column2: The Role         The Ideal Candidate         The Senior Manager will contribute to the success of the business by implementing and executing short and long term strategies, policies and programs to support organizational objectives.      Leading a small team, the role will build relationships with executives, becoming a trusted advisor and facilitator of change.     Continuing the development of an employee-oriented company culture that emphasizes quality, continuous improvement, team work, and high performance     Working with key stakeholders to deliver on transformational business strategies to enhance the success through new and innovating HR ideas.     Partnering with leaders to ensure talent acquisition is in line with organizational goals.      Lead compensation planning and salary reviews, recommending strategies for continuous improvement.     Overseeing the learning and development needs of the organization and presenting training options for employees.     Facilitating succession planning and ensuring participation in performance management programs from management.     3+ years of HR experience in a complex, unionized environment.     Excellent Communication (verbal and written) with good analytical skills. Confident talking over the phone/Skype with North American clients.     Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools with an emphasis on Word and Excel.     Sound technical knowledge and experience as an HR Leader or Business Partner with a proven track record of managing a team, ideally in multiple locations.     Skilled in examining and re-engineering operations and procedures, formulating policy, and developing and implementing HR initiatives.     Solid negotiation and influencing abilities, coupled with strong project management skills.     Strong business acumen to align both business objectives and HR strategies with corporate goals.     Strong diagnostic skills followed by good ability to evaluate options/alternatives and develop recommendations for solutions to complex and multi-dimensional issues.     Adept at building and managing relationships effectively and be able to gain the confidence of business leaders quickly.     Tenacity, resourceful, flexible and adaptable.

column2: Brief Role :  Urgent Opening for "HR Manager  Exp. Req. 9 -  11 yrs;   Job Description    PURPOSE    Provide support and guidance to less experienced members of the HR team in their day- to- day operational roles.	 Support the continuous improvement of the HR function through development and implementation of HR programs in	 An assigned geography or business line. With limited guidance,  provide comprehensive HR support to employees and	 Management across assigned service areas,  business units,  or departments. As HR Business Partner,  with guidance, 	 Provide expertise,  support and advice to assigned management teams either locally,  regionally,  globally or by function. RESPONSIBILITIES    Develop strong and effective team relationships with HR specialist functions/ Centers of Excellence,  e.g.,  HRPSC, 	 Finance PSC.	 Maintain and develop local HR policies regarding employment legislation,  HR systems,  practices,  procedures and	 Compliance as required to ensure risk of litigation is mitigated and staff,  company and customer interests are	 Maintained.	 Provide advice and guidance to more junior members of the HR team as appropriate.	 Lead specific projects and support the day- to- day development and implementation of redesign and new local and	 Global HR initiatives.	 Provide HR Partnering management coaching and counseling.	 Act as Business Partner to assigned business areas and ensure that HR delivery adds value to the business.	 Provide input and assist in or lead efforts associated with change management efforts involving reorganizations,  mergers/ acquisitions and transfers to ensure compliance to local legislation.	 - Provide reports and analyses as requested by senior management.	 Support line managers in the recruitment and selection process where appropriate.	 Provide advice and guidance on all aspects related to people management,  absenteeism,  workforce planning, 	 Talent development and management,  etc.	 All responsibilities are essential job functions unless noted as nonessential (N). REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE,  SKILLS AND ABILITIES    Sound knowledge of local and relevant employment legislation	 Expert coaching and counseling skills	 Excellent problem- solving with sound judgment and decision- making skills	 Excellent presentation skills	 Effective leadership skills	 Good ability to work in a matrix environment	 Good computer skills,  including Microsoft Office applications and HRIS applications	 Organization and project management skills in leading a project	 Effective influencing skills	 Strong verbal and written communication skills and very good interpersonal skills.	 Very high degree of discretion and confidentiality	 Good attention to detail	 Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with coworkers,  managers and clients MINIMUM REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE    Bachelor's degree or educational equivalent and 6 years experience within an HR function as a generalist or	 combination of generalist and specialist experience including experience operating with senior/  executive	 management teams; or equivalent combination of education,  training and experience	 Professional HR accreditation. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS    Extensive use of telephone and face- to- face communication requiring accurate perception of speech or the use of other	 communication systems such as email or instant communicator	 Extensive use of keyboard requiring repetitive motion of fingers or other equipment such as voice recognition software	 that will provide access to electronic data	 Regular sitting for extended periods of time	 Occasional travel  Salary: AS PER Norms Industry:Pharma /  Biotech /  Clinical Research Functional Area:HR ,  Recruitment ,  Administration ,  IR Role Category:HR/  Recruitment /  IR Role:HR Business Partner   Desired Candidate Profile  Please refer to the Job description above

column2: Job Description :    The L&D Lead is responsible for planning,  organising,  budgeting and conducting training and development programmes including developing content,  facilitating training programmes and evaluating their effectiveness across the Firm in accordance with its requirements at the corporate level    Develop long- term strategic and annual operating plans for L&D programmes   Regularly create and update L&D policies and procedures,  and evaluate the most effective,  cost- efficient way to deliver relevant training modules across the Firm   Identify training needs based on upcoming projects,  processes and business strategy; conduct robust learning need analysis; and roll out need- based,  role- based learning journeys with automated tools   Operate as an internal consultant to the business/ management in identifying,  developing and implementing training solutions with business relevance and impact    Plan and prioritise competency- driven organisational interventions   Develop and organise training manuals,  multimedia visual aids and other informative materials; encourage blended learning by facilitating e- learning,  webinars,  classroom programmes,  book reading,  one- on- one and group coaching,  peer discussions,  and assessment centres   Design effective in- house and third- party L&D programmes to develop and coach across levels,  to drive the highest level of employee engagement and performance excellence   Establish outreach and partnerships with other organisations,  institutions and knowledge providers (consultants,  assessment providers,  colleges,  universities,  etc.) and coordinate training courses with these organisations/ providers   Research industry trends,  new technologies,  concepts and techniques to update the current training curriculum    Establish,  implement and monitor all appropriate performance metrics for learning and development    Develop and implement methods to evaluate the effectiveness and delivery of training modules,  and modify programmes based on feedback   Support the HR and leadership teams in strategic projects that revolve around OD,  OE,  employee survey,  development of succession plan and talent pipeline,  and external awards and felicitations   Prepare the training budget and calendar as per the Firm s requirement,  and generate reports   Skills   10+ years of experience in L&D and leadership development programmes in a corporate environment   Knowledge and experience in building and delivering training curriculum    Experience in conducting needs assessments and performance gap analyses   Strong communication skills including verbal,  written,  presentation and active listening,  and group facilitation   Knowledge of training and developing practice and methods,  including needs assessment and/ or instructional design   Strong project management skills and demonstrated capability   Skill and ability to create,  facilitate and conduct instructor- led and/ or virtual training sessions; knowledge and ability to provide performance coaching and consulting   Master s or Post Graduate diploma or a certification in L&D,  Human Resources,  Organisational Development or related discipline

column2: The GSM HR Analyst manages all aspects of data and analytics in support of Human Resources service delivery processes for the Global Supply Management function. This includes managing data entry/editing, position management and reporting/analytics for all core HR processes. The HR Analyst will also lead initiatives related to HR metrics. This role requires a process-minded team player with a bias for action and strong attention to detail.                    Role Purpose:                      Manages end-user HRIS, position management, and data reporting/analytics processes for business unit human resources.                  Ensures and assists in implementation/administration of HR programs / processes / policies establishing and reinforcing Corning Values and positive work environment, while complying with all legal and regulatory requirements                  Ensures HR key stakeholders fully understand the value, benefit, and use of HR tools / programs / processes / policies.                  Manages/ensures standards and guidelines are understood and consistently applied                  Ensures HR programs / processes / policies meet or beat quality and delivery expectations                  Responsible for execution thru finalization of hiring processes including salary offers, etc.                  Identifies employee value proposition issues affecting turnover and works with HR manager to identify actions for improvement                      Responsibilities (Key tasks and activities associated with achieving primary accountabilities):                     Maintains and ensures confidentiality of time and personnel sensitive materials                  Maintains and develops reports and analysis tools, ensures timely updates, and provides organization and distribution of reports for use by human resources managers and business leadership (Monthly HC report, annual process reports (ASR, PIP, Rex, LTI, GS etc.)                  True Blue position management associated with various processes (new hires, org change, hiring)                  Monitors and maintains integrity of data contained in HR systems for which he/she is responsible. Data audits associated with various processes (CFS codes, GS Codes, PIP codes etc.)                  Gathers and analyzes data on the performance and impact of HR programs / processes / policies, highlights areas of concern or improvement, and creates reports and presentations as requested to ensure achievement of targeted results                  Develops and maintains subject matter expertise through independent research and participation in company / professional groups (Data Steward CoP)                  Educates colleagues and customer groups on proper use of HR systems for which he/she is responsible Provide appropriate support to the HR team and business clients concerning data.                  Understanding of the configuration changes and impact to the group.                  Global Coordinator for Trainings Project Work:                  As per the requirement of the HR goals.            Bachelor s Degree (in relevant field) with 2-5 years of relevant experience or equivalent                  Computer Proficiency (SuccessFactor, Word, Excel, Access, Power BI, PowerPoint, column2: The Senior Compensation Analyst will be instrumental in designing and managing competitive compensation programs that attract and retain top talent, while aligning with our organizations strategic objectives      This role involves conducting market research and analysis to inform our compensation strategies, ensuring our offerings are equitable, competitive, and compliant with regulatory standards      Additionally, the Senior Compensation Analyst will play a key role in ad-hoc compensation projects, with a focus towards optimizing and refining the existing compensation structures to support organizational growth and efficiency          What You ll Do:          Conduct comprehensive market research and analysis to ensure competitive and equitable compensation structures.          Utilize sound logic and empathy to offer guidance and influence decision-making processes for stakeholders across the organization.          Refine and maintain compensation programs, including salary bands, incentive plans, and equity options while collaborating with stakeholders.          Ensure compliance with all India regional regulatory standards and internal policies related to compensation and benefits.          Collaborate with People team and departmental leaders to align compensation strategies with organizational goals and employee performance metrics.          Provide expert advice and guidance on compensation matters to senior management and People teams. column2: Role & responsibilities     About Profile: An HR Ops professional is required to streamline the ongoing and upcoming HR processes and get involved in day-to-day HR tasks and operations. The professional will be required to maintain a regular connection with all the employees and device mechanism to deal with daily employee issues.  Responsibilities:   Supporting the effective and scoping and design of HR projects/initiatives to ensure clear, achievable and impactful plans that can then be implemented with discipline and which solve business problems or realize opportunities  Co-work on HR strategic initiatives across the network, collaborating with multiple functions and teams to drive progress and success against company objectives.  Collaborate with the HR team to design, develop, and implement people programs, including but not limited to employee onboarding, candidate experience, employee engagement initiatives.  Delivering and accelerating our people roadmap at network level post pandemic, focusing on future of work including hybrid work model strategies and other such people practices.  Manage the onboarding process for new hires, ensuring a smooth transition and positive induction into the organization.  Driving harmonization and standardization of key HR processes, starting with talent acquisition.  Establishing a framework for HR innovation centered around experience design, process design and continuous improvement/ automation opportunities.  Stay informed about industry best practices and trends to continually enhance and evolve our people programs.  Collaborating with global and local stakeholders to ensure the delivery of key project milestones on time and within budget, resource, and guidelines.  Facilitating planning, progress tracking, communication and reporting for company strategic initiatives. Establishing and monitoring plans and ensuring the realization of goals and continuous improvements. Preferred candidate profile     MBA from an institute of repute with 3-4 years of experience in designing or implementing strategic HR programs leading to strong business/ people results.  Track record of organizing, planning and successfully managing both long-term and short-term initiatives in a fast-moving, fast-growing, and dynamic company. Understanding of project management techniques and tools.  Ability to conduct extensive research of HR programs across industries and use market insights, workforce data, and stakeholder/ employee voice. Demonstrated eye for detail, problem solving, presentation, communication and follow-through skills.  Perks and benefits   Flexible Working Hours  Learn and earn opportunities  Positive Work Environment  Opportunity to work On-site  Rewards and Recognitions

column2: Conducting Inductions   : This involves welcoming new employees to the organization and providing them with necessary information, training, and resources to integrate them into the company culture and their roles effectively. Good command on works   : This might refer to having a strong understanding and competency in the tasks and responsibilities associated with the role, such as administrative duties, project management, or other specific job functions.       Excellent in drafting mails   : Communication is key in any workplace. Event Planning   : This involves organizing various events, such as team-building activities, corporate meetings, conferences, or social gatherings. Employee Engagement   : Fostering a positive work environment and ensuring that employees feel valued and motivated is essential for productivity and retention. Working on Fun or Festival or events activities in Office   : This could involve organizing activities or celebrations within the office to boost morale, celebrate achievements, or mark special occasions such as holidays or team milestones. column2: The Senior Compensation Analyst will be instrumental in designing and managing competitive compensation programs that attract and retain top talent, while aligning with our organizations strategic objectives      This role involves conducting market research and analysis to inform our compensation strategies, ensuring our offerings are equitable, competitive, and compliant with regulatory standards      Additionally, the Senior Compensation Analyst will play a key role in ad-hoc compensation projects, with a focus towards optimizing and refining the existing compensation structures to support organizational growth and efficiency                  What you'll Do:          Conduct comprehensive market research and analysis to ensure competitive and equitable compensation structures. Collaborate with People team and departmental leaders to align compensation strategies with organizational goals and employee performance metrics.      Provide expert advice and guidance on compensation matters to senior management and People teams.      Educate, inform, and guide leaders and stakeholders throughout the organization on compensation practices and processes.      Manage salary surveys and participate in external compensation benchmarking studies to stay informed of industry standards.      Analyze internal pay practices and trends to identify disparities and recommend adjustments.      Support the People team in annual compensation review processes, including merit increases and bonus allocations.      Contribute to due diligence and integration efforts related to mergers and acquisitions from a compensation perspective. column2: We are seeking a motivated and organized HR individual to join our dynamic HR team. In this entry-level position, you will be responsible for managing and coordinating various HR-related projects, acting as the central point of contact (POC) for project stakeholders, and providing essential support to our HR leadership, including the Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO). Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project objectives, deliverables, and timelines.              Develop and maintain project documentation, including project plans, status reports, and risk assessments.                Stakeholder Engagement:                Act as the primary point of contact for HR programs/project stakeholders, including HR team members, department heads, and external partners.              Foster strong relationships with stakeholders to ensure clear communication and project alignment.                Data Analysis:                Collect and analyze HR-related data to support decision-making and measure project outcomes.              Prepare reports and presentations to convey project progress and findings to leadership.                Compliance and Best Practices:                Stay up-to-date with HR regulations and best practices to ensure project compliance.              Collaborate with HR team members to implement industry-leading HR practices in projects.                Administrative Support:                Assist the CHRO and HR leadership in day-to-day administrative tasks, including scheduling meetings, preparing materials, and managing calendars.                  Qualifications:                Bachelor's/Masters degree in HR, Business Administration, or related field.              1-3 years of experience in HR, program management, or a related role.              Strong organizational and project management skills.              Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.              Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite              Attention to detail and ability to multitask effectively.                Preferred Qualifications:                    HR certifications (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR).              Experience with HRIS or HR-related software systems.              Knowledge of agile project management methodologies.

column2: Recruitment Support: Assist in the recruitment process by posting job openings, reviewing resumes, conducting initial candidate screenings, and coordinating interviews. Candidate Experience: Provide a positive candidate experience by communicating with candidates, scheduling interviews, and ensuring timely responses to inquiries. Onboarding Assistance: Support the onboarding process for new hires by coordinating paperwork, conducting orientation, and helping them acclimate to the organization. Data Management: Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate and employee records in the applicant tracking system (ATS) and HR databases. Compliance: Ensure that all recruitment and onboarding practices comply with legal and regulatory requirements, including equal employment opportunity (EEO) laws. Job Descriptions: Assist in creating and updating job descriptions and role profiles to align with organizational needs and expectations. Talent Pipelining: Help build and maintain a talent pipeline by sourcing candidates, attending job fairs, and conducting outreach to potential hires. Reporting: Provide regular reports and data analysis on recruitment and onboarding metrics to HR teams and management. HR Documentation: Assist in the preparation of HR documentation, such as offer letters, contracts, and employee handbooks.

Compliance: Ensure that all recruitment and onboarding practices comply with legal and regulatory requirements, including equal employment opportunity (EEO) laws. Job Descriptions: Assist in creating and updating job descriptions and role profiles to align with organizational needs and expectations. Talent Pipelining: Help build and maintain a talent pipeline by sourcing candidates, attending job fairs, and conducting outreach to potential hires. Reporting: Provide regular reports and data analysis on recruitment and onboarding metrics to HR teams and management. HR Documentation: Assist in the preparation of HR documentation, such as offer letters, contracts, and employee handbooks.

column2: The Senior Compensation Analyst will be instrumental in designing and managing competitive compensation programs that attract and retain top talent, while aligning with our organizations strategic objectives      This role involves conducting market research and analysis to inform our compensation strategies, ensuring our offerings are equitable, competitive, and compliant with regulatory standards      Additionally, the Senior Compensation Analyst will play a key role in ad-hoc compensation projects, with a focus towards optimizing and refining the existing compensation structures to support organizational growth and efficiency                  What you'll Do:          Conduct comprehensive market research and analysis to ensure competitive and equitable compensation structures.      Utilize sound logic and empathy to offer guidance and influence decision-making processes for stakeholders across the organization.      Refine and maintain compensation programs, including salary bands, incentive plans, and equity options while collaborating with stakeholders.      Ensure compliance with all India regional regulatory standards and internal policies related to compensation and benefits.      Collaborate with People team and departmental leaders to align compensation strategies with organizational goals and employee performance metrics.      Provide expert advice and guidance on compensation matters to senior management and People teams.      Educate, inform, and guide leaders and stakeholders throughout the organization on compensation practices and processes.      Manage salary surveys and participate in external compensation benchmarking studies to stay informed of industry standards.      Analyze internal pay practices and trends to identify disparities and recommend adjustments.      Support the People team in annual compensation review processes, including merit increases and bonus allocations.      Contribute to due diligence and integration efforts related to mergers and acquisitions from a compensation perspective.                  Who You Are:          5+ years of experience in progressive compensation & operations roles      Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Math, Data Analytics or a related field      Experience supporting M&A processes      Experience in employee compensation programs and compliance at global companies          Systems experience is a plus, but not mandatory:          Workday, specifically Workday Advanced Compensation      Radford market data      Carta equity administration and/or market data          Meticulous attention to detail coupled with outstanding analytical and creative problem-solving abilities      Strong communication and project management skills, with a track record of successful cross-departmental collaboration and engagement with stakeholders      Skilled in balancing and prioritizing multiple demands and requests effectively      Capable of adapting and applying concepts to new contexts and broader frameworks

column2: We are seeking a highly motivated and tech-savvy individual to join our team as an HR & Operations Intern. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain practical experience in the areas of human resources, operations, and technology. The ideal candidate should possess a strong interest in HR and operations, along with a solid foundation in various tech tools and software applications. This role will involve working closely with the HR and operations teams to support their day-to-day activities, including managing company processes, communications and creating professional write-ups and presentations.       Responsibilities         Managing the employee lifecycle, including recruitment, onboarding, training, and offboarding processes.     Support the HR team in maintaining employee records, updating databases, and ensuring data accuracy and confidentiality.     Coordinate and schedule interviews, meetings, and training sessions using online scheduling platforms.     Assist in the implementation and administration of HR programs and policies.     Contribute to the development and maintenance of HR-related documents, such as job descriptions, policies, and procedures.     Conduct research on industry best practices and assist in developing innovative HR and operational solutions.     Collaborate with the operations team to streamline processes and enhance efficiency using technology.     Assist in managing the company accounts email, including responding to inquiries, forwarding messages, and maintaining email correspondence.     Create professional write-ups, such as business emails, memos, and reports, ensuring accuracy, clarity, and professional tone.     Support the creation of presentations and other visual materials for internal and external stakeholders, utilizing software tools for design and formatting.     Assist in the implementation and maintenance of various operational systems, such as project management tools, CRM software, and time-tracking systems.     Generate reports and analyze data using spreadsheet software to provide insights and support decision-making.     Stay updated with emerging HR and operational technologies, recommending and implementing improvements as appropriate.         Requirements         A bachelor s degree in Information Technology or Computer Science is preferred; however, candidates with other relevant degrees are also encouraged to apply.     Proficient in using technology tools, including Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and Google Suite.     Excellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize effectively.     Strong attention to detail and commitment to maintaining data accuracy.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.     Analytical mindset and the ability to analyze data, draw insights, and present findings.     Proactive and self-motivated, with a willingness to learn and take on new challenges.     Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.         Perks and Incentives       We offer a comprehensive package of perks and incentives to make your experience as an HR & Operations Intern even more rewarding.        In addition to valuable hands-on experience and professional growth opportunities, we provide the following:         Competitive Compensation: We offer a competitive stipend or compensation package that recognizes your skills, contributions, and commitment to the role.     Recognition and Rewards: Outstanding performance and achievements are recognized and rewarded through various programs, including performance-based incentives, employee appreciation events, and public acknowledgment.     Learning and Development: As an intern, you will have access to various training programs, workshops, and resources to enhance your skills and knowledge in HR, operations, and technology.     Mentorship and Guidance: You will have the opportunity to work closely with experienced professionals who will serve as mentors, providing guidance and support throughout your internship journey.     Networking Opportunities: We encourage networking and provide opportunities to connect with professionals across departments and even industry experts. Building these relationships can be invaluable for your future career.     Flexible Work Schedule: We understand the importance of work-life balance. While meeting your responsibilities, we offer flexibility in terms of working hours or remote work arrangements when possible.     Potential for Long-Term Opportunities: Exceptional interns may have the opportunity to be considered for full-time positions or future roles within the company upon successful completion of the internship

column2: Purpose          The Maersk Global Service Centres are spread across 5 sites with over 9500 employees. The GSC organization is responsible for facilitating executing off- shoring primarily for Maersk Line,  however also covering all other Business Units of the APMM Group. The GSC organization has been successful in doubling its size over the past 2 years whilst at the same time improving the satisfaction as well as processes of its business partners.          In light of the expected continued growth in terms of both headcount and process scope for the GSC in the coming years,  we have made changes to the GSC organization design. The new structure is a process based,  delivery focused organization called GSC 2.0 and will come into effect on 1st of August 2011.          One of the new roles designed in support this is the Liner Global Delivery BPI Manager for the Customer Service Process based out of Chennai,  who will be responsible for facilitating performance management,  driving standardization of the Customer Service processes and managing the improvement agenda within scope of the Customer Service Delivery portfolio.          The Role:      The GSC Customer Service Global Delivery BPI Manager is responsible for facilitating effective process management,  standardization and continuous improvement of the Customer Service processes,  including all aspects of the delivery system.      Key Responsibilities would be to:          Take charge of the process improvement agenda for Customer Service delivery organization          Guide improvement initiatives providing E2E benefits (e.g. avoid improvements for the sake of improvement)          Lead projects assigned to Customer Service Delivery BPI by performing program/project portfolio management and thereby avoiding duplication of efforts between sites          Drive replication of best practices and improvement projects across sites and Customer Service processes          Drive standardization of operational practices across sites and Customer Service processes (e.g. operations management,  performance management,  visual management systems)          Establish and overview process standardization and governance of process variants          Facilitate business performance management of Customer Service Delivery processes          Overview and secure business continuity measures are in place and contingency plans tested regularly          Closely working with the Customer Service Business Development BPI team,  facilitating the coordination between the site process teams. Closely coordinate and cooperate with the Customer Service Site BPI teams which in turn take the lead on implementing global solutions,  driving continuous improvement in Gemba,  safeguarding business continuity and providing coaching and learning to the teams in the sites          Act as sparring partner for the process delivery leads in the sites          Be an active member of the Customer Service Delivery leadership team,  jointly setting the strategy,  objectives and the overall improvement agenda for Customer Service Delivery          Lead a small virtual team with 1- 2 team members per GSC site,  including people leadership,  talent development and performance management aspects.          Profile Specification          Graduate,  preferably with a strong technical background/aptitude to facilitate the understanding of how Process Excellence can be used to meet specific business needs          Minimum of 8- 10 years of management experience,  preferable in the Customer Service activities.          Deep understanding of the ML business system and process hierarchy          Experience of working in a senior position in a corporate or LOC/Cluster/GSC Operations organization.          Strong change management skills,  envisioning and overcoming obstacles while ensuring benefits are realized          Proven strong communication skills ensuring clear,  direct and appropriate communication at multiple organizational levels and working across different cultures          Project Management Certification or Six Sigma Black Belt Certification is an advantage          Personal Skills:          High Analytical / problem- solving skills          Drives for results and success,  conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure          Visionary,  innovative and dynamic          Ability to influence without formal authority          Good interpersonal Skills        Complaince Analyst -  Mumbai -  Asset Management Company      HR Business Partner Kerela Deputy Manager/ Manager level      Manager -  Corporate Finance -  Oman      Multiple Requiremnets Location -  Kotak Bank      Operation Executives and Team Leader      Regional HR Mgr -  Chennai      Relationship Manager -  HDFC Bank -  Chennai      Sales HR Head -  South      Site Office Manager      Total Rewards JD (India) -  Templeton      VP -  Finance and Corporate Controller-  Chennai      1.Prepare and organize all of your notes,  research,  questions,  and interview responses ahead of time. Make sure everything is at your fingertips and that you know right where everything is located.    Branch Head -  HDFC Bank    Locations : Anantapur,  Guntakal..    Salary: 6 9 Lpa + Benefits..    Requirements:    At least 5 year(s) of working experience..    Sales / Marketing skills..

column1: HR Ventures & Acquisition Associate Manager ??????DE Capability
column2: Skill required:  Venures & Acquisition - Talent Management Designation:  HR Ventures & Acquisition Assoc Manager Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 10 to 14 years  What would you do? The HR Solution Architect team partner with our deal teams across Accenture's acquisitions to design solutions across all core components of HR people programmes and processes, to enable the integration of our acquisitions. The team support the end-to-end deal lifecycle, from assessment of an acquisition in diligence, through to designing and implementing solutions to enable the integration of the business. The team has a high executive presence, working closely with acquisitions HR Deal Leads, business sponsors and acquired leadership, alongside reviewing and agreeing solutions with internal stakeholders. What are we looking for? The HR Solution Architect will be assigned to various M&A projects and will be accountable for the success, effectiveness, and on-time delivery of HR due diligence and integration work stream activities.Core Skills &  Qualifications Knowledge across HR & People Programmes -Deep experience across broad range of HR programmes, incl. managing change programmes  Strong analytics/analytical skills (including strong Excel experience)- Able to identify and realize actions based on insight and trends  Total Rewards Experience (Compensation, Equity, Benefits, etc)- Deep experience in designing and developing new reward programmes  Presentation skills (including strong PowerPoint skills)- Able to manage presentations to senior leaders  Highly effective stakeholder and relationship management skills - Holds deep and trusted relationships across a range of senior leaders  Strong project management, leadership/facilitation of all levels of people inside and outside of your organizations-Manages complex programmes and deliverables across multiple projects Risk identification, analysis and management, with previous experience of solution development or escalation.-Ability to identify risk, articulate to stakeholders and walk through mitigations Understanding of HR systems (e.g. HR ERP systems, Performance Management tools)- Understanding of HR tools and how they integrate, and support people processes. Knowledge of HR tech innovation and change programmes. Financial Exposure and commercial awareness-Comprehensive understanding of investment cases and impact of people outcomes to financial results.  Roles and Responsibilities:  Key ResponsibilitiesDue Diligence Phase (includes solution development)-- Define and manage due diligence data validation approach and processes Apply judgement to assess and highlight talent trends and risks, present findings, and influence decisions and integration strategies. Partner with Global and MU HR teams to develop solutions(e.g. TR CoE ,Service Career Arch) Estimate costs for full integration of an acquisition into Accenture. Coordinate across all key stakeholder groups, in particular heavy interaction is expected with Finance and Legal as well as Corporate Development professionals Develop preliminary solution plan for key human resource decisions, including but not limited to compensation, benefits, perquisites, retirement/pension plans, payroll and career/reward architecture, incentives (short-term, long-term, sales force-specific, deferred), culture, HR compliance and policies.  Build strong internal relationships and collaborate with stakeholders to develop preliminary integration recommendations (e.g. Global and local Total Rewards leads, Global Talent Architecture, local HR Business Partners and stakeholders). Drive the development of leadership compensation, Performance and Retention plans and recommendations for acquired workforce. Integration Phase-- Plan and drive HR integration planning and execution activities for each V&A deal Partnering with the broader deal team and internal stakeholders to develop a compelling employee journey in terms of all aspects of talent and people processes and activities; building upon previous solutions and an understanding local HR context.  Develop and deliver integration solutions across a range of key HR processes and critical areas (including career architecture, total reward and performance, HR technology, and people policies).  Participate in solution conversations with acquired leadership including HR and CXO group through the PMI cycle Leverage insight and analysis to shape key integration decisions, supporting the understanding of relevant commercial and talent impacts  Project manage the end-to-end onboarding process for acquired employees; collaborating with other parts of HR Operations & local/global HR to ensure a successful new joiner experience.  Capture learnings and knowledge from the integration journey, sharing this across stakeholders and retaining experience for future acquisitions.

column2: HR Service Delivery Specialist: Job  Summary : Work with the DTE recruiting teams to drive the recruiting risk and compliance agenda for India GU Drive effective implementation of process and technology changes to bring the required impact on recruiting compliance. Identify existing / potential risks and link Process, Technology and People to mitigate / eliminate the risks Ensure the stakeholders are informed, integrated and enabled. Act as the SME to the recruiting and HRSS teams, applying deep expertise and knowledge on recruiting policies and processes. Key Responsibilities: Track and ensure closure of all recruiting related actions identified through internal and external reviews / audits. Conduct a periodic review of all recruiting manuals and review responsibilities and accountability defined in entity recruiting and HRSS manuals to identify conflicting roles, responsibilities and access between these teams. Carry out checks of all recruiting processes across entities, by process, by team and by city. Conduct Self-Checks of recruiting controls and processes to proactively identify vulnerabilities by partnering with entity teams Regularly attend hiring events across entities to understand how the process is being executed. Report concerns or anomalies, if any, to the relevant recruiting lead. Partner with the relevant teams to review any new process and technology change that is being driven in entity / HRSS recruitment teams from risk perspective. Conduct review post introduction of new process and technology changes to assess awareness and effectiveness of implementation. Work with the AEE Risk and Compliance team to conduct periodic forensic analytics of recruitment data. Analyze candidate escalation data to identify potential issues and share with RPT (Recruiting Process & Technology) and delivery teams to fix. Fraud escalations- work with CI and ER to understand the process and technology fixes required and bring to RPT and delivery teams to design and execute. Partner with the concerned internal teams to carry out regular access rights reviews to hiring tools in HRSS and entity teams. Publish regular reports on themes and action plans for closure to HR leadership Qualification Skill requirements: Must have recruiting process expertise and in-depth knowledge of the policies Must be excellent in stakeholder management and highly collaborative Must have compliance / audit outlook Good in Program Management Must have problem solving and analytical skills Strong verbal & written communication skills

While M&A and global expansion experience is not required,  experience managing projects and competing priorities is strongly preferred. Our team works in a fast- paced,  global environment and someone who thrives working on high- profile projects and is comfortable adapting to a wide range of customers and business priorities would be a good fit for the role.       Responsibilities Include:      Perform hands on project management such as development of project plans,  scheduling and planning,  monitoring and status reporting against planned deliverables,  benefits and milestones,  resource and program tracking,  development and management of risk,  issue and action logs.    Build and maintain successful partnerships with global HR Services teams,  HR stakeholders and key business sponsors across the Americas,  EMEA,  and APAC.    As required,  partner with external vendors/ parties to ensure teams are engaged and effectively utilizing the best tools available.    Proactively identifies solutions to meet business objectives,  taking into account the implications of change on the organization and all stakeholders.    Using own initiative to develop or improve project management processes and tools. Ensure project tools,  best practices and lessons learned are documented.    Ensure smooth project execution of acquired companies and expansion projects by monitoring and auditing key tasks across HR work streams,  including employee data integrity.    Help to build the HR Services M&A /  Expansion program at Amazon by identifying ways to improve the employee or customer experience -  via automation,  simplification or other types of process improvement; partnering cross- functionally to influence and implement change.    Support on- going efforts to enhance our capabilities through training,  development and program improvements. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS   Bachelor s degree a minimum  5 years of relevant program/ project management experience,  preferably in HR  High level of proficiency in MS Office,  Excel this will be an essential tool for accomplishing many tasks and deliverables  Bias for action,  excellent attention to detail and relentless commitment to follow- through  Ability to multi- task and handle various projects simultaneously to drive timely results  Ability to prioritize effectively and facilitate action across remote groups  Ability to convey ideas and recommendations in a clear,  compelling and succinct way in written and verbal communications  Ability to communicate and influence effectively with a wide variety of audiences -  technical and business clients,  HR functions,  and all levels of employees  Ability to travel as needed    PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS   Experience as an HR Business Partner and/ or with M&A integration  Certified Project Mgmt/ Program Mgmt credentials  Demonstrated expertise in process management- Six Sigma/ green belt certification preferred  Experience leading global program initiatives and/ or process improvement efforts  Experience within core central HR specialist functions: e.g.

column2: The Senior Compensation Analyst will be instrumental in designing and managing competitive compensation programs that attract and retain top talent, while aligning with our organizations strategic objectives      This role involves conducting market research and analysis to inform our compensation strategies, ensuring our offerings are equitable, competitive, and compliant with regulatory standards      Additionally, the Senior Compensation Analyst will play a key role in ad-hoc compensation projects, with a focus towards optimizing and refining the existing compensation structures to support organizational growth and efficiency          What You ll Do:          Conduct comprehensive market research and analysis to ensure competitive and equitable compensation structures.          Utilize sound logic and empathy to offer guidance and influence decision-making processes for stakeholders across the organization.          Refine and maintain compensation programs, including salary bands, incentive plans, and equity options while collaborating with stakeholders.          Ensure compliance with all India regional regulatory standards and internal policies related to compensation and benefits.          Collaborate with People team and departmental leaders to align compensation strategies with organizational goals and employee performance metrics.          Provide expert advice and guidance on compensation matters to senior management and People teams.          Educate, inform, and guide leaders and stakeholders throughout the organization on compensation practices and processes.          Manage salary surveys and participate in external compensation benchmarking studies to stay informed of industry standards.          Analyze internal pay practices and trends to identify disparities and recommend adjustments.          Support the People team in annual compensation review processes, including merit increases and bonus allocations.          Contribute to due diligence and integration efforts related to mergers and acquisitions from a compensation perspective.          Who You Are:          5+ years of experience in progressive compensation & operations roles          Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Math, Data Analytics or a related field          Experience supporting M&A processes          Experience in employee compensation programs and compliance at global companies          Systems experience is a plus, but not mandatory:          Workday, specifically Workday Advanced Compensation          Radford market data          Carta equity administration and/or market data          Meticulous attention to detail coupled with outstanding analytical and creative problem-solving abilities          Strong communication and project management skills, with a track record of successful cross-departmental collaboration and engagement with stakeholders          Skilled in balancing and prioritizing multiple demands and requests effectively          Capable of adapting and applying concepts to new contexts and broader frameworks

column2: As a Senior Associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. Delegate to others to provide stretch opportunities, coaching them to deliver results.     Demonstrate critical thinking and the ability to bring order to unstructured problems.     Use a broad range of tools and techniques to extract insights from current industry or sector trends.     Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance.     Know how and when to use tools available for a given situation and can explain the reasons for this choice.     Seek and embrace opportunities which give exposure to different situations, environments and perspectives.     Use straightforward communication, in a structured way, when influencing and connecting with others.     Able to read situations and modify behavior to build quality relationships.     Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.                                       We are seeking an experienced and result-oriented Workforce Management professional with a strong understanding of the WFM life cycle including demand forecasting, capacity planning, deployment and work allocation     We are looking for dynamic professionals who can work with the business to predict future demand projections and create capacity to assign best-fit staffing on projects     The candidate will be responsible to assess the ongoing demand and capacity, determine personnel requirements based on staffing rules and regulatory compliance guidelines and collaborating on resource management with multiple teams within our organization     As a Deployment Senior Associate, you will be responsible and accountable to meet resource management KPIs for the assigned Business Unit, Sub- Business Unit, Industry/Sector or territory.      You will provide subject matter support to stakeholders, build creative staffing solutions and mitigate over/under staffing situations.      You will also be responsible to train and mentor your team members.     To ensure success as a Deployment Senior Associate, you should possess extensive domain knowledge in resource management, demand - supply planning, schedule management, capacity and headcount planning, bench management, deployment, resource allocation and business analytics.     Prior resource management experience in Big 4s, Audit/Tax/accounting practice and/or financial services industry will be preferred.             Key Responsibilities:         Review demand pipeline and generate capacity to enable effective staffing on projects based on scope of work, skills, prior experience, availability, regulatory requirements and project budget.     Maintain a proactive view of demand pipeline and headcount projections to minimize over/under staffing scenarios.     Create an implement an effective annual staffing portfolio considering client complexities, scope of work, business rules and regulatory requirements.     Act as a control owner to ensure 100% compliance on all regulatory requirements and business rules associated with resource allocations and staffing on projects.     Demonstrate success against all business, operational and people     management KPIs.     Drive continuous improvement, process transformation and automation to create measurable efficiencies within the team.     Monitor schedule adherence, address schedule changes and resolve staffing conflicts.     Minimize staffing gaps, reduce non billable time and optimize staffing   during busy periods.     Analyze and execute staffing solutions to meet unplanned demands.     Publish effective reports and dashboards to monitor, analyze and report against key KPIs.     Participate in business meetings, stakeholder connects and deployment   reviews.     Perform regular reviews to ensure quality of delivery.             Key      Skills and Experiences:         Any Graduate/Post-Graduate.     5 - 7 years of relevant, post qualification work experience in reputed     organizations with a proven track record of career growth and stability.     Proficiency in resource management/workforce management domain.     Must have at least 2 years of experience in managing stakeholders.     Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.     Excellent negotiation skills.     Exceptional organizational and time-management skills with a proven     record of working under tight deadlines.     Strong ability to analyze data, identify trends and projections to draw     intelligent inferences will be a key success factor.     Strong working knowledge of MS Excel and MS PowerPoint. The incumbent     should have very good understanding of Excel functionalities, Pivot tables,     Charts, formulae, Lookup functions and Power Pivot.     Working knowledge of Alteryx and Power BI will be preferred.

column2: Role   Title:   HR   Lead  (Dy Manager/Manager) Locations : Haldwani, Kausani, Orakhan, Letibunga in the Kumaon region of Uttarakhand.  Type : Full-time, 6 day week 1.   Background :  BPO, being a people intensive business, Human Resource Management plays a key role in having an engaged, involved and motivated team; and in a social enterprise model in a rural setting, keeping a balance of focus on business goals and yet retaining social essence of the objectives of the organization is critical. As a key member of local leadership team in Uttarakhand, to lead and implement Organizations vision, policies and culture; be the face of the organization locally, work closely with leaders in different functions, and individuals in teams in various locations; to be accessible and available as a support point to an individual in any team. 2. Key Areas of Responsibilities for the role: a.  Recruitment / Hiring  ??aking complete ownership of planning and recruitment cycle as per business plans. This would include managing end-to-end hiring chain (sourcing, background verification, on-boarding, induction etc.) b.  Performance Management:  Administer performance management program to ensure effectiveness and equity within organization in a transparent and fair manner. c.  Employee Benefit Program Management:  manage & administer benefit programs like Rewards & Recognition, Leave Management, and employee assistance etc. in conjunction with Finance, Operations and Administration departments, leading to reduced absenteeism and higher retention/empowerment. d.  Employee Engagement : Drive engagement initiatives like cultural and sporting activities, Quiz sessions, health & safety initiatives etc. and bring in other innovative practices. e.  Payroll Management : Preparation of payroll data including attendance, incentives and allowances; liaison with MIS and accounts team, ensuring salary processing as per defined process and timelines. f.  Separations:  Manage entire separation process including data mining. g.  Grievance, Conflict & Discipline management:   Handle employee grievances, resort to counseling as required. Intervene in conflict resolutions and manage disciplinary proceedings, as and when required. h.  Audits & Compliances : Complete ownership of Labour law and other employee related statutory compliances (viz. Minimum Wages, PF & ESI, Apprenticeship etc.) including representation at hearings, as required. Participate in process / Quality audits from a HR perspective.  i.  External interfacing:  with B2R NGO Partners, Government departments, others as required. Engage with stakeholders in academia and local communities. j.  Maintain HR Records & MIS:  Maintaining HR Records/data for employees (employee database, personnel files etc.) in physical and electronic format, HR Dashboard and analytics.  k.  Automation & Digitization:  Play an active role in the ongoing automation initiatives of B2R, from HR and workforce management perspective.   3.   Candidate profile Postgraduate degree in HR or Social Work/ or Graduate degree with diploma in HR with 10 to 12 years of relevant experience Excellent  Interpersonal & Communication skills Good Interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong relationships at all levels. Self-motivated with a high level of commitment, initiative & result orientation. Problem-solving and conflict-resolution skills. High level of integrity and confidentiality in handling sensitive information. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Adept to multi-tasking with a ??ill do??approach Ability and experience to recommend & implement process improvements Capable of working well under pressure and multi-tasking  The position is based out of Uttarakhand, at the centers mentioned above. Individual could reside in/around our center (or open to stay in nearby town like Almora, Haldwani, Ranikhet, Nainital or Bhimtal with a willingness to travel). Why Join Us Make a positive impact on rural communities by contributing to job creation and economic development. Work in a collaborative and supportive environment that values diversity and inclusivity. Opportunity for professional growth and development within a rapidly growing organization. We believe that true learning and growth happens when you have the desire to acquire knowledge and experience beyond your gamut of activities. Decent salary + performance linked incentive If you are ready to thrive in a unique work setting and make a difference, send your resume to hr@b2r.in with the subject line B2R - [Position Name] Application.

column2: Job Title: HR Executive Company:  Genesis Energy.   Location:  Jogeshwari/ Andheri (East)    About Genesis Energy: Genesis Energy is a dynamic player in the oil and gas sector, offering comprehensive solutions ranging from manufacturing to cutting-edge software and automation technologies. We are committed to driving innovation and sustainability in the energy industry.   Job Description: We are seeking a skilled HR Executive to join our team at Genesis Energy. As an HR Executive, you will play a pivotal role in supporting our diverse workforce across manufacturing, software development, and automation divisions. You will be responsible for managing HR functions to ensure an engaged, motivated, and productive team.   Responsibilities: Lead the recruitment process for various positions across manufacturing, software development, and automation divisions, from sourcing to onboarding. Develop and implement HR policies and procedures tailored to the unique needs of each business unit while ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations. Administer employee benefits programs and provide guidance on employee relations matters, including performance management, conflict resolution, and disciplinary actions. Collaborate with department heads to identify training and development needs and coordinate training initiatives to enhance employee skills and competencies. Manage payroll and maintain accurate employee records and HR databases. Conduct regular employee engagement activities and initiatives to foster a positive work culture. Stay updated on labor laws and regulations relevant to the oil and gas industry and ensure adherence to statutory requirements. Assist in performance appraisal processes and succession planning activities. Handle employee queries and provide timely HR support to all levels of the organization. Participate in strategic planning and contribute to the development of HR strategies aligned with business objectives.   Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, or a related field. Proven experience as an HR Executive or HR Generalist in the oil and gas industry or related sectors. Strong knowledge of HR practices, including recruitment, employee relations, performance management, and compliance. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build relationships at all levels of the organization. Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities. High level of confidentiality and integrity.   Join us at Genesis Energy and be part of a forward-thinking team driving innovation in the oil and gas industry!   How to Apply: Please send your resume and cover letter to humanrelations@gepl.biz indicating your interest in the HR Executive position at Genesis Energy and highlighting your relevant experience and qualifications.

column2: We are seeking a skilled and experienced HR Generalist, the ideal candidate will be responsible for managing various aspects of human resources functions while leveraging tools to analyse HR data, this role encompasses a wide range of responsibilities related to managing personnel and supporting the organizations workforce needs. Here are some key aspects of the HR Generalist role;              Responsibilities:         Serve as a primary point of contact for employees on HR-related inquiries and provide guidance to employees on HR policies, procedures, and best practices; escalates concerns to Director, Senior HRBP as needed.      Administer employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other perks, and assist employees with benefit-related inquiries.      Support the Director, Senior HRBP with employee relations issues by conducting investigations, mediating conflicts, and providing coaching and support to employees and managers.      Maintain HRIS (Human Resources Information System) data integrity and ensure accurate and up-to-date employee records; including but not limited to entering new hires, handling terminations, updating titles, pay information, and department data, and maintaining accurate digital personnel files      Support the team by running reports from the HRIS system to analyse HR metrics and trends, such as turnover rates, employee demographics, and performance evaluations, and develop visualizations and reports.      Assist in the development and implementation of HR policies, procedures, and initiatives to support organizational goals and compliance with employment laws and regulations.      Assist the team with planning and facilitating training sessions for employees and managers on HR-related topics, including performance management, diversity and inclusion, and compliance training.      Operates with high standards of compliance, and high ethical standards to protect employees as well as the assets and image of the company      Performs other duties and responsibilities per business need.          Qualification:          Bachelor s degree in human resources, Business Administration, or related field. Masters degree or HR certification (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR) is a plus.      Proven experience working as an HR Generalist or in a similar HR role, with a comprehensive understanding of HR functions, policies, and practices.      Experience working in an HRIS system, required; experience with ADP highly preferred.      Proven experience running reports and analysing data; experience with ADP reporting or other HRIS system reporting, required. Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to effectively interact with employees at all levels of the organization. column2: Payroll Processing: Execute the end-to-end payroll process, including data entry, calculations, and verification of payroll transactions.       Data Management: Maintain accurate employee payroll records, including new hires, terminations, and changes in compensation or deductions. Update employee payroll information as needed and ensure data integrity.     Compliance: Stay updated on payroll laws, regulations, and tax requirements. Ensure payroll processes comply with legal and regulatory standards. Prepare and file payroll-related reports and tax filings as required.     Benefits Administration: Collaborate with the HR team to administer employee benefits, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other voluntary deductions. Ensure accurate deduction and reporting of benefits contributions.     Audits and Reviews: Conduct regular audits of payroll data to identify discrepancies or errors. Resolve payroll discrepancies and address payroll-related inquiries from employees in a timely and professional manner.     Systems Management: Utilize payroll software and systems to process payroll transactions efficiently.     Recommend system enhancements or upgrades to improve payroll processes and data management.     Communication: Serve as the primary point of contact for employee payroll inquiries. Communicate payroll-related policies, procedures, and changes to employees as needed. Provide exceptional customer.     service to address employee concerns and questions.     Utilize HR data to generate insightful reports and analytics for strategic decision-making.     Develop and maintain HR dashboards to monitor key metrics related to workforce, turnover, and other relevant areas.     Identify opportunities for process improvements in payroll and data analytics.     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement automation and streamline HR processes.           We Are Looking for Someone With                 3-5 year of proven experience in payroll processing and administration.     Good knowledge of MS Excel PowerPoint is must V-lookup/Pivots etc.     Basic understanding of payroll laws, regulations, and tax requirements.     Proficiency in payroll software and data analytics tools.     Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and calculations     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.     Effective communication and interpersonal skills.     Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.     High level of professionalism and integrity.

column2: Role & responsibilities   Job description We are looking for a Human Resource Manager to join our team and lead our talent acquisition and people management activities. You will be responsible for developing and implementing HR strategies and initiatives that align with our business goals and values. You will also oversee the entire recruitment and selection process, from sourcing to hiring, as well as managing employee relations, performance, training, and development. To be successful in this role, you should have at least 3-5 years of experience in HR management, with a strong focus on talent acquisition. You should also have excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills, as well as a high degree of professionalism and integrity. You should be able to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, and handle multiple tasks and projects effectively. Responsibilities:  Plan and execute organizational objectives in human resources, such as talent acquisition, retention, engagement, diversity, and inclusion  Create and update job descriptions and design, and post job advertisements on various platforms  Review resumes and applications, conduct interviews, and negotiate job offers with candidates  Manage employee relations by addressing demands, grievances, or other issues, and ensuring compliance with labour laws and regulations  Conduct performance management and appraisal, provide feedback and coaching, and identify areas for improvement and development  Design and implement training and development programs that enhance employee skills and competencies  Evaluate and monitor the effectiveness of HR policies and practices, and suggest improvements as needed  Maintain HR records and reports, and ensure data accuracy and confidentiality Requirements:  Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field  At least 4 years of experience in HR management, preferably in a similar industry  Proven experience in talent acquisition, sourcing, hiring, and onboarding  Knowledge of HR best practices, trends, and tools  Familiarity with labour laws and regulations  Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills  High degree of professionalism and integrity  Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment  Ability to handle multiple tasks and projects effectively If you are interested in this position, please send your resume. We look forward to hearing from you. column1: Manager Employee Relations And Employee Engageme
column2: Job Description :    Be a lead HR business partner and change catalyst in the organization by augmenting the efforts of the leadership team at people practices in building replicable,  systemic,  performance oriented people process,  thus enabling the organization to realize its growth aspirations on a sustainable basis.    Responsibilities    Employee Engagement and Attrition Management   Lead the employee relations and people operation functions of the origination in line with organizational best practices and be a facilitator and custodian of positive work culture in the organization.    Effectively support the leadership team in designing the competency mapping model for the organization and effectively implement the same across the organization.    Effectively supports the leadership team in resource management strategies thus utilize the existing skill pool in building efficient and productive teams across service lines.    Build and implement career development plan and succession planning framework for the organization.    Innovate and create process improvements for people processes so as to reduce delivery timelines and yet maintain quality.    Effectively update all data matrices and create employee life cycle framework and publish people dashboards as per the periodic timelines.    Effectively run and manage early warning systems and be a catalyst in critical talent retention.    Employee Connect and Fun @ work Management   Effectively manage all employee touch points and track the feedback to logical conclusion encompassing all relevant stakeholders.    Effectively support the leadership team in various people initiatives and Advantmed Value building initiatives as required from time to time.    Ensure people CMMi-  Level 3 compliance on HR operations and employee life cycle management.    Facilitate employee committees and cross functional teams.    Effectively plan and manage all high visibility programs,  Fun @ wok,  Employee connect programs,  quarterly newsletters,  Town halls,  CXO hours,  and Advantmed Strategy week.    Define the quarterly/ periodic communication plan for or units in line with the overall unit communication plan.    Effectively lead the implementation of programs like,  D- 90,  15- Day One - 0- ones,  anniversary One- 0- 0nes and other new connect initiatives.    Deploys Rewards & Recognition program for the org/ unit,  Execute the org. R &R process at the Unit level.    Defines the disciplinary handling process and provides support for disciplinary cases as required.    Monitor and ensures the effectiveness of the grievance resolution mechanism and employee query handling processes.    Monitors the employee governance process,  intervene where required IN ORDER to drive employee adherence to code of conduct.    Handle level 3 disciplinary cases (along with VP HR in extreme cases) by conducting investigation,  and taking action with the employee.    Checks continuously to evaluate the effectiveness of the discipline process within the organization and drives communication to educate employees.    Workforce Planning and Talent Management   Effectively support in implementation and evaluation succession planning framework using progressive KPI metrics facilitating the development of the 2nd line leaders post 12 months of a leaders in a given leadership role.    Effectively support in creating Employee Value preposition vis a vis the effectively support the leadership team in implementing various talent management initiatives and benchmark the same against industry best practices.    Identifying workforce requirements to achieve organisation s short and long term goals and objectives (i.e. cross functional ability,  workforce expansion or reduction)    Execute division specific performance management framework and initiatives,  program manages appraisal cycles & CRR process (delivery,  sales and consulting),  Conduct orientation workshops for appraisers across locations and onsite,  CRR CG Councils.    Post appraisal conducts and reviews the status of the PIP cases in order to ensure fair and effective feedback mechanism which will lead to improved performance   Analytics and Reporting   Generate and review the workforce management dashboard and highlights areas of focus as well as track continuous improvements.    Also prepares and publishes report on HR solutions/ various HR initiatives on the defined effort and outcome metrics.    Socializes the usage of the reports in delivery by building awareness and communication -  IN ORDER to continuously communicate with delivery/ operations on effectiveness of HR    Skills   Reporting to Global Head HR (VP- HR) for all functional as well as admin issues.    Interfacing with all service level heads and managers based out of India as well as other global offices. (24 X 7 work environment).    Interfacing with Business development,  finance,  administration team members and software development teams of for all functional as well as operational issues.    Interfacing with employee committees and all employee through town halls and webinars.    Interface with potential and existing vendors and channel partners.    Post Graduate in Human Resources Full time course from a reputed institution.    7- 10 Yrs,  primarily in global ITeS space. (Candidates with more than 10 years of experience will not be considered)    Minimum 3 years of relevant experience HR Business Partner.    Min 3 years exposure process improvement,  effective people management,  HR Operations.    Should have exposure to people CMMi- L3 practices
column11: Career development, Performance management, Consulting, Employee engagement, Management consulting, Succession planning, ITES, Talent management, Resource management, Analytics

column2: Job Description :    Drive organization level initiatives to boost up the employee morale and their motivational levels   Ensure employee Connect through various employee engagement activities like Townhalls,  skip level meetings,  coffee sessions etc.    Manage and conduct employee satisfaction/ engagement surveys for all the employees   Drive engagement through effective communication strategies   Manage varior R&R activities   Experience    6 Years of relevant experience   Should have relevant experience in Employee Communications   Excellent content creation skills combined with effective presentation and communication style   Ability to plan,  organize,  manage and execute effective employee engagement activities at organizational level   Ability to collaborate with required stakeholders internally and externally   Education   MBA in HR from premiere college (Regular full time course)    Candidates with Mass Communications/ similar education may also be considered if they have required years of relevant experience    25.7.2014
