column2: Role & responsibilities     1) Onboarding & Offboarding: Manage end-to-end onboarding and offboarding processes, ensuring seamless transitions and exceptional experiences for new hires and departing employees, including paperwork, scheduling, orientation, data entry, compliance auditing, and cross-departmental coordination.  2) Attendance Management: Coordinate with employees, clients, and coordinators to manage attendance effectively, ensuring compliance with policies and regulations. 3) Payroll Processing: Process payroll accurately, including bonus/incentive pay, expense reimbursements, and benefit changes. Input exceptions into payroll systems and ensure compliance with relevant regulations. 4) Record Maintenance: Maintain all records and reports within the HR information management system, ensuring accuracy and compliance with state and local employment laws. 5) Compliance: Ensure compliance with employment laws and regulations, reviewing policies and practices as necessary. Prepare compliance reports for clients and address queries accordingly. 6) Reporting: Prepare weekly, monthly, and yearly reports, including MIS reports and departmental budgets. Keep track of various forms and application formats. 7) Performance Management: Assist in performance management tasks, including half-yearly and annual performance reviews. Attend and participate in disciplinary meetings, terminations, and investigations as required. 8) Employee Engagement: Develop employee engagement plans, obtain necessary budget approvals, and initiate activities to foster a positive work environment. 9) Grievance Management: Monitor multiple sites to promptly address and resolve any employee grievances through effective coordination with supervisors and relevant departments to achieve satisfactory solutions. 10) Continuous Learning: Stay updated on trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in human resources, talent management, and employment law. 11) Training & Development: Coordinate and plan training schedules according to departmental needs, maintain an aligned training calendar for employees, ensuring it meets organizational goals and fosters employee development. 12) Other Duties: Perform other HR-related duties as assigned by the management.   Preferred candidate profile   1) Proven experience in human resources administration or a similar role. 2) Strong knowledge of HRIS software and payroll processing systems. 3) Excellent organizational and time management skills. 4) Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion. 5) Strong communication and interpersonal skills. 6) Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Perks and benefits   Mediclaim PF Gratuity

column2: Roles and Responsibilities:    Coordinate the recruitment process, including job postings, candidate screening, scheduling interviews, conducting reference checks, and arranging job offers. Facilitate the onboarding process for new hires, including orientation sessions, completion of paperwork, introduction to company policies and procedures, and provision of necessary resources. Serve as a point of contact for employees regarding HR-related inquiries, issues, and concerns, providing guidance, support, and resolution as needed. Foster positive employee relations by promoting open communication, addressing grievances, and facilitating conflict resolution in accordance with company policies and applicable labor laws. Coordinating performance appraisal processes under guidance of Head office. Assist in identifying training and development needs, coordinating training programs, and tracking employee progress to enhance individual and organizational performance. Coordinating payroll processes, including timekeeping, attendance tracking, payroll deductions, ensuring accuracy and compliance with statutory regulations. Administer employee benefits programs, such as health insurance, leave entitlements, and assist employees with inquiries and enrollment procedures. Implement, and enforce HR policies, procedures, and guidelines in alignment with company requirements, industry best practices, and organizational values. Stay abreast of labor laws, regulations, and employment standards to ensure compliance and mitigate risks related to employee relations, compensation, benefits, and workplace safety. Coordinate employee training and development initiatives, including identifying training needs, sourcing training providers, scheduling sessions, and evaluating training effectiveness. Maintain accurate and up-to-date HR records, including personnel files, employment contracts, performance appraisals, training records, and other relevant documents. column2: As an HR Recruiter, you will be responsible for sourcing, attracting, and hiring talented individuals to fill open positions within our organization. You will collaborate closely with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and develop effective recruitment strategies to meet those needs. This role requires a proactive and resourceful approach to identify and engage top talent, as well as strong communication and organizational skills to manage the recruitment process efficiently.    Key Responsibilities: Recruitment Strategy:  Develop and implement recruitment strategies to attract qualified candidates for various positions. Sourcing:  Utilize various channels such as job boards, social media, networking, and referrals to source potential candidates. Candidate Screening:  Review resumes, conduct initial screenings, and assess candidates' qualifications to determine suitability for open positions. Interview Coordination:  Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and candidates, ensuring a smooth and efficient interview process. Candidate Engagement:  Maintain regular communication with candidates throughout the recruitment process, providing updates and guidance as needed. Employee Relations:  Serve as a point of contact for employee inquiries, grievances, and conflict resolution. Benefits Administration:  Administer employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other perks. Performance Management:  Support performance appraisal processes, provide guidance to managers and employees on performance feedback, and assist in the development of performance improvement plans when necessary. HR Policies and Compliance:  Maintain and update HR policies and procedures in accordance with federal, state, and local regulations. Ensure compliance with employment laws and regulations and provide training to employees as needed. Training and Development:  Identify training needs within the organization and coordinate training programs to enhance employee skills and competencies. Collaborate with department managers to support career development initiatives. Employee Engagement:  Develop and implement initiatives to promote employee engagement and morale, such as employee recognition programs, team-building activities, and company events

column2: An HR executive is an administrative human resources role that is primarily responsible for ensuring an organizations entire HR department performs well. Those who obtain this role have achieved the highest position in an HR department and are viewed as the main authority on all HR matters and functions.     HR executives should have at least a bachelors degree. Generally, the more common degree programs among HR executives are social sciences, business administration, human resources, communications and management. Moreover, organizations tend to prefer candidates with HR-related work experience and basic computer skills, so that they will already be familiar with the basic job functions once they start work..     RESPONSIBILITIES         Acquire a thorough understanding of client needs and requirements. Roles and Responsibilities :    1.Understanding the client requirements from time to time and devise appropriate strategies with due diligence of various risk management practices 2.Communicate market and price outlook to the client on regular basis and advice on the appropriate strategy 3.Compile MIS with open and closed positions of the client for review from time to time and devise course correction measures, if any 4.Handling and addressing client queries in cohesion with corresponding research teams 5.Client retention and identifying up - selling opportunities with each client 6.Regular maintenance of client wise engagement track in - line with the companys internal systems 7.Pre sales engagement and support in converting the leads      ?       Desired Profile :    1.Thorough understanding of various business process across diverse sectors 2.6 - 12 + years of work experience 3.Experienced on similar roles with any of the following functional areas -  Consulting firms, Research organizations, Funds, Banks, 4.Sound understanding and knowledge of derivatives / commodity markets 5.Good Leadership skills          ROLE: Fundamental Analyst       Designation Jr. FA/ FA /Sr. FA/Associate(Designation will depend on the level of experience) Education Graduationfrom premiuminstitute and or Post Graduation in Management -  Agriculture/ Finance / Economics/ Statistics with related experience. Additional Qualification Industry specific diplomas/ Functional certifications Work Experience 1 year to 12+yrs (Freshers from premium institues may also ) Domain Research on Agricommodities Functional Area: Consulting firms, Funds, Banks, Independent consultants, Entrepreneur, Broking Firms Essential Language English Cost to Company As per market standards No. Of open positions Location of work Hyderabad -  3 ; Jakarta - Indonesia 1(Native of Indonesia)      ?       Job Objective:    The Research Analyst would be required to perform extensive research on the supply - demand - price of select commodities on a global basis and build several forecast models based on the collected information.To be successful in this role, the Analyst will be expected to demonstrate strong analytical capabilities, forecast modeling, and the ability to critically analyse data in an efficient manner. Commodity Fundamental Analysts are required to support Commodity Consulting Services at TransGraph which are aimed to serve various corporate houses that are exposed to price risk in the commodity segment.    Job Requirements:    1.Expert level of skills in fundamental analysis and strong ability to take a call on the market for short term to long term periods. 2.Ability to build any indicators, forecasting models for any new commodity 3.Statistical knowledge is a must. 4.Business acumen, attention to detail and strong data interpretation skills to connect dots and predict market developments 5.Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to generate timely reports and to interact with clients 6.Negotiation and persuasive skills to discuss and obtain information from market participants,industry experts and the ability to interact and establish various market sources to obtain the market intelligence. 7.Good understanding of the value chain of the respective domain/commodity 8.Sound knowledge in derivative markets and related concepts 9.Ability to effectively operate independently and in a team environment 10.Should possess mastery in MS Excel and very good PPT preparation skills. 11.Service - oriented attitude while delivering the research and working with passion for clientesteem. 12.Innovation, willingness to learn / un - learn and be the change agent. Ability to think out - of - box on facing any constraints    Job Responsibilities:    1.Responsible for independently handling the assigned commodities from the needs of consulting clients. 2.Identification of various drivers of the commodity time to time and updating in reports and if necessary release special updates. 3.Timely preparing daily / weekly / bi - weekly / monthly / quarterly reports. 4.Helping the consulting team with appropriate market factors ina timely manner 5.Actively participating in market outlook discussions and contribute to enhancing the forecasting accuracy 6.Active role while designing the trading, hedging and procurement strategies 7.Self - auditing the market factors and price ranges given for budgeting 8.Ability to guide the team and convert the collected data into decision enabling content. 9.Be hands - on on industry developments. 10.Should travel to the markets in - person with short notices. 11.Handling the assigned clients with respect to the client needs.      ROLE:Inside Sales Representative       Designation Inside Sales Representative Education Post Graduation in Management OR Graduate from any stream Additional Qualification PhD/ M. Phil/ MS/ Industry specific diplomas/ Functional certifications Work Experience 0 - 3 years Communication Skills Excellent, both verbal and written Technical Skill Good working knowledge and applicability of MS office Work Location Hyderabad    Roles and Responsibilities :    Working closely with Marketing, Sales and Research teams across the globe to plan execute account coverage and campaign strategies to unlock new sales opportunities. The Inside Sales role is adept at understanding the needs and process pains of relevant Business Decision Makers to identify opportunities where TransGraph product and service offerings can add long - term value. 1.Creating database of existing and new clients 2.Ensuring excellence in pipeline management, pipeline hygiene and sales execution against targets to maximize business potential. 3.Maintain leads excel file commodity wise 4.Coordinate with research/engagement team and the sales team, to communicate high points of our research, price forecasts and value addition to the leads in list 5.Diligent follow - ups with the leads via email/phone communications 6.Route qualified leads to the outside sales team by initiating appointments 7.Generate qualified appointments/ opportunities through phone calls, emails, internet research, etc mainly in US, APAC, Europe and India. 8.Marketing: Social meda, web site, teasers (monthly minimum 5), data base management (LinkedIn, subscriptions to new data bases, existing data base), collateral preparation 9.Ensure the generation of agreements, invoices, payment follow ups, access to services, coordination with accounts and engagement teams 10.Prepare tenders and proposal, working with regional sales managers 11.Experience in working with sales databases like zoominfo, inside view, hoovers etc 12.Experience working with Salesforce.com or similar CRM. 13.Experienced in Company profiling, updating and logging all activities accurately within CRM 14.Meet or exceed quarterly business development objectives 15.Flexible attitude, with an ability and willingness to multi - task 16.Highly self - motivated and hard - working      ROLE:Sales and Marketing       Designation Asst. Manager/ Manager(Designation will depend on the level of experience Education Post graduate / MBA -  Marketing or related degree Communication Skills Excellent, both verbal and written Work Experience 2 -  8 + years Domain Commodity Markets, Services Sales Functional Area: Sales and Marketing Work Location Hyderabad    Competencies to be sold    Price forecasting | risk management | value chain analysis of commodities and currencies | Government / Policy Consulting : 1.Price / procurement / hedge / risk / business consulting services (primary focus) 2.Research reports (part of price consulting services) 3.Risk management software product 4.Government projects establishing PMUs, sector specific works    Target client base    1.Commodity buyers (FMCG/ Auto/metal / edible oils), 2.Commodity sellers (plantation/ mining / commodity producing companies) 3.Commodity physical trading companies ( having manufacturing / processing / refining facilities) 4.Oil and Gas companies 5.Secretaries / Directors in government departments    Sales Approach    Has to meet procurement / sourcing mangers of commodity buying community or traders / head of trading in commodity sellers and trading companies make high impact presentations, including market analysis and price outlook presentations, risk management best practices, agri value chain, industry analysis presentations.    Types of sales    B2B sales, directly approaching the clients.No distributor / dealer network.    Geography focus    West India : Maharashtra, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh    Job description     1.Consistently opening up of new leads through personal initiative, industry analysis identifying right contacts and contacting them either through cold calling, e - mails or social media and ensuring to get targeted leads. Maintaining a healthy pipeline, that would convert into business for the company and achieving the given targets.     2.Follow ups leads, coordinating with marketing support system, social media marketing (linkedin, bulk emails).     3.Attending Conferences (advance planning, focused / targeted sales in the conferences)     4.Coordination with research/engagement teams, customer relationship management and Payment follow ups     5.Contributing for the marketing collateral of TransGraph and social media presence     6.Updating the new leads opened and status of existing leads on a daily basis     Desired Profile     3 - 7 years of work experience     He/ She should be willing to travel extensively within the allocated territories and other locations as per the business requirement.     Good networking skills with ability to proactively interact with unknown people in unknown territories and ability to develop and establish good relations with the same     Good Microsoft Office skills     Experience in sales is a Must     Growth and tenure     Salary shall commensurate with experience and growth is directly proportional to organizations growth and your performance.     Minimum committed service of 2 years (this is applicable to all employees who join the company)     Looking for a long term relationship that will grow into senior management personnel in the company, driving the companys growth and in turn achieving their own career growth. column2: Experience    : Minimum 5-6 years of experience in Manufacturing plant .       Qualification    : MSW or Masters with specialization in HR     MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES PERFORMANCE INDICATORS:     Knowledge of Factories Act and SPINE HRMS. ( HR Software)Recruitment Ensuring all positions are closed within 45-50 days of receiving the requirement.     a. Following the recruitment process and closing positions as required for both on-roll and off-roll     b. Ensuring all documents of recruitment are maintained and update       Pre joining and Joining Formalities       a.Background verification, medical check-up follow up and execution of selected candidate     b. Preparing Induction schedule, Welcome aboard, Email Id, Asset allocation form, New joinee inputs, ID card, HR Master, Vendor Master, getting employee code for new joinee from Corporate team     c. Joining Kit to be given to new employee, getting introduce new employee with all existing staff, plant round     d. sending all the original documents with joining kit to Mumbai office and keep one zerox set at plant     e. Giving induction as per induction schedule- by HR and then all dept.as per schedule     f. Giving training of spine to new joinee     g. Updating new joinee in success factor     The background and medical has to be initiated and completed within one day from the day the Offer letter is issued. All pre-joining formalities have to be completed atleast 2 days before the joining.     Post employee joins, the joining kit and documents have to be shared with Corporate HR within 2 days after the joining.       Probation Formalities       The probation form has to be sent to the HOD atleast 20 days prior to the confirmation/extension date. The location HR has to ensure the employee receives the letter on the date of confirmation and provides acknowledgement on the same within 1 day.     a. On the completion of six months of the employee, probation evaluation form needs to be filled by the HOD and submitted.     b. Ensuring the process is completed within the defined timelines. Coordinating with Corporate HR for the same.       Attendance       a. Weekly upload the shift, resolving attendance related queries of the employees, sending mails weekly in DLU- ring for updating attendance     b. Sending attendance confirmation to Corporate HR before the payroll as per the timelines provided     All shifts, need to be updated in advance for the upcoming weeks. Regular attendance checking needs to be done on Spine and monthly report need to be given as per the deadlines       Monthly Reports       a. Preparing On roll and off roll Cognos send to Corporate HR on 26th of every month     b. Offroll contractors invoice to be check as per check list given by them to be done on 1st of every month     c. Monthly Accident Report to be done on 1st of the month     d. LTFAR Report to be done on 1st of the month     e. Off roll Monthly Absenteeism Report to be done by 5th of every month     f. Monthly Attendance report On roll & Off roll to be done latest by 22nd of every month based on the salary cycle     g. Monthly Off-roll employee master report to be done by 8th of every month     All reports need to be provided as per the mentioned deadlines       ISO & Training       a. Maintaining all the documents/ files related to ISO     b. Mainly forms are,     c. Manpower requisition form     d. Induction form     e. Induction feedback form     f. Training Identification Form (Newly introduced)- when employee gets confirm then this form need to be filled up HOD     g. Training Co-ordination - attendance sheet, filling up training feedback form from participants     All processes and documentation need to be completed as per SOP       Exit Formalities       a. Sending goodbye mail of left employee to Corporate HR a day in advance     b. Clearance form and exit interview form to be filled up by the employee who is going to leave the company     c. Collecting employees' ID card, corporate credit card- if he/she has. Along with ID card, Corporate credit card clearance form and exit interview form scan copy and hard copy to be send to Corporate Team     d. Deletion of the employee from the success factor     Ensuring the resignation received has been accepted by manager with last date mentioned. Forward the same to Corporate HR and ensure the resignation acceptance letter is issued to employee within 3 days. Location HR initiates the exit formalities 2 days prior to employees last day. Completing the exit formalities on the last day of employee and sharing the documents with Corporate HR      Other important responsibilities Completing all work as per the deadlines     a. Preparing daily attendance emails     b. Shop Floor round and ensuring proper smooth overall functioning       Skill :         Compliances     Leave & Attendance Management     HR Operations     Communication Skills     Time Management     Multi-tasking     Ability to work in a team and under pressure d. Grievance/ query

column2: Warm Greetings from Aarvi Encon. We do have opening for below mentioned profile. Position: HR executive  Job Description: We are seeking a highly organized and proactive HR and Administration Lead to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing all HR and administrative functions, ensuring smooth operations and a positive work environment. Key Responsibilities: 1. Prepare comprehensive job descriptions for various roles within the organization. 2. Coordinate with recruitment firms to source potential candidates and manage the recruitment process. 3. Coordinate interviews with relevant stakeholders and ensure a seamless interview experience for candidates. 4. Ensure meticulous paperwork for new candidates, including the preparation of offer letters and the verification of documents. 5. Ensure readiness for new joiners by coordinating with relevant departments and stakeholders. 6. Facilitate orientation and onboarding processes for new employees, ensuring a smooth transition into the organization. 7. Manage schedules for confirmation of employees, performance reviews, and feedback sessions. 8. Arrange and coordinate training schedules for employees. 9. Verify and regularize attendance records. 10. Oversee office administration tasks, including phone, internet, housekeeping, and pantry management. 11. Plan and organize motivational activities to boost employee morale and engagement. 12. Demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills in English. 13. Possess basic math skills for administrative and financial tasks. 14. Be proficient in computer applications, particularly Microsoft Office 360. 15. Maintain an empathetic and customer-oriented approach in all interactions. Qualifications: 1. Bachelor's degree in Arts, Commerce, or Science. 2. Diploma or certification in Human Resources Management. 3. 2-3 years of experience in a similar role. 4. Proven experience in HR and administrative functions. 5. Strong organizational and multitasking abilities. 6. Excellent communication skills in English. 7. Basic math skills and proficiency in computer applications. 8. Empathetic and customer-oriented approach. Location:  Powai, Andheri. Note: Female candidates only  Please share your updated cv on shubhada@aarviencon.com with following details- Current CTC Notice Period Expected CTC Relevant experience Current Location Contact Details: Shubhada S 8291919369 shubhada@aarviencon.com

Job Description:-  Recruitment Plan   Create a recruitment plan, with timelines and deployment of recruiter details, priority level etc.  Track progress against plan, changes in priorities etc.  Create and circulate MIS giving updates  Manpower Requisition & JD    Follow a defined process of manpower requisition form to trigger the process  Ensure JD are in place for all recruitment positions column2: Role & responsibilities   Talent Acquisition & Management  a) Oversee the entire recruitment process, attracting top talent aligned with company needs.  b) Develop and implement effective onboarding programs to integrate new hires seamlessly.  c) Manage employee relations, including performance management, coaching, and conflict resolution.  d) Design and administer competitive compensation and benefits programs to attract and retain talent.  Compliance & Employee Relations  a) Stay updated on and ensure adherence to all relevant Indian HR laws and regulations.  b) Develop and maintain comprehensive HR policies and procedures. c) Manage employee grievances and disciplinary actions in a fair and confidential manner.  d) Foster a positive and inclusive work environment that promotes employee well-being.  Additional Responsibilities  a) Manage the HR budget and resources effectively.  b) Leverage HR technology to streamline HR processes and improve efficiency.  c) Stay abreast of HR trends and best practices.  d) Act as a trusted advisor to management on all HR-related matters.  e) Oversee and mentor HR team members, fostering professional development.  Preferred candidate profile   We are seeking a seasoned Senior HR Manager to lead our dynamic team and champion a strategic approach to talent management. You will oversee all HR functions, ensuring alignment with business goals and fostering a positive work environment. In this crucial role, you'll leverage your in-depth knowledge of Indian HR laws to guide policy development, ensure compliance, and navigate complex employee relations matters. Strong leadership, strategic thinking, and a passion for building a high-performing workforce are essential.  Interested Candidates share the CV on mail- rec.pune02@layamweb.com

column2: We are looking for an HR Executive to manage our company s recruiting, learning and development and employee performance programs.                      Experience: 1-2 Years (Relevant Experience Only)       Motive:         To cultivate a dynamic workforce through talent engagement and empowerment. They aspire to create inclusive, growth-oriented workspaces, prioritizing employee well-being and contributing to organizational success.         Responsibility:       - Foster a positive work environment by engaging employees and addressing their concerns, thereby increasing team morale and overall productivity.   - Knowledge of how to manage and track employee-related financial matters, such as reimbursements, benefits, and payroll coordination.   - Collaborate with department managers to identify strategies for enhancing team productivity and effectiveness, offering insights and solutions.   - Monitor employee performance and conduct regular assessments to identify areas for improvement, assisting in the development of tailored training and development plans.   - Ensure discipline and adherence to company policies by implementing proactive measures, addressing violations, and initiating corrective actions when necessary.   - Manage the entire employee lifecycle, from recruitment and onboarding to performance appraisals and offboarding.   - Knowledge of how to deal with conflicts and create a healthy environment.   - Stay updated on labor laws, regulations, and HR best practices to ensure compliance and effective HR operations.   - Knowledge of KPIs and KRAs and how to manage them.   - Prepare comprehensive reports on HR-related activities, providing insights and recommendations to senior management.   - Manage employee information and all responsible things related to hiring and firing candidates.   - Maintain accurate and organized HR records and databases, ensuring confidentiality and data security.         Qualifications:         - Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (Masters degree preferred).   - Minimum of 1 year of experience in human resources, showcasing proficiency in employee engagement, conflict management, and accounting tasks.   - Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to create clear and impactful communications.   - Strong accounting skills, with experience in managing financial aspects related to employee compensation and benefits.   - Proven ability to engage and motivate employees, driving team productivity and positive work culture.   - Demonstrated discipline and punctuality, consistently delivering work on time and meeting deadlines.   - Sound knowledge of employment laws, regulations, and HR best practices.   - Exceptional organizational skills with a keen attention to detail.   - Proficiency in HR software and tools for managing employee data and generating reports.         Interview Pre-Requirements:       - Check that you carry all these things and they work properly before starting your work.   - Must read the complete job description and acknowledge self-fit for this position.   - Good internet connection/Wifi.   - Diary and a pen to solve some questions.   - Working earphones and camera.   - Your previous work opens in a new tab.   - Make sure you sit with proper lighting in a stable place.

column1: Senior Executive / Assistant Manager HR For Pharma Formulation Factory
column2: About Company VEKO CARE PVT LTD Veko started in year 2016. We are the fastest growing Veterinary / Animal Health Pharmaceutical Company from India.   Our factory is   approved for GMP by AUSTRALIA, ZAMBIA, Uganda, Kenya, Philippines, Costa Rica   & WHO. We now have more than 3 international GMP audit planned. Veko has state of art   New factory for Pharmaceuticals with a specialization in Veterinary Medicine   at Ranjangaon MIDC near Pune. The factory is designed & made as per the   latest GMP guidelines (PIC/s, WHO-GMP, MHRA), so as to cater & comply   with the FDA regulators of various countries. This will also help to make   dossiers fasters. This manufactures   specialist Veterinary Pharmaceuticals. 1] External   Preparations a)Ectoparasitic Liq. ,   like spray, pour-on. Nail Lacquer (In external liquid)    b) Medicated Shampoo    c) Dusting Powder 2] Oral Solids Dosages   Forms    a) Tablets (Flavoured, Chewable & Normal)    b) Powders & Granules     Based on the above capabilities  We are Exporting to 55+ countries and target to reach 100 countries by end of year 2025. We have all India Sales & Marketing Team and we shall focus at the beginning at Companion Animals and later stage in the Cattle market. To support the above, we shall have to build up strong & robust products, with good dossiers & documentation and with a very high level of the GMP standards and business practices & most important a very strong, honest, hardworking team of inspired people.     Join   the Journey, Be a Part of the Veko, Grow with us !!Role & responsibilities     Update information for Manpower planning to cater requirements of all Departments. Responsible for entire recruitment and on boarding process of employee and support Talent Acquisition Lead for the recruitment. Maintaining MIS, legal database for legal compliance like (Factory return) Form 27, Form 7 (Medical Checkup) Responsible for checking monthly bills form different contracts like Security, Manpower, Employee welfare and warehouse rent bills. Conducting Employee satisfaction surveys for employees and workers Dealing with Government officials for factory compliance related to Annual Return, Mathadi, Property Tax, POSH, Police Station etc Maintaining Discipline at Workplace, Initiating Disciplinary Action against any misconduct & following set Legal Procedure before Action. Issuing Offer, Appointment, Promotion, Transfer, Show cause and Termination Letter. Preparing Salary structures of newly joined candidates & other compliances related data Ensuring control of employee attendance, leave, compensatory offs, shifts working, overtime. To ensure timely availability of Contract Labors, Liaison with Contractors To ensure required levels of housekeeping, sanitation, and cleanliness. Discarding trash and scarp material of factory with help of approved MPCB MEPL vendors. Arranging Employee Welfare activities Basic training to contract employees for factory discipline / behavior /rules. Maintaining Discipline & Healthy Industrial relationship in the factory. Monitoring Housekeeping activities. Providing proper guidelines to personnel hygiene practices. Arrangement for employees medical health check-up on yearly basis. Arrangement of Motivational and skill enhancement training's. Provision and maintenance of factory uniforms and foot ware. Preferred candidate profile     Relevant   Experience of 8-10 yrs in HR, preferably from FMCG Honest,   Hard Working Growth Mindset (Important) PHARMACEUTICAL COMPANY or Manufacturing unit would be preferred. Working Knowledge of Relevant Laws Computer proficiency in MS Office, Excel, e-mail, and internet function

column2: The Executive HR (MIS) will be responsible for managing the Human Resources Management Information System (HRMIS) and providing accurate and timely data and reports to support HR decision-making processes      The role involves ensuring data integrity, generating reports, and collaborating with various departments to enhance HR processes and efficiency              Key Responsibilities          Manage the day-to-day operations of the HR Management Information System.          Ensure accurate and up-to-date employee data entry, maintenance, and confidentiality.          Generate regular and ad-hoc reports for HR and management, providing insights and trends.          Manage the digitization and storage of HR documents within the HRMS.          Ensure accurate and timely filing of employee records, including contracts, performance evaluations, and other relevant documents.          Implement document naming conventions and organizational structures to facilitate easy retrieval.          Coordinate with the HR team during the onboarding process to collect and input necessary documentation into the HRMS.          Streamline data collection and reporting processes to improve efficiency and reduce errors.          Conduct regular audits of HR documents to ensure accuracy, completeness, and adherence to organizational standards.          Collaborate with internal audit teams to facilitate comprehensive reviews of HR documentation for compliance purposes.          To support the team in developing reports and presentations, Data analysis.          Establish and maintain version control for critical HR documents, tracking revisions and updates and ensure that the most current versions of documents are readily accessible to authorized personnel.          Provide regular updates to HR Head on the completeness and accuracy of employee documentation.          Other responsibilities as assigned by reporting manager.          Qualification and Experience          Should possess a graduate or post graduate degree in any stream.          Atleast 1- 2 years of experience in a similar role of handling MIS platforms, collecting, organizing, protecting and storing of data.          Excellent analytical skills for data analysis and reporting.          Proficient in Microsoft Office especially working with Microsoft Excel and database management.          Excellent verbal and Written Communication (Both English and Hindi)          Ability to work with different stakeholders          Competencies:            Flexible and Adaptive:    Remains effective when experiencing major changes in work tasks or the work environment; adjusts effectively to work within new work structures, processes, requirements, or cultures.            Information Management:    Establishes procedures to collect information needed to manage an organization or ongoing activities within it.            Planning and Prioritizing:    Establishing courses of action for self and others to ensure that work is completed efficiently.            Contributes to Team Performance:    Is an engaged and integral member of a group, recognizing the need for group collaboration, empathy, consensual decision-making, and respect for others.            Analytical Problem-Solving:    Analyses information to understand relationships, patterns, and causes and effects, integrate data and check facts. This is done with both qualitative and quantitative information, making rational and timely judgments on the basis of the information that is available.            Attention to Detail:    Pays close attention to information that is overlooked or taken for granted by others. Prefers to look beyond the obvious and does not accept situations or take information at face value. Scrutinizes how things go together, making sure components are indeed aligned and appropriately interrelated.            Effective Communication:    Clearly conveys information and ideas through a variety of media to individuals or groups in a manner that engages the audience and helps them understand and retain the message.

column2: Job Description: HR Executive (Payroll) at Presidency College, Kogilu Location:  Kogilu, Bangalore, India - Yelhanka   Job Summary:  As an HR Executive specializing in Payroll at Presidency College, you will be responsible for accurately processing payroll for all employees, ensuring compliance with relevant laws and regulations, and providing timely assistance and support to employees regarding payroll-related queries. using Saral & HRONE Software.   Key Responsibilities: Payroll Processing: Accurately process payroll for all employees on a monthly basis, ensuring timely disbursement of salaries. Calculate and deduct appropriate amounts for taxes, insurance, and other deductions as per statutory requirements and company policies. Ensure adherence to payroll schedules and deadlines. Compliance: Stay updated with relevant labor laws, tax regulations, and statutory requirements related to payroll processing. Ensure compliance with all applicable laws and regulations while processing payroll. Assist in preparing and filing necessary payroll-related reports and returns.   Employee Support: Address employee queries and concerns related to payroll promptly and accurately. Provide assistance to employees in understanding their salary structures, deductions, and other payroll-related matters. Collaborate with other HR team members to resolve payroll-related issues efficiently. Records Maintenance: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records related to employee salaries, deductions, benefits, and other payroll-related information. Ensure confidentiality and security of payroll data and records.   Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements in payroll processing and implementation of best practices. Work closely with the HR team to streamline payroll processes and enhance efficiency and accuracy.   Qualifications and Skills: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Accounting, Finance, or related field. Proven experience (3 years) in payroll processing and administration, preferably in an educational institution or similar setting. Sound knowledge of payroll software and MS Office applications, especially Excel. Strong understanding of payroll-related laws, regulations, and compliance requirements. Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in processing payroll. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.  oin us at Presidency College, where you can contribute to the success of our institution and ensure the well-being of our employees through accurate and efficient payroll management. Apply now to be a part of our dynamic HR team!

column2: As the HR Payroll Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and managing the payroll functions within the organization. This role requires a strong understanding of payroll processes, compliance with relevant regulations, and effective communication skills to collaborate with various departments.                   Key Responsibilities:           Payroll Processing:             Manage end-to-end payroll processing, ensuring accurate and timely disbursement of salaries.         Review and validate payroll data, including timekeeping, benefits, and deductions.             Compliance:             Stay abreast of local, state, and federal payroll regulations to ensure compliance.         Implement changes in payroll processing systems as needed to adhere to new regulations.         Compliance - Internal and Statutory (PF, PT, ESIC,      Labour     welfare, Bonus      etc     ) compliances.             Database Management:             Maintain and update employee payroll records, ensuring accuracy and confidentiality.         Implement and manage changes related to employee status, tax withholdings, and other payroll-related data     ,      accurate employee database, e-employee records, employee files, Employee Record Keeping / Database      Updation     and Management             Communication and Support:             Act as a point of contact for employees regarding payroll-related inquiries.         Collaborate with HR teams to address payroll issues and provide support on related matters.             Reporting:             Generate and      analyze     payroll reports to support financial and HR-related decision-making.         Prepare reports for management, detailing payroll costs, overtime, and other relevant metrics.             Audits and Reviews:             Conduct regular audits of payroll data to identify and rectify discrepancies.         Collaborate with internal and external auditors during payroll audits.             System Management:             Oversee the functionality of payroll systems, ensuring they meet organizational needs.         Implement system updates and improvements to enhance efficiency.             Training and Development:             Train HR and other relevant staff on payroll procedures and compliance.         Provide guidance to employees on understanding their pay statements.             Qualifications:             Bachelor s     /      M     aster s degree in human resources     , Finance, or a related field.         Proven experience in payroll management, preferably in a leadership role.         In-depth knowledge of payroll regulations, tax laws, and compliance requirements.         Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.         Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.         Proficient in using payroll software and other relevant tools.             Attributes:             Attention to detail and accuracy.         Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.         Strong organizational and time-management skills.         Team player with the ability to collaborate across departments.         Adaptability to evolving payroll regulations and technologies.         The HR Payroll Manager plays a critical role in ensuring the accurate and compliant processing of payroll, contributing to the overall success of the organization and the well-being of its employees.

The same needs to be updated as and when required to be shared withhigher management Budget: Entirely responsible to work on Manpower, Training & Office welfare budget for the Centre HR Operations: Manage Akrivia portal for all employee activities, process monthly payroll in co-ordination with external agency + internal Finance team, create MIS reports, conduct and evaluate HR documents every month, manage off boarding formalities. Employee Engagement: Design and develop engagement strategies, administering rewards and recognition program, employee satisfaction survey. Outdoor programs. Formulating HR policies guidelines; review and update HR processes in timely manner; educate employee time to time on various HR processes and provide support to them as and when required Prepare issue various document to employees offer, appointment, confirmation, PLI increment letters, Bonafide letters, Performance improvement plans, resignation acceptance, relieving letters etc Maintain employee records, personal files, manage and maintain employee database Complete Vendor Management related to Human Resource and Administration. Bit of Administration been given to admin spoc along with managing those set of vendors. Employee Grievances: Ensuring Grievance are heard well and shared further with correct concern to ensure results. Exit Formalities : Ensuring all the forms are filled in correctly, Clearance acquired from all the departments, Sharing required information with the Payroll agency to get F&F calculations in co-ordination with Accounts & Finance Head, Ensuring all official assets are acquired from the person whos exiting the company as this does impact F&F calculations and then to close the case by handing over final payment along with exit letters. Nurture a positive working environment, be an enabler to promote company values. Women  - Company would provide a uniform (formal attire), has to tie a bun Working days :6 days working with 6 week offs in a month (working days would be roster based). Other skills required : Good language skills Energetic and enthusiastic People oriented result driven Should be active listener and socially perceptive Good understanding of MS Office Team working Preferred candidate profile   Desire Candidate 3 - 5 years of experience in HR Operation/Generalist profile MBA in HR is must Any Industry, Retail/Hospitality preferable Minimum 3 years of related experience required. Contact Interested Candidates kindly share your resume on   anishaoasishrconsultant@gmail.com

column2: Job Description  We are currently seeking a dynamic and experienced HR and Administration Executive to join our team. This role will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of human resources management and administrative functions to support our organizational objectives. Responsibilities  Develop, implement, and update HR policies and procedures to ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations while fostering a positive work culture. Facilitate employee training and development programs to enhance skills, improve performance, and promote career growth. Involement in performance management process, including goal setting, performance reviews, feedback sessions, and performance improvement plans. Drive employee engagement initiatives to create a positive work environment, boost morale, and increase productivity. Design and implement rewards and recognition programs to acknowledge and celebrate employee contributions and achievements. Act as a primary point of contact for employee relations matters, including conflict resolution, grievance handling, and disciplinary actions. Oversee day-to-day administrative operations, including managing office facilities, supplies, and equipment to ensure a conducive work environment. Coordinate travel arrangements and accommodations for employees, executives, and guests as needed. Plan and execute company events, meetings, and conferences, including scheduling, logistics, and coordination. Manage vendor relationships, negotiate contracts, and ensure the timely delivery of services such as cleaning, maintenance, and security. Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion and integrity. Skills Required  Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. Proven experience in HR management and administration roles, preferably in a corporate setting. In-depth knowledge of HR policies, procedures, employment laws, and best practices. Strong understanding of training and development principles and methodologies. Excellent interpersonal, communication, and negotiation skills. Ability to prioritize tasks, manage time effectively, and work well under pressure. Proficiency in G- suite  and HRMS

column2: The HR Executive specializing in Payroll, Compliance, and Attendance plays a pivotal role in ensuring accurate and compliant management of payroll processes, adherence to statutory regulations, and efficient tracking of employee attendance. This role requires meticulous attention to detail, strong analytical skills, and a comprehensive understanding of payroll laws and regulations. Key Responsibilities: Payroll Management: Oversee end-to-end payroll processing, including calculating wages, deductions, overtime, and incentives. Ensure timely and accurate disbursement of salaries and benefits to employees. Verify and reconcile payroll data to identify discrepancies and resolve issues promptly. Prepare payroll reports for management review and financial audits. Stay updated on changes in tax laws, labor regulations, and payroll processing standards. Compliance Management: Maintain compliance with local, state, and federal labor laws and regulations. Prepare and submit statutory reports, tax filings, and other compliance-related documents. Assist in audits conducted by regulatory agencies, providing necessary documentation and explanations. Monitor changes in labor laws and update HR policies and procedures accordingly. Collaborate with legal advisors or consultants on compliance-related matters. Attendance Tracking: Implement and maintain systems for accurately recording employee attendance, including timekeeping software or manual tracking methods. Review and reconcile attendance records to ensure accuracy and compliance with company policies. Address attendance-related inquiries and discrepancies from employees. Generate attendance reports and metrics to support decision-making and workforce planning. Monitor trends in attendance patterns and identify areas for improvement. HR Administration: Maintain employee records related to payroll, attendance, and compliance in HRIS or other database systems. Assist in the administration of employee benefits programs, such as health insurance and retirement plans. Respond to employee inquiries regarding payroll, benefits, and attendance policies. Support HR-related projects and initiatives as needed. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management, Accounting, Finance, or related field. Proven experience in payroll processing, compliance management, and attendance tracking. In-depth knowledge of payroll laws, tax regulations, and labor standards. Proficiency in payroll software and MS Office applications, particularly Excel. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in data management. Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information appropriately. Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
column11: Payroll Management, Compliance Management, Attendance Management, Hris Systems, Statutory Compliance, HR Operations, Leave Management

column1: Urgent Opening _Executive Employee Relations_ Navi Mumbai
column2: Job Title: Executive Employee Relations Job Summary:  The Executive Employee Relations serves as a strategic partner to senior management, providing expert guidance and support in managing complex employee relations issues. This role is responsible for promoting a positive and productive work environment by proactively addressing employee concerns, resolving conflicts, and ensuring compliance with company policies and legal regulations. Key Responsibilities: Strategic Employee Relations Leadership: Develop and implement strategic employee relations initiatives aligned with the organization's goals and values. Collaborate with senior management to identify trends, risks, and opportunities related to employee relations and develop proactive strategies to address them. Employee Conflict Resolution: Act as a primary point of contact for employees and managers seeking guidance on employee relations matters. Investigate employee complaints, grievances, and conflicts, ensuring fair and timely resolution in accordance with company policies and legal requirements. Mediate disputes between employees, promoting open communication and mutual understanding. Policy Development and Compliance: Review, update, and develop employee relations policies and procedures to ensure alignment with best practices and legal regulations. Provide guidance to management on the interpretation and application of company policies, and employment laws. Performance Management Support: Partner with HR Business Partners and managers to address performance issues, providing guidance on performance improvement plans, disciplinary actions, and terminations. Ensure that performance management processes are fair, consistent, and compliant with company policies and legal requirements. Employee Engagement and Communication: Develop and implement initiatives to promote employee engagement, morale, and retention. Facilitate effective communication between employees and management, including conducting employee surveys, focus groups, and feedback sessions. Training and Development: Develop and deliver training programs for employees on employee relations topics, including conflict resolution, communication skills, and diversity awareness. Provide coaching and support to managers on handling employee relations issues effectively. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.  Minimum of 1 years of experience in employee relations or a related HR function, with demonstrated expertise in managing complex employee issues. Thorough knowledge of employment laws, regulations, and best practices related to employee relations. Excellent communication, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the ability to make sound judgments and decisions in complex situations. High level of discretion, integrity, and professionalism in handling confidential information and sensitive employee matters. Candidate should be ready to work in rotational shifts. Interested candidates can share their resume on ssahani@lesterinc.com or call Hr Sushma -9136646037 Best Regards, Hr Sushma Sahani 9136646037

column2: Skill required:Employee Services - Employee and Labor Relations  Designation:Associate  Qualifications:Any Graduation  Years of Experience:1 to 3 years  What would you do? This role provides client services for Employee & Org Data Mgmt which may include from hire to retire services, follows all adminstration processes to ensure tasks are completed correctly and resource efficiencies are maintained, works closely with Delivery Services Management to identify and escalate client issues; obtains and confirms pending information / documentation, and adds and amends transaction information to client/systems responding to changes (via e-mail / telephone) so as to maintain a current visible HR records for the client. Employee Services - More into query/case management Employment and Labor Law encompasses the relationships among unions, employers, and employees. Labor laws grant employees in certain sectors the right to unionize and allow employers and employees to engage in certain workplace-related activities in order to further their demands for changes in the employer-employee relationship. Employment law, on the other hand, is defined more broadly as the negotiated relationships between employers and employees.  What are we looking for? Adaptable and flexible  Ability to perform under pressure  Problem-solving skills  Detail orientation  Ability to establish strong client relationship  " Knowledge of Employee & Org data Mgmt Processes ( New Hires, Exit, Job Changes etc).  Strong command on written and verbal English language  Knowledge of MS Office/Excel Skills would be a plus  Knowledge of Successfactors would be a plus"  Bachelor's degree (Any discipline)  "Essentials :  1 - 2 yrs. business experience with Employee & Org data Mgmt background Desirable:  Exposure to BPO industry " " Strong customer orientation - high level of responsiveness to urgent requests or troubleshooting.  Resilient and able to work under pressure  Organization & prioritisation skills to deliver as per deadlines  Attention to detail & quality driven in communications and all system transactions  Demonstrate high levels of confidentiality  Team Work & collaboration  Multi-cultural awareness  Flexibile to work in Shifts" Roles and Responsibilities: Read, understand & analyze client process as per the business rules. Execute full range of the process accurately & timely as a hands on processor.Escalate issues & seek advice when faced with complex issues/problems. Follow Work Instructions while processingHighlight any anomalies in Work Instructions/process documentation to the SME/Leads. Participate in client conference calls, where required & manage appropriate documentation.Perform Root Cause Analysis on issues faces & suggest appropriate corrective action for current remediation & future control. Must be able to propose process improvement ideas which can reduce time, improved accuracy or enhance controls Must have clear understanding of the existing matrices in the process, how they are measured & improvise the measurement system to make it more effective & transparent. Update process metrics on daily basis & maintain MIS.Always demonstrate the highest level of customer service.Pay close attention to detail & follow through to resolve any outstanding issues.Goes beyond immediate requests & activities to ensure both own & related tasks are completed.Update client applications accurately & quickly in accordance with the appropriate User Guides.Ensure assigned tasks are completed accurately in timely fashion.Ensure & maintain the security & confidentiality of client data.Activley Participate in team activities & Organizational initiatives

column2: A career within Internal Audit services, will provide you with an opportunity to gain an understanding of an organisation s objectives, regulatory and risk management environment, and the diverse needs of their critical stakeholders     We focus on helping organisations look deeper and see further considering areas like culture and behaviours to help improve and embed controls     In short, we seek to address the right risks and ultimately add value to their organisation     As a Senior Associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution         PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:             Use feedback and reflection to develop self awareness, personal strengths and address development areas.     Delegate to others to provide stretch opportunities, coaching them to deliver results.     Demonstrate critical thinking and the ability to bring order to unstructured problems.     Use a broad range of tools and techniques to extract insights from current industry or sector trends.     Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance.     Know how and when to use tools available for a given situation and can explain the reasons for this choice.     Seek and embrace opportunities which give exposure to different situations, environments and perspectives.     Use straightforward communication, in a structured way, when influencing and connecting with others.     Able to read situations and modify behavior to build quality relationships.     Uphold the firms code of ethics and business conduct.                               Position:        Human Capital - HC Audits & Compliance - Senior Associate               ?         Qualification:           Degree/ Diploma in Audits/ Quality               ?         Preferred Certifications:        Compliance/ Audits/ HR                   ?         Requirement:                A minimum of 4+ years experience in Human Capital             Preferred to have experience in Quality & Risk such as execution of audits             Should be interested in learning about Human Resource function and also develop in depth understanding of HR processes and audit concepts             Strong application and presence of mind             Should have strong attention to details, analytical skills             Should take ownership and responsibility of the deliverables end to end             Inclination and interest in compliance related matters             Ability to analyze, assess and independently drive and close matters, while taking complete ownership and responsibility, and being responsive             Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (including excel knowledge)             Team player, dynamic, committed to providing high quality, responsibility and maintaining timeliness             Strong communication skills in English both written and verbal English             Demonstrate self motivation and desire to take responsibility for personal growth and development                     We are looking for an extremely self-motivated individual who will relish the opportunity to join the Audit & compliance team.            ?         The following would be his/her key job responsibilities:             Compliance Reviews             Review process design and collaborate with stakeholders to ensure compliance, as/ when needed         Execute Dip checks to ensure processes are working as expected         Maintain Compliance Scorecard             Audit Readiness-              Understand Human Resource (HR) processes & related risks, assess the controls required to mitigate the risks         Undertake dip check audits in HR and identify risks         Support with preparation of the Risk control Matrix for HR for as per the Audit areas such as statutory / quality / security / finance etc                 Audit/ Compliance Review Program Management -             Audit schedule tracking         Coordination of the audit schedule         Collaborate with the teams for deliberation of any compliance requirement of the Firm from HC standpoint         Ensure timely submissions          Ensure actions plans are drawn and executed efficiently                 Additionally,               The individual should have the ability to work effectively under pressure without compromising on professional standards or quality of the work. Additional Information:                  S/he will be reporting to HR- Compliance & Audit Senior Manager. column2: Job Location -  Shankar Garden, NearJanakpuri West Contact-  7669855622 (Muskan) Position Overview:  As an HR Executive Generalist, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the human resources functions within our organization. This role encompasses a broad range of responsibilities, from recruitment and onboarding to employee relations and performance management. You will be the point of contact for employees and managers regarding HR-related inquiries, policies, and procedures. Your contribution will be essential in fostering a positive work environment and ensuring the smooth operation of HR processes. Key Responsibilities: Recruitment and Onboarding: Collaborate with hiring managers to identify staffing needs and develop job descriptions. Source candidates through various channels such as job boards, social media, and referrals. Coordinate new employee onboarding activities, including paperwork completion, orientation sessions, and introductions to company policies and culture Employee Relations: Serve as a primary point of contact for employee inquiries, concerns, and grievances. Mediate conflicts and facilitate resolution between employees and management. Performance Management: Support the performance appraisal process by assisting managers with goal setting, feedback, and evaluation. Monitor employee performance and provide guidance on performance improvement plans. HR Administration: Manage HRIS (Human Resources Information System) and maintain accurate employee records. Prepare and distribute HR-related documentation such as employment contracts, offer letters, and policy manuals. Training and Development: Coordinate training programs and workshops to support employee development and career growth. Evaluate training effectiveness and recommend improvements based on feedback and outcomes.

column2: The Accountant cum HR Executive plays a pivotal role in managing financial operations and human resources functions at Arisen Technologies     This dynamic professional will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of accounting, including financial reporting, budgeting, and compliance, while also managing HR activities such as recruitment, employee relations, and performance management     This position requires a high level of attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and the ability to multitask effectively           Key Responsibilities:         Accounting:         Manage day-to-day accounting operations, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general ledger entries.     Prepare and review financial statements, budgets, and forecasts to monitor financial performance and inform decision-making.     Ensure compliance with all relevant accounting standards, regulations, and tax requirements.     Conduct regular financial analysis and provide insights to support strategic planning and business decision-making.     Coordinate with external auditors and tax authorities as needed.     Implement and maintain accounting policies, procedures, and internal controls to safeguard company assets and ensure accuracy of financial data.     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline processes and improve efficiency in financial operations.         Human Resources:         Manage the recruitment process from job posting to onboarding, including sourcing candidates, conducting interviews, and negotiating offers.     Maintain HR records and documentation, including employee files, contracts, and performance evaluations.     Handle employee relations issues, conflicts, and grievances in a fair and timely manner.     Facilitate employee training and development initiatives to enhance skills and promote career growth.     Administer employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and leave policies.     Ensure compliance with all relevant labor laws, regulations, and company policies.     Support performance management processes, including goal setting, performance reviews, and employee recognition programs.     Promote a positive and inclusive work environment that values diversity, equity, and inclusion.         Qualifications:         Bachelor s degree in Accounting, Finance, Human Resources, or related field (or equivalent experience).     1-8 years of experience in accounting and/or human resources roles, preferably in a fast-paced environment.     Strong understanding of accounting principles, financial analysis, and reporting standards.     Proficiency in accounting software and ERP systems (eg, QuickBooks, SAP, etc).     Knowledge of HR policies, procedures, and best practices.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact with employees at all levels of the organization.     Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.     Ability to handle confidential information with discretion and professionalism.     Problem-solving skills and the ability to multitask and prioritize in a dynamic environment.     Relevant certifications in accounting or human resources are a plus.

column2: We are hiring a Senior human resources executive to join our talented team. Your role as an HR Generalist at Cobold Digital will be far from one-dimensional. You ll undertake a wide range of HR tasks, like organizing training, administering employee benefits and leaves, and crafting HR policies. You will use Human Resources Information Systems to ensure all employee records are up-to-date and confidential. And you ll also act as the main point of contact for employees queries on HR-related topics.         The goal is to ensure the HR department s operations are running smoothly and effectively to deliver maximum value to the organization as a whole.     Responsibilities        Administer compensation and benefit plans.             Assist in talent acquisition and recruitment processes.             Conduct employee onboarding and help organize training development programs.             Provide support to employees in various HR-related topics such as leaves and compensation and resolve any issues that may arise.             Assist in the development and implementation of human resource policies.             Undertake tasks around performance management.             Maintain employee files and records in electronic and paper form.             Assist with all internal and external HR-related matters.             Participate in developing organizational guidelines and procedures.             Recommend strategies to motivate employees.             Investigate complaints brought forward by employees.             Coordinate employee development plans and performance management.             Perform orientation and update records of new staff.             Manage employee database and prepare reports.             Produce and submit reports on general HR activity.             Assist in budget monitoring and payroll.             Keep up-to-date with the latest HR trends and best practices.             Create and distribute internal communication regarding status changes, benefits or company policies.       Requirements        Possesses superb written and spoken communication skills.             Excellent interpersonal relationship building and employee coaching skills.             Excellent computer skills, knowledge of Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS), Excel and demonstrated skills in database management and record-keeping.             Be organized and efficient in daily tasks.             A Bachelor s Degree in human resources, business, or a related field, or extensive prior experience in human resources.             Understanding of recruitment portals (like Naukri, Indeed, Hirst, and others).             At least 3 years of proven experience in Human Resources management.

column2: The Senior Talent Acquisition Executive will lead and direct the functions of the Human Resources (HR) department including designing and implementing company policies that promote a healthy work environment and further develop compensation and benefits plans       Job Responsibilities       The responsibilities of Senior Talent Acquisition Executive can be further broken down by daily job duties, which include:    Support and suggest improvements to the entire recruitment process     Partnering with hiring managers to determine staffing needs and performing in-person interviews with candidates followed by proper background checks of the selected ones.     Organize learning and development programs     Discuss employees career development paths with managers     Work to devise and renew the SolutionInn external relations operation to reflect and deliver the Chief Executive s overarching strategy for the organization; they will directly manage the SolutionInn external relations activity.      Serving as a liaison with area employment agencies, colleges, and industry associations. Be required to attend relevant events and/or represent the organization in networking events.     Creates learning and development programs and initiatives that provide internal development opportunities for employees.     Develop strong relationships with career services departments in educational institutions and other organizations, providing support to our members and leading collaborations where appropriate.      Analyze trends in compensation and benefits; researches and proposes competitive base and incentive pay programs to ensure the organization attracts and retains top talent.     Maintains compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices; reviews policies and practices to maintain compliance. column2: Role & responsibilities       We are seeking a dynamic and experienced HR Executive to join our team. The HR Executive will be responsible for providing comprehensive HR support to our organization, including but not limited to recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training and development, and compliance with all relevant employment laws and regulations. The ideal candidate will possess strong interpersonal skills, attention to detail, and a proactive approach to problem-solving. Key Responsibilities: Recruitment and Selection: Coordinate the recruitment process, including job postings, resume screening, scheduling interviews, and conducting background checks. Assist in the development of job descriptions and job specifications. Collaborate with hiring managers to identify staffing needs and ensure timely fulfillment of vacancies. Employee Relations: Serve as a point of contact for employee inquiries and concerns. Facilitate conflict resolution and disciplinary procedures in accordance with company policies and applicable laws. Promote a positive and inclusive work environment through effective communication and engagement initiatives. Performance Management: Support the performance appraisal process, including goal setting, performance evaluations, and feedback sessions. Provide guidance to managers and employees on performance improvement plans and career development opportunities. Compensation and Benefits: Assist in the administration of compensation and benefits programs. Ensure compliance with legal requirements and internal policies related to compensation and benefits. Handle inquiries and requests related to payroll, benefits, and other HR-related matters. HR Administration: Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records and HR databases. Prepare and distribute HR-related documents, such as offer letters, contracts, and policies. Assist in the development and implementation of HR policies and procedures. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, or a related field. Proven experience in HR roles, with a focus on recruitment, employee relations, and performance management. Knowledge of employment laws and regulations. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong organizational and time management abilities. Proficiency in HRIS software and Microsoft Office applications.

column2: The Senior HR Executive, also known as an Associate HR Manager (AHRM), plays a crucial role in managing and executing various HR functions within an organization     They work closely with the HR team, department managers, and senior leadership to develop and implement HR strategies, policies, and programs that align with the overall business objectives     The Senior HR Executive provides guidance, support, and expertise on a wide range of HR activities, ensuring compliance with legal requirements and promoting a positive work culture       Key Responsibilities:       HR Strategy and Planning:Collaborate with senior management to develop and implement HR strategies aligned with the organization's goals and objectives     Analyze workforce trends and provide recommendations for talent acquisition, retention, and development       Recruitment and Selection:       Coordinate and oversee the recruitment process, including job postings, screening resumes, conducting interviews, and making job offers     Develop and maintain relationships with recruitment agencies and other talent sources     Ensure compliance with legal and company policies during the recruitment process       Performance Management:       Develop and implement performance management processes and systems     Support managers in setting performance goals, conducting performance reviews, and providing feedback     Identify training and development needs based on performance evaluations       Employee Relations:       Act as a point of contact for employees, addressing their concerns, grievances, and disciplinary issues     Promote positive employee relations and foster a healthy work environment     Advise managers and employees on HR policies, procedures, and employment laws       Compensation and Benefits:       Administer compensation and benefits programs, including salary structures, incentives, and employee benefits     Conduct salary benchmarking and analysis to ensure competitive compensation practices     Assist in the implementation and communication of employee benefit programs       HR Administration and Compliance:       Maintain accurate employee records and HR databases     Ensure compliance with labor laws, regulations, and company policies     Prepare HR reports and analytics for management review       Training and Development:       Identify training needs and coordinate the delivery of training programs     Assist in the design and implementation of employee development initiatives     Support career development and succession planning activities
