column2: H R Admin Executive HR assistants are involved with nearly all programs and services that relate to a company s human resources division. Their work ,  which is often decidedly administrative in nature ,  involves documenting grievances ,  terminations ,  absences ,  performance reports ,  and compensation and benefits information. Responsibilities Include:  Provides job candidates by screening ,  interviewing ,  and testing applicants; notifying existing staff of internal opportunities; maintaining personnel records; obtaining temporary staff from agencies.  Pays employees by calculating pay; distributing checks; maintaining records.  Administers student loan ,  medical insurance ,  savings bond ,  and disability programs by advising employees of eligibility; providing application information; helping with form completion; verifying submission; notifying employees of approvals.  Monitors unemployment claims by reviewing claims; substantiating documentation; requesting legal counsel review.  Maintains human resources records by recording new hires ,  transfers ,  terminations ,  changes in job classifications ,  merit increases; tracking vacation ,  sick ,  and personal time.  Orients new employees by providing orientation information packets; reviewing company policies; gathering withholding and other payroll information; explaining and obtaining signatures for benefit programs.  Documents human resources actions by completing forms ,  reports ,  logs ,  and records.  Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications.  Accomplishes human resources department and organization mission by completing related results as needed.  Key Skills:  Must be adept at problem - solving ,  including being able to identify issues and resolve programs in a timely manner  Possess strong interpersonal skills  Communicate clearly ,  both written and orally ,  as to communicate with employees ,  members of the HR management team ,  and in group presentations and meetings  Able to effectively read and interpret information ,  present numerical data in a resourceful manner ,  and skilfully gather and analyze information  Able to prioritize and plan work activities as to use time efficiently  Must be organized ,  accurate ,  thorough ,  and able to monitor work for quality  Must be dependable ,  able to follow instructions ,  respond to management direction ,  and must be able to improve performance through management feedback  Additional Information  No. of Positions: 2  Job location: Bangalore  Salary: Industry Standards

column2: Job Description : We are looking for a skilled and reliable HR Executive to offer Recruitment, Onboarding, Offboarding, Payroll Management, and administrative support to our Company. The Executive will oversee the HR operations and ensure smooth organisational communication and coordination with our employees. Role & responsibilities You will actively engage in recruitment processes, conducting interviews and coordinating hiring efforts to ensure we attract and retain top talent.     We expect you to develop and implement HR policies that promote a healthy work environment and ensure compliance with legal regulations.     You shall organise and oversee employee training and development programs to foster professional growth within our team.     You will manage payroll processing, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and timely execution of all compensation-related activities.     We expect you to handle employee relations, provide guidance, and resolve conflicts in a manner that upholds the company's values and culture.     You shall administer benefits programs, such as health insurance and retirement plans, ensuring employees receive their entitlements and understand their benefits.     You will maintain accurate and confidential HR records, including employment contracts and personal information, adhering to data protection laws.     We expect you to assist in developing and monitoring the company's organisation's overall HR strategies, systems, tactics, and procedures and maintain confidentiality when handling sensitive information.

column2: About the role:       The Human Resource Executive (HRE) plays a vital role in supporting the organization through the development and implementation of human resources strategies and programmes that provides an employee-oriented, high-performance culture. The HRE is responsible for providing support in the various human resource functions, which include recruitment, staffing, training and development, performance monitoring and employee counseling.       Key responsibilities:         Manage the recruitment process and ensure candidates fit the role and company culture.     Coordinate and manage the orientation of new employees, process probationary reviews, employee evaluations and terminations.     Assist in administering a wide range of HR matters in areas such as manpower planning and recruitment, compensation benefits and performance management exercise.     Maintain records and compile statistical reports concerning personnel-related data such as hires, transfers, performance appraisals, and absenteeism rates.     Process and follow up appointments, reassignments, promotions, and other HR decisions which generate personnel administration actions in a timely and thorough way, being sensitive to the human dimensions involved and tailoring actions accordingly.     Advise staff on specific entitlements and explain employment standards and legislation where needed.         Technical Competencies:         Degree in Human Resource Management and/or equivalent.     At least 3 years and above of related working experience in human resource administration         Core Competencies:         Excellent oral, written and inter-personal communications skills, adept at dealing with and engaging people at all levels.     Skilled at establishing and cultivating strong relationships with peers; across different levels of the organization and externally.         Note:       We prefer Immediate Joiners
column11: Executive, HR

column2: The Employee Engagement Manager,  will work with the Service Teams and the unit HR Directors to create a University-wide engagement strategy. The manager will also work with those responsible for supervisor training to integrate engagement concepts into existing and future supervisor training so that strong supervisors become the primary conduit for increasing engagement. The manager will be responsible for the execution and overall communication as it relates to employee engagement initiatives. The manager will be responsible for developing a survey process and metrics that will enable the Academy to track employee engagement progress at both an institution wide and a local unit level. During the survey cycle the manager will partner with the HR directors and the Service Teams to ensure effective administration of the survey. The manager will serve as a subject matter expert on the survey results. After the survey cycle,  the manager will produce both global and local reports that will help the Academy and individual units track progress and create action that drive positive employee engagement. Key Responsibilities Create a comprehensive and sustainable employee engagement strategy  Work with senior leaders and deans to develop strategies and demonstrable links between engagement and their strategic goals  Work with vendors,  Office of Human Resource partners and college and administrative unit Human Resource partners to design,  deploy,  and evaluate effective and efficient engagement surveys  Conduct employee focus groups to complement engagement surveys  Develop a train the trainer program to enable units to analyze their own data and build action plans  Create and/ or edit tools,  training materials,  and resources to help partners and leaders successfully build action plans based on survey results  Create an effective communication plan and provide content for various communication vehicles  Leverage events to create and sustain dialogue around engagement  Identify and address issues and solutions related to employee engagement  Help University leaders determine links between engagement and outcomes such as; turnover,  healthcare costs,  grievances,  student success  Work with cross-functional teams to identify unique division/ location needs while balancing the overall purpose and requirements of the employee engagement strategy  Manage a professional training and development staff Required Education and Experience  Masters Degree Preferable  Minimum of 2 years in direct human resource work or in a closely related field  Minimum 1 years experience in managing a staff  Demonstrated ability to move forward an agenda or initiative Preferred Experience  Strong experience working in partnership with leaders and colleagues to drive results.  Experience interacting with all levels of management/ staff and across organizational lines.  Experience implementing diverse and high impact HR initiatives to support  Organizational Objectives.  Excellent influencing,  leadership,  communication skills - particularly within matrix style organizations.  Experience presenting to different audiences verbally,  in writing and in presentation formats  Experience working with detailed information and numerical data and presenting it in a way that is easily understood by people at different levels in the organization.  Experience with event management  Identifying opportunities for continuous improvement,  based on feedback,  stakeholder engagement,  trend analysis,  etc.  Experience in change management to improve efficiency and effectiveness

Handling end-to-end recruitment process by exploring all the sources and close the positions within timeline.          Exploring all the sources and databank of candidates through Portals, Databank, Social Medias, Contacting and visiting colleges and institutes, Agencies and calling the candidates for initial round of online interview, sending call letter for the interview and coordinate line them up for the personal rounds technical final interview till selection. column2: Skill required:  Talent Acquisition - HR Delivery Strategy Designation:  Associate Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 1-3 Years  About Accenture Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security.Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Technology and Operations services, and Accenture Song all powered by the worlds largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 699,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities.Visit us at www.accenture.com  What would you do? You will be aligned to our Human Resources vertical and will help us in the function that deals with people and people related areas such as recruiting, learning, training, onboarding, compensation and benefits, performance management, organization development and culture. You will be working as a part of HR Operations team which is responsible for providing backend HR services to business operations. HR operations and operational HR services, include administrative services, job analysis, and employee relationship management. This team works on designing, developing, and implementing HR Delivery Strategy to support the end to end employee experience across lifecycle. This includes coaching and advising account/engagement leads and employees when needed and coordinate and deliver HR activities. They work on HR Operations Processes like recruitment, WFA, Benefits, Exit, Payroll, LOA etc. They work on delivery of non-commercial aspects of the outsourcing agreement as well as standards of service (related to quality, effectiveness, productivity, efficiency etc.) What are we looking for? Adaptable and flexible  Ability to perform under pressure  Problem-solving skills  Detail orientation  Ability to establish strong client relationship  Strong customer orientation Extensive and demonstrable experience of Payroll Processes Resilient and able to work under pressure Attention to detail&quality driven in communications and all system transactions Strong communications skills (Written&Verbal) Problem solving skills Team Work&collaboration Willing to work in flexible shifts??weekends Versant score should be 62 Passing the psychometric test a must Work from Office - Mandatory BPO experience Knowledge of MS Excel&Word Knowledge of US Payroll process Bachelor's degree (Any discipline)  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines  Your expected interactions are within your own team and direct supervisor  You will be provided detailed to moderate level of instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instruction on new assignments  The decisions that you make would impact your own work  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a predetermined, focused scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Any Graduation

column2: Skill required:  Employee Services - Employee and Labor Relations Designation:  Assciate Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 1-3 Yrs  What would you do? You will be aligned to our Human Resources vertical and will help us in the function that deals with people and people related areas such as recruiting, learning, training, onboarding, compensation and benefits, performance management, organization development and culture. You will be working as a part of HR Operations team which is responsible for providing backend HR services to business operations. HR operations and operational HR services, include administrative services, job analysis, and employee relationship management. This team works on designing, developing, and implementing HR Delivery Strategy to support the end to end employee experience across lifecycle. This includes coaching and advising account/engagement leads and employees when needed and coordinate and deliver HR activities. They work on HR Operations Processes like recruitment, WFA, Benefits, Exit, Payroll, LOA etc. They work on delivery of non-commercial aspects of the outsourcing agreement as well as standards of service (related to quality, effectiveness, productivity, efficiency etc.) What are we looking for? Adaptable and flexible  Ability to perform under pressure  Problem-solving skills  Detail orientation  Ability to establish strong client relationship  Strong customer orientation Resilient and able to work under pressure Attention to detail & quality driven in communications and all system transactions Strong communications skills (Written & Verbal) Problem solving skills Resilience and ability to work under pressure  Excellent interpersonal skills - can build effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders at all levels Team Work & collaboration Willing to work in flexible shifts & in weekends Versant score should be 62 Passing the psychometric test a must Work from Office - Mandatory BPO experience Knowledge of MS Excel & Word Knowledge of US WFA process Bachelor's degree (Any discipline)  Roles and Responsibilities:  In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems  Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors  In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management  You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments  The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Any Graduation

column2: Skill required:HR Operations - Compensation Administration Process Design  Designation:Management Level - Associate  Job Location:Bengaluru  Qualifications:Any Graduation  Years of Experience:1 to 3 years  What would you do? This role provides client services for Comp & Benefits to ensure tasks are completed correctly and resource efficiencies are maintained, works closely with Delivery Service Management to identify and escalate client issues; obtains and confirms pending information / documentation, and adds and amends transaction information to client/systems responding to changes (via e-mail / telephone) so as to maintain a current visible HR records for the client. You will be working as a part of HR Operations team which is responsible for providing backend HR services to business operations. HR operations and operational HR services, include administrative services, job analysis, and employee relationship management. The Compensation Administration Process Design team is focused on designing processes for performing salary adjustments, providing bonuses/incentives, maintaining salary and job tables, and managing employee stock purchase plan.  What are we looking for? Adaptable and flexible  Ability to perform under pressure  Detail orientation  Problem-solving skills  Ability to establish strong client relationship  " Knowledge of Comp & Benefits and Performance management Processes.  Strong command on written and verbal English language  Knowledge of MS Office/Excel Skills would be a plus  Knowledge of Successfactors would be a plus" Bachelor's degree (Any discipline) "Essentials :  1 - 2 yrs. business experience with Comp & Benifits and Performance management background Desirable:  Exposure to BPO industry " " Strong customer orientation - high level of responsiveness to urgent requests or troubleshooting.  Resilient and able to work under pressure  Organization & prioritisation skills to deliver as per deadlines  Attention to detail & quality driven in communications and all system transactions  Demonstrate high levels of confidentiality  Team Work & collaboration  Multi-cultural awareness  Flexibile to work in Shifts" Roles and Responsibilities " Read, understand and analyze client process as per the business rules.  Execute full range of the process accurately and timely as a hands on processor.  Escalate issues and seek advice when faced with complex issues/problems.  Follow Work Instructions while processing  Highlight any anomalies in Work Instructions/process documentation to the SME/Leads.  Participate in client conference calls, where required and manage appropriate documentation.  Perform Root Cause Analysis on issues faces and suggest appropriate corrective action for current remediation and future control.  Must be able to propose process improvement ideas which can reduce time, improved accuracy or enhance controls  Must have clear understanding of the existing matrices in the process, how they are measured and improvise the measurement system to make it more effective and transparent.  Update process metrics on daily basis and maintain MIS.  Always demonstrate the highest level of customer service.  Pay close attention to detail and follow through to resolve any outstanding issues.  Goes beyond immediate requests and activities to ensure both own and related tasks are completed.  Update client applications accurately and quickly in accordance with the appropriate User Guides.  Ensure assigned tasks are completed accurately in timely fashion.  Ensure and maintain the security and confidentiality of client data.  Activley Participate in team activities & Organizational initiatives"

column2: As a core member of the Employee Life Cycle Management (ELCM) team, you will be responsible for delivering HR Service support to the HR community, business managers and employees. Reporting to the Team Lead, you will provide a high level of support for internal customers, with accurate and timely processing of information for all stakeholders.          Your Responsibilities:           Executing the HR CORE processes through WorkDay and SAP ensuring that Organization Management (OM), Personnel Administration (PA) & Payroll related data accurately according to the global standard processes.         Monitoring payroll relevant data in HR Core (salary, recurring payments etc), whilst ensuring supporting documentation is in place.          Play key role in the lock and unlock process of critical data within HR Core.          Capturing ELCM-related activities into appropriate systems and record the employee queries in an appropriate IT system (ticketing tool) and process ownership of complete employee life cycle from Hire to Retire/ Termination Ensuring execution and delivery of ELCM services according to defined Service Level Agreement(s) like TAT, quality, and Customer satisfaction (C-SAT). Extracting reports for internal data quality through Ad-hoc query, or from customized Transactions codes and willingness to learn and implement the learning in an innovative manner. Your Background           A bachelors degree in any stream.          At least 2 - 3 years of experience in HR Shared Services in a global organization will be advantageous.         Experience in workday, SAP & Service Now is preferred.         Proficiency in MS Office and excellent written and verbal communication skills.          Ability to manage multiple demands on time and work with cross-functional teams.          Quick Learner         A collaborative, solutions-oriented approach, strong analytical skills and a proactive way of working to serve customers with a can-do attitude.          Flexible to work in shifts and ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-tasking, high transaction team environment.

The team is responsible for addressing Employee and HR queries related to payroll inputs in a timely and accurate manner, work with Payroll Providers or 3rd Party Vendors to research and provide resolution. column2: The opportunity  Were looking for candidates who can work with us as Experience Management (EM) POC for assigned SET(s)/industry/sector teams to ensure timely execution of resource scheduling activities and deliver highest quality scheduling support while meeting deployment timelines.  Your key responsibilities Work as subject matter expert on resource management concepts and scheduling tools for the assigned SET(s)/industry/sector teams  Work with GDS Service Delivery teams to create optimized resource portfolios/resource allocation plan on classified accounts/clients.  Proactively identify staffing challenges and provide customized scheduling solutions.  Ensure staffing guidelines are consistently followed within the resource management and Service Delivery teams.  Ensure resource schedules are timely and accurately updated on the scheduling tools.  Optimize resource utilization through effective scheduling strategies.  Supervise and review the execution of resource management and deployment procedures carried out by EY GDS Associates/advanced associates.  Training and development of EM associates.  Identifying and prioritizing opportunities for process improvement/re-engineering.  Develop a strong business continuity framework for self and team.  Develop strong working relationships with GDS Service Delivery Managers/Seniors as well as with experience management/resource management teams onshore. Skills and attributes for success Workforce/Resource Management professional with expertise in scheduling, staffing and resource planning concepts.  Quick decision-making ability to accommodate real time staffing changes/requests.  Strong execution skills with focus on meeting timelines and delivering highest quality service.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Strong working knowledge of MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint.  Excellent teaming and interpersonal skills.  Strong time management and analytical skills.  Stakeholder/client management experience.  At least 1 year of experience in supervising a team will be preferred.  Positive attitude and ability to excel under tight timelines.  Ability to identify staffing challenges and provide proactive solutions. To qualify for the role, you must have Graduates with 3-6 years of post-qualification experience, preferably on resource management, scheduling and staffing concepts. Exposure of short term and long-term resource planning would be an added advantage. Ideally, youll also have Proficiency in using MS ??Office Interest in business and commerciality.  What we look for A Team of people with commercial acumen, technical experience and enthusiasm to learn new things in this fast-moving environment An opportunity to be part of a market-leading, multi-disciplinary team in the only integrated global assurance business worldwide. Opportunity to work with EY GDS Assurance practices globally with leading businesses across a range of industries What we Offer  EY Global Delivery Services (GDS) is a dynamic and truly global delivery network. We work across six locations ??Argentina, China, India, the Philippines, Poland and the UK ??and with teams from all  EY service lines, geographies and sectors, playing a vital role in the delivery of the EY growth strategy. From accountants to coders to advisory consultants, we offer a wide variety of fulfilling career opportunities that span all business disciplines. In GDS, you will collaborate with EY teams on exciting projects and work with well-known brands from across the globe. We??l introduce you to an ever-expanding ecosystem of people, learning, skills and insights that will stay with you throughout your career.  Continuous learning:  You??l develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.  Success as defined by you:  We??l provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.  Transformative leadership:  We??l give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.  Diverse and inclusive culture:  You??l be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs. kindly apply for the Job via below link: https://careers.ey.com/job-invite/1490107/

column2: Create the future of e-health together with us by becoming a Senior Associate- HR Generalist As one of the Best in KLAS RCM organizations in the industry we offer a full scope of RCM services as well as BPO services, our organization gives our team members the training and solutions to learn and grow across variety of technologies and processes.? In this role, you will be responsible for managing and executing a wide range of HR operational activities. This role focuses on ensuring efficient HR processes, optimizing systems and tools, managing employee data, and providing excellent service to stakeholders. What you can expect from us ??   An extensive group health and accidental insurance program.   A safe digital application and a structured and streamlined onboarding process.   Fun at Work: tons of engagement activities and entertaining games for everyone to participate.   Various career growth opportunities as well as a lucrative merit increment policy in a work environment where we promote Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion.   Best HR practices along with an open-door policy to ensure a very employee friendly environment.   A recession proof and secured workplace for our entire workforce.   Our progressive transportation model allows you to choose: You can either receive a self-transport allowance, or we can pick you up and drop you off on your way from or to the office.   Subsidized meal facility. Principal Responsibilities and Duties:   Employee Life Cycle Management - Providing high quality HR administrative support and service to ensure and sustain a great employee experience (onboarding, offboarding, leave of absence, time-off)   Handle employee data administration, including new hires, terminations, transfers, promotions, and employee records management.   Continuously assess and improve HR processes and workflows for efficiency and effectiveness.   Serve as a point of contact for employees' benefit inquiries and provide guidance on available options.   Provide support in handling employee inquiries, concerns, and grievances.   Assist with employee relations activities, including investigations, disciplinary actions, and conflict resolution. Maintain documentation related to employee relations matters.   Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive project milestones and deliverables.   Contribute to change management efforts related to HR initiatives. You are a Good Fit for this Job, if you,   Bachelor?? or master?? in human resources, Business Administration, or a related field.   Minimum 3 years of experience in HR Operations Generalist.   Should be comfortable in Night Shift.   Strong knowledge of HR processes, systems, and best practices.   Excellent attention to detail and data accuracy.   Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.   Effective communication and interpersonal skills.   Ability to handle confidential information with discretion.   Strong organizational and time management abilities. If you are a self-motivated individual with a passion for HR Operations Generalist and a desire to grow in the field of Human Resource, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Convinced? Submit your persuasive application now (including desired salary and earliest possible starting date). We create the future of e-health.  Become part of a significant mission.

Since the last 5+ years we have been working in this Industry alongside large Consulting firms like Big-4s other MNC Management Consulting giants, in offering best of services to drive people effectiveness culture effectiveness within Organizations.     Who do we look for:   It is not easy working in a Young Enterprise. Indeed! We don?t look for talent much. We look for attitude. We look for people who want to discover themselves.       The prime mandate of the role is to work in the People Culture practice of the firm, in ensuring timely quality delivery of Client Projects also enriching thought leadership internally externally. As a senior member of the team, you will be responsible for complete turnkey delivery of Design, Build Execute Frameworks for:     Organization Design Development ? OD   Competency Development   Hipo/Hiper   Developing IDP/CDP/LDP/ESDP   Change Management   Values Behaviors   Performance Management   Balanced Scorecard   EVP Total Rewards   Employer Branding   Succession Planning   Culture Assessment Transformation   Pulse / Engagement Surveys   Key People Assessment   SOPs   Digital Culture   Employee Experience   Ideal Candidate:   Shall have 6-12 years of experience in Human Resources Service Delivery; consulting experience preferred.   Shall have worked on at least some of the stacks mentioned above. The more the better.   One who is energetic a go-getter.   Not the ones who have achieved internal solace nirvana being in the cloud of big brand name plush offices.   Who wishes to be the CEO of his/her role. Shall have a great entrepreneurial spirit.   CREATING VALUES, an Employer of Choice:   We focus on Employee Happiness not on retention:   First one in the industry to have a Happiness Variable Pay   First one in Consulting Industry: Employees being the partner in the firm through Employee Partnership program.   Paid one week Vacations Leave, every year.   Many more of innovative Employee friendly initiatives   Before developing Culture effectiveness for others, we made it for us!

column2: We are seeking a highly motivated and driven HR Associate to join our dynamic human resources team     This position is an excellent opportunity for individuals passionate about launching their careers in HR and gaining hands-on experience in various HR functions     The HR Associate will support the HR department in a wide range of tasks, such as recruitment, onboarding, employee engagement, and HR administration       Responsibilities:        1. Assist in managing the end-to-end recruitment process, including job postings, candidate screening, conducting interviews, and issuing offer letters.        2. Collaborate with managers to create accurate job descriptions and help develop effective recruitment strategies.        3. Maintain updated candidate data in the applicant tracking system (ATS) and ensure compliance with privacy regulations.        4. Support the onboarding process by coordinating paperwork, conducting orientation sessions, and assisting new employees with their integration into the company.        5. Help organize training and development initiatives, schedule sessions, and collect feedback to enhance the learning experience.        6. Assist in employee engagement activities, including organizing team-building events, employee surveys, and recognition programs.        7. Contribute to HR administration tasks such as preparing HR documents, maintaining employee records, generating reports, and handling confidential information.        8. Address employee queries related to HR policies, benefits, and general inquiries in a timely and professional manner.        9. Stay abreast of the latest HR trends and best practices through research and participation in industry events.        10. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support HR projects and initiatives.        Qualifications:        1. Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Psychology, or a related field. An HR specialization is desirable.        2. 1-2 years of experience within HR          3. Knowledge of HR processes and practices, including recruitment, onboarding, employee relations, and HR administration.        4. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to interact professionally with employees at all levels within the organization.        5. Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and handle multiple assignments simultaneously.        6. Proactive mindset and willingness to learn and take on new responsibilities.        7. High level of integrity and ability to maintain confidentiality of sensitive information.        8. Proficiency in using MS Office applications, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.        9. Familiarity with HR software and tools, such as applicant tracking systems (ATS) or human resource information systems (HRIS), is a plus.        10. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with attention to detail.        11. Professional certification or courses in HR management are advantageous.
column11: Analytical skills, HR administration, HRIS, Time management, Employee engagement, HR, Training and Development, MS Office, Human resource management, Team building

column2: The Senior HR Associate is responsible for providing comprehensive HR support to the organization. They will work closely with the HR team and other stakeholders to deliver HR services and programs effectively and efficiently. The Senior HR Associate will handle a wide range of HR tasks, including recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training and development, and HR policy implementation. This position requires strong interpersonal skills, exceptional attention to detail, and the ability to maintain confidentiality      Responsibilities          Recruitment and Selection:            Assist in the recruitment process by posting job advertisements, screening resumes, and coordinating interviews.          Conduct initial interviews and assessments of candidates.          Coordinate pre-employment checks and facilitate the onboarding process.            Employee Relations:            Serve as a point of contact for employees regarding HR policies, procedures, and benefits.          Support managers in resolving employee conflicts and disciplinary issues.          Conduct investigations and recommend appropriate actions.            Employee Engagement:            Actively organise employee engagement activities.          Plan/curate birthdays, festivals and work anniversary celebrations.          engagement activity for better team bonding and mental health and wellness.            HR Policy and Compliance:            Assist in developing and implementing HR policies and procedures.          Stay updated with labor laws and regulations to ensure compliance.          Conduct audits and assessments to ensure adherence to HR policies.            HR Administration:            Maintain employee records and HR databases.          Prepare HR reports and metrics as required.          Assist in HR projects and initiatives as assigned.        Mandatory Qualification and Experience:            Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.          Previous experience in an HR role, preferably as an HR Associate or similar position.          Strong knowledge of HR principles, practices, and employment laws.          Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.          Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with professionalism and integrity.          Strong organizational and time management skills.          Proficient in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite.          Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.          A minimum of 1 year work experience in project handling and management.          Clear and systematic thinking that demonstrates good judgement, expert problem solving, and creativity          Pro-active and self-initiator.

column2: Skill required:  Venures & Acquisition - Talent Management Designation:  HR Ventures & Acquisition Assoc Manager Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 10 to 14 years  What would you do? The HR Solution Architect team partner with our deal teams across Accenture's acquisitions to design solutions across all core components of HR people programmes and processes, to enable the integration of our acquisitions. The team support the end-to-end deal lifecycle, from assessment of an acquisition in diligence, through to designing and implementing solutions to enable the integration of the business. The team has a high executive presence, working closely with acquisitions HR Deal Leads, business sponsors and acquired leadership, alongside reviewing and agreeing solutions with internal stakeholders. What are we looking for? The HR Solution Architect will be assigned to various M&A projects and will be accountable for the success, effectiveness, and on-time delivery of HR due diligence and integration work stream activities.Core Skills &  Qualifications Knowledge across HR & People Programmes -Deep experience across broad range of HR programmes, incl. managing change programmes  Strong analytics/analytical skills (including strong Excel experience)- Able to identify and realize actions based on insight and trends  Total Rewards Experience (Compensation, Equity, Benefits, etc)- Deep experience in designing and developing new reward programmes  Presentation skills (including strong PowerPoint skills)- Able to manage presentations to senior leaders  Highly effective stakeholder and relationship management skills - Holds deep and trusted relationships across a range of senior leaders  Strong project management, leadership/facilitation of all levels of people inside and outside of your organizations-Manages complex programmes and deliverables across multiple projects Risk identification, analysis and management, with previous experience of solution development or escalation.-Ability to identify risk, articulate to stakeholders and walk through mitigations Understanding of HR systems (e.g. HR ERP systems, Performance Management tools)- Understanding of HR tools and how they integrate, and support people processes. Knowledge of HR tech innovation and change programmes. Financial Exposure and commercial awareness-Comprehensive understanding of investment cases and impact of people outcomes to financial results.  Roles and Responsibilities:  Key ResponsibilitiesDue Diligence Phase (includes solution development)-- Define and manage due diligence data validation approach and processes Apply judgement to assess and highlight talent trends and risks, present findings, and influence decisions and integration strategies. Partner with Global and MU HR teams to develop solutions(e.g. TR CoE ,Service Career Arch) Estimate costs for full integration of an acquisition into Accenture. Coordinate across all key stakeholder groups, in particular heavy interaction is expected with Finance and Legal as well as Corporate Development professionals Develop preliminary solution plan for key human resource decisions, including but not limited to compensation, benefits, perquisites, retirement/pension plans, payroll and career/reward architecture, incentives (short-term, long-term, sales force-specific, deferred), culture, HR compliance and policies.  Build strong internal relationships and collaborate with stakeholders to develop preliminary integration recommendations (e.g. Global and local Total Rewards leads, Global Talent Architecture, local HR Business Partners and stakeholders). Drive the development of leadership compensation, Performance and Retention plans and recommendations for acquired workforce. Integration Phase-- Plan and drive HR integration planning and execution activities for each V&A deal Partnering with the broader deal team and internal stakeholders to develop a compelling employee journey in terms of all aspects of talent and people processes and activities; building upon previous solutions and an understanding local HR context.  Develop and deliver integration solutions across a range of key HR processes and critical areas (including career architecture, total reward and performance, HR technology, and people policies).  Participate in solution conversations with acquired leadership including HR and CXO group through the PMI cycle Leverage insight and analysis to shape key integration decisions, supporting the understanding of relevant commercial and talent impacts  Project manage the end-to-end onboarding process for acquired employees; collaborating with other parts of HR Operations & local/global HR to ensure a successful new joiner experience.  Capture learnings and knowledge from the integration journey, sharing this across stakeholders and retaining experience for future acquisitions. Qualification Any Graduation

column2: Human Resources Specialist  Position Overview:  We are seeking an experienced Human Resources Specialist to join at Sreetech. The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years of experience in HR functions, demonstrating expertise in recruitment, employee relations, and HR compliance. Key Responsibilities: Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, including job postings, interviewing, and onboarding. Develop and implement HR policies and procedures in compliance with legal standards. Handle employee relations issues, including conflict resolution and performance management. Conduct regular training sessions on HR best practices and company policies. Maintain and update employee records and HR databases. Administer employee benefits programs and address any related queries. Assist in the development and execution of employee engagement initiatives. Ensure compliance with labor laws and regulations. Prepare HR reports and metrics for management review. Support payroll processing and resolve any discrepancies. Coordinate with department heads to address HR needs and provide strategic support. Foster a positive workplace culture and promote diversity and inclusion. Participate in HR projects and contribute to continuous improvement efforts. Stay current with HR trends and best practices to ensure effective HR management. Provide guidance and support to employees on HR-related matters. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. Minimum of 3 years of HR experience. Strong knowledge of HR laws and regulations. column2: An HR Professional is responsible for executing various human resources (HR) functions within an organization. Key responsibilities include:     Recruiting and staffing: sourcing, screening, and hiring new employees.     Employee relations: addressing and resolving employee concerns, complaints, and conflicts.     Performance management: conducting performance evaluations and providing feedback to employees.     Employee development: creating and implementing employee training programs and career development plans.     Compensation and benefits: administering employee compensation and benefits programs, such as salaries, bonuses, and insurance.     Compliance: ensuring compliance with federal and state employment laws and regulations.     Policy development and administration: creating, updating, and communicating HR policies and procedures.     Employee records management: maintaining accurate and up-to-date employee files and records.     Diversity and inclusion: promoting and fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace culture.     Other HR-related tasks as assigned by management.       Qualifications:       Strong knowledge of federal and state employment laws and regulations.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with employees at all levels of the organization.     Good organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively.     Experience with HR information systems (HRIS) and other HR technology solutions.     Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive employee information.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve HR-related issues.

column2: Position :  HR cum Admin Manager (Urgent Requirement) Location : Hyderabad Industry : Trading & Servicing - Mining & Construction Engineering tools distributors Qualification: MBA / msw  Experience : 5 - 8 years experience HR  Job Summary : The HR Manager is responsible for overseeing all human resources functions ensuring the development and implementation of effective HR strategies and policies to support organizational objectives.  Overall business goals and objectives. Role & responsibilities     Employee Relations : Develop and maintain positive employee relations by fostering a supportive work environment, handling grievances, and promoting open communication channels. Talent Acquisition : Manage the recruitment process for plant positions, including job postings, candidate selection, interviews, and onboarding, to ensure a skilled and motivated workforce. Performance Management : Implement performance evaluation programs to provide timely feedback to employees, identify areas of improvement, and recognize exceptional performance. Training and Development : Assess training needs and coordinate training programs to enhance employee skills, knowledge, and professional growth. Compliance : Ensure compliance with labor laws, regulations, and company policies, minimizing potential risks and legal issues. Employee Engagement : Drive employee engagement initiatives to create a positive work environment that fosters productivity, innovation, and teamwork. Rewards & Recognition  : Foster an environment to reward & recognize for better employee engagement  Health and Safety : Collaborate with safety personnel to maintain a safe work environment, conduct safety training, and promote a culture of safety awareness. Employee Benefits and Compensation : Administer employee benefits programs and manage compensation structures to attract and retain top talent. HR Metrics and Reporting : Monitor and analyze HR metrics to identify trends, make data-driven decisions, and provide regular reports to plant leadership. Conflict Resolution : Mediate and resolve employee conflicts or issues in a fair and impartial manner. Organizational Development : Support organizational change initiatives and develop strategies to enhance organizational effectiveness and efficiency. Admin Activities:  All factory admin activities canteen, facilities and welfare. Preferred candidate profile   Requirements: Masters degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field  Proven experience of 5 - 10 yrs in HR management. Comprehensive knowledge of HR best practices. Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build positive relationships across all levels of the organization. Demonstrated ability to handle sensitive and confidential information. Problem-solving and conflict resolution skills.

column2: Overview: The HR & Administration Assistant will provide support in the daily operations of the human resources and administrative departments. This entry-level role is ideal for a recent graduate looking to start their career in HR and administration. The assistant will handle a variety of tasks, including recruitment, employee records management, office administration, and other duties as assigned by the HR Manager. Key Responsibilities: Assist with the recruitment process, including posting job openings, screening resumes, and scheduling interviews. Support the onboarding process for new hires, including preparing orientation materials and conducting initial training sessions. Maintain and update employee records, ensuring data accuracy and confidentiality. Help with organizing employee engagement activities, company events and meetings. Assist in administering employee benefits programs and responding to employee inquiries. Ensure proper documentation and filing of employee records. Assist in preparing reports and presentations as needed. Help maintain compliance with labor laws and company policies. General Support: Provide administrative support to the HR Manager and other department heads as needed. Perform other duties as assigned to support the efficient operation of the office. Qualifications: Masters in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Strong organizational and multitasking abilities. Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook). Attention to detail and a high level of accuracy. Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion. A proactive and positive attitude, with a willingness to learn and take on new challenges. Work Environment: Full-time position based in the corporate office. Standard office hours with occasional flexibility as needed. Collaborative work environment with opportunities for professional growth and development. Reporting Structure: Reports to the HR & Administration Manager.

column2: Skill required:  Employee Service - HR Delivery - HR Delivery Strategy Designation:  HR Service Delivery Analyst Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 3 to 5 years  What would you do? You will be a part of the Human Resources Shared Services (HRSS) team that supports lateral recruitment of Accenture's Operations entity and will be responsible for building the strategy towards fulfilment of demands and exercising thought leadership in improving the overall delivery efficiency of HRSS services to its clients. This team is accountable for delivery of talent across regions in partnership with regional recruitment teams.You will be a part of the Human Resources Shared Services (HRSS) team that supports lateral recruitment of Accenture's Operations entity and will be responsible for building the strategy towards fulfilment of demands and exercising thought leadership in improving the overall delivery efficiency of HRSS services to its clients. This team is accountable for delivery of talent across regions in partnership with regional recruitment teams.This team works on designing, developing, and implementing HR Delivery Strategy to support the end to end employee experience across lifecycle. This includes coaching and advising account/engagement leads and employees when needed and coordinate and deliver HR activities. They work on HR Operations Processes like recruitment, WFA, Benefits, Exit, Payroll, LOA etc. They work on delivery of non-commercial aspects of the outsourcing agreement as well as standards of service (related to quality, effectiveness, productivity, efficiency etc.) What are we looking for? HR Analytics HR Delivery Strategy HR Policy Development & Maintenance HR Process Design Microsoft Excel Ability to manage multiple stakeholders Collaboration and interpersonal skills Strong analytical skills Written and verbal communication Problem-solving skills  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Any Graduation

column2: Development and implementation of value-added Human Resource initiatives, Industrial Relations, and administrative excellence across all sites in coordination with Site HRs and Site Leaders      Develop and implement comprehensive HR policies to ensure consistency and clarity in HR practices across the organization. This involves regularly updating policies to reflect changes in labour laws, organizational objectives, and industry best practices.      Responsible for recruitment of all open positions PAN in with department heads to prepare job descriptions and manage the recruitment process from job postings to selection.      Create and implement effective onboarding plans for new and oversee daily HR operations Ensure accurate and up-to-date maintenance of both physical and digital employee records.      Address and resolve employee grievances, providing necessary counselling and support. Implement skill gap analyses and implement learning and development programs across all sites. Collecting, analysing, and interpreting HR data to provide insights for decision-making is a key function, along with tracking key HR metrics and preparing reports and dashboards for the Director of HR.      Vendor management and benefits administration for recruitment, benefits management, including overseeing employee benefit plans like Group Medical Cover, Group Personal Accident, Group Term Life, and Gratuity is mandatory.      Plan and Execute employee engagement activities and organize wellness programs to promote employee well-being. Ensure compliance with all statutory requirements related to labour laws and integrated management systems and participating in both internal and external compliance audits. Implementation of HR programs such as the Performance Management System (PMS) and Recognition and Rewards (R&R) programs, as well as driving effective communication programs      Office administration and facility supervision are part of the responsibilities, ensuring the management of office facilities and handling tasks such as travel arrangements, office supplies management, and maintenance coordination.      Managing the termination process ensuring all exit procedures are compliant with company policies and legal requirements ensuring timely processing of final settlements and necessary documentation for exiting employees.            Qualifications            Experience & Education           A masters in human resources administration is a must      Minimum 8 to 12 years of experience in HR activities related to the Employee Life Cycle.      Experience working at a corporate office will be an added advantage.      Preferably in Manufacturing and steel/cement industries with knowledge of the Contract Labor Regulation Act (CLRA).      Extremely good hands on experience on MS Office          Skills and Knowledge           Strong understanding of labour laws and regulations, including wage and hour laws, safety regulations, and other employment-related laws.      Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail in policies, procedures, and systems.      Effective communication abilities across all levels of internal and external stakeholders.      Excellent knowledge of HR analytics, reporting, statutory compliance, and labour laws (across different states of India).      Experience with leave management systems, PMS, ERP processes.      Awareness of the latest talent acquisition systems and processes.      Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and MS Visio.

column2: The Team Lead serves for Talent Insights team in the International HR organization. This role will have a dotted-line management reporting to TI leadership role reporting to Human Resources - Talent Insights. The team lead will provide guidance, coaching and direction to the non-US team to manage the prioritization, assignment, and performance of work. This team member should have management experience and be an expert in HR analytics with experience building dashboards (preference on Workday, but a minimum using Excel, Tableau, Domo or similar) that improve the user experience and provide insights to support decision making. The associate must have ability to solve complex problems and find innovative solutions, must have strong collaboration skills to work across functions and facilitate collaborative problem solving. The associate will be responsible for developing solutions alongside team members while also providing leadership and support to the team               JOB RESPONSIBILITY             Responsible for managing and executing the workforce analytics strategy, serving as an active advisor to the business.              Primary duties may include but are not limited to: Makes recommendations for workforce solutions, Partners with internal clients to enhance organizational success by adding context and relevancy to analytical information and connecting-the-dots to drive tangible business value.              Leads increasingly complex national and global talent analytics initiatives and works proactively to develop and implement solutions.              Provides direction and support to junior level staff, acts as coach and mentor to the Talent Insights team.              Provides consultation and recommendations for leveraging data to improve business performance for complex and varied organizations, and enterprise initiatives.              Performs data mining, analytics, data interpretation and statistical modeling to drive improved workforce outcomes.              Develops data mining techniques, reports, statistical methodologies, predictive models, and analytical capabilities using structured and unstructured data.              Connects program and process data to performance outcomes, develops advanced dashboards, scorecards, metrics, and indices reflective of learning, workforce and business objectives.              Interprets and explains the implications of data on performance and the business and provides expert recommendations for action to drive individual and organizational performance improvement.              Trains and promotes use of dashboards and other interactive analytical reporting tools.              Develops and articulates study findings to key stakeholders and varied audiences, and crafts actionable recommendations to improve business outcomes.              Consults with Human Resources, Learning & Development and the Business to evaluate needs, formulate the analytics plan, select appropriate data elements and metrics, determines and conducts data sourcing and extraction techniques, identifies and reports data trends, correlations and causations, conducts statistical modeling and analysis, and advises end-users regarding interpretation and best use of information to optimize workforce outcomes to drive individual and organizational performance improvement                 QUALIFICATION             Bachelors/master s in engineering in related field preferred ; MS preferred              Requires BA/BS in business or math related field and minimum 10 years of data collection and analysis experience.                 EXPERIENCE             10+ years of experience                 SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES             Working experience in Workday, reporting, workday analytics, complex reporting           Skill Level of proficiency (Scale 1 to 10) 10 being the highest (kindly list the skills)           MBA or advanced degree preferred             Experience leading analytics teams             Expertise in data translation, storytelling and advanced visualization             Advanced knowledge of Workday reports, dasbhoards, including Prism analytics             Expertise using Tableau, Domo, Alteryx, Visier or other data blending and visualization tools

column2: Skill required:HR Operations - Talent Management  Designation:Management Level - Associate  Job Location:Mumbai  Qualifications:Any Graduation  Years of Experience:1 to 3 years  What would you do? You will be aligned to our Human Resources vertical and will help us in the function that deals with people and people related areas such as recruiting, learning, training, onboarding, compensation and benefits, performance management, organization development and culture. You will be working as a part of HR Operations team which is responsible for providing backend HR services to business operations. HR operations and operational HR services, include administrative services, job analysis, and employee relationship management. column2: Skill required:Talent Acquisition - Recruitment  Designation:Recruiting Specialist  Qualifications:Any Graduation  Years of Experience:7 to 11 years  What would you do? You will be aligned to our Human Resources vertical and will help us in the function that deals with people and people related areas such as recruiting, learning, training, onboarding, compensation and benefits, performance management, organization development and culture. Key Responsibilities: Track and ensure closure of all recruiting related actions identified through internal and external reviews / audits. Conduct a periodic review of all recruiting manuals and review responsibilities and accountability defined in entity recruiting and HRSS manuals to identify conflicting roles, responsibilities and access between these teams. Carry out checks of all recruiting processes across entities, by process, by team and by city. Report concerns or anomalies, if any, to the relevant recruiting lead. Partner with the relevant teams to review any new process and technology change that is being driven in entity / HRSS recruitment teams from risk perspective. Conduct review post introduction of new process and technology changes to assess awareness and effectiveness of implementation. Work with the AEE Risk and Compliance team to conduct periodic forensic analytics of recruitment data. Analyze candidate escalation data to identify potential issues and share with RPT (Recruiting Process & Technology) and delivery teams to fix. Fraud escalations- work with CI and ER to understand the process and technology fixes required and bring to RPT and delivery teams to design and execute. Partner with the concerned internal teams to carry out regular access rights reviews to hiring tools in HRSS and entity teams. column2: As a Tech hiring Specialist, youll be a part of the technology hiring team that is building JioCinema and play a pivotal role in attracting and securing top tech talent.              What You ll Do?           Payroll :    Obtain tax regime updates from new hires and update the information in the system. Gather salary details from HR Business Partners (HRBP) for employees who have resigned and update the status monthly. Maintain monthly compliance and other Management Information Systems (MIS). Possess basic knowledge of General Ledger (GL) clearing. Upload manual payments on the bank portal if necessary. Upload Sodexo details on the Sodexo portal for new employees, process Sodexo payouts, and distribute Sodexo cards to employees. Analyze employee salary slips and resolve employee queries        Final Settlement :    Obtain clearance approvals from various stakeholders. o Calculate final settlements for exited employees and update SAP within Service Level Agreement (SLA). Share final settlement statements and pay slips with employees. Calculate and process gratuity payouts to employees within given timelines        Reimbursement Audit:    Perform monthly reimbursement audits for claims made by employees. Process different reimbursements through Employee Self Service (ESS), verify documents uploaded by employees, and update them for payment. Send audited remarks to employees for revalidation. Update inputs in Payroll for employees who have not submitted correct invoices. Maintain monthly and yearly trackers for audited reimbursements    Investments:    Audit investment documents uploaded by employees in various investment heads such as HRA, house loan interest, SEC80D, SEC80C, etc. Link NPS Permanent Retirement Account Number (PRAN) with corporate vendors and provide weekly updates on the status. Share NPS contribution details with corporate vendors       Compliance:    Coordinate with consultants to update compliance MIS on a monthly basis. Collect Form 11 and EPS confirmation from new hires and share the same with consultants. Coordinate with consultants and finance team on monthly PF, ESIC, P-tax, and LWF payments and challan preparation. Update UAN number and EPS details in SAP. Handle PF queries of employees and resolve them with the help of consultants        ADHOC SUPPORT :    Provide support on other ADHOC HR payroll activities and execution when required         Who Should Apply?          Education and Qualifications:    Minimum graduate in any field, with preference given to candidates holding an MBA in HR       Work Experience:    Minimum of 5 years of prior work experience in HR or HR Operations. Mandatory prior experience of 2-3 years in designing compensation inputs       Preferred Experience:    Prior experience in managing contract employees and/or insurance will be preferred       Skills:    Excellent proficiency in MS Excel. Strong analytical and decision-making abilities. Good knowledge of labor law and compliance regulations. Strong communication skills. Demonstrated orientation towards employee service

column2: A Data Services Consultant for UKG is an integral member of a dynamic organization responsible for data conversion in the field of Human Capital Management. The consultant is accountable for delivering top-quality SQL development and data consulting services to our customers and is responsible for accurately converting data from customers source system(s) into UKG Pro. Skills essential to this role are strong SQL, knowledge of HCM and Payroll, analysis, consulting, organization, written and verbal communication. Functional and technical knowledge of HCM and Payroll systems is good to have. Knowledge of any ETL tool is desired. The candidate is expected to work during US shift and be flexible for other shifts as applicable per the organization needs. The night shift here refers to 6 PM to 3 AM IST to provide full overlap to US customers. On some days the consultant will have flexibility based on project work or customer call. The candidate is also responsible for interacting with other businesses and technical project stakeholders to gather business requirements and ensure successful delivery. The candidate should be able to leverage the strengths and capabilities of the software tools to provide an optimized solution to the customer. The candidate must have good communication skills and able to effectively communicate ideas both verbally and in writing at all levels in the organization, from executive staff to technical resources. The role requires working with the Program/Project manager, Solution Consultant, and customer representative to deliver the solution based upon the defined design requirements and ensure it meets the scope and customer expectations. Primary/Essential Duties and Key Responsibilities: Provide three to ten (3-10) statements, in order of importance, that describe the major activities/functions for which an employee in this job is held accountable.  Collaborate and conduct a full and thorough data analysis and provide input to customers and internal teams on best practices for data conversion and data cleanup Interpret, validate, and convert data from source system(s) to target system including demographic data, taxation, benefits, payroll balances, additional tables, contacts, dependents, beneficiaries, and optional data including job history, status history, check detail history, platform configurable field data, and complex elements (e.g., system setup tables, employee pictures and documents) Utilize available data conversion tools, templates, and documentation to promote efficiency and standardization in compliance with approved data conversion methodology Utilize available ETL tool to extract and convert data from source system reports Proactively communicate with peers, internal teams, and customers to keep them apprised of project status and ensure they are on track with assigned responsibilities and project timeline and effectively implement change-control Create required post conversion documents including Issues and Assumptions and Tax Verification Schedule and successfully complete multiple projects within the timeline required Provide input on data conversion methodology and process improvements Maintain high level of productivity, supporting multiple projects, and meet assigned productivity and project requirements Provide support to peers (e.g., mentoring, knowledge transfer) including developing and delivering knowledge transfer sessions on new tools and processes as needed/requested Serve as an escalation point for resolving issues with converted data Provide ideas and support to functional project resources to promote efficiencies and increased customer satisfaction levels Successfully assist or shadow System Consultant on implementation projects in order to gain a better understanding of system configuration and apply that knowledge to add more value during the data conversion process  Qualifications Strong SQL skills and Knowledge of any ETL tool Customer-focused, positive and professional attitude Strong communication and interpersonal skills Able to work independently with minimal supervision A self-directed team player: collaborative, seeks input, accepts and incorporates feedback from others, freely offers assistance Organized, detail oriented, accurate and responsive Results driven orientation, Good listening skills Ability to work in a fast-paced environment Strong decision making and problem-solving skills Strong analysis and task and time management skills (Experience, Education, Certification, License and Training) Bachelors degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related field. A minimum of 5 years of experience in SQL Database, Programming, and Transact SQL Experience working in project teams

column2: Assistant Manager - HR Generalist Position Overview: We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Assistant Manager - HR Generalist to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for a wide range of HR activities including contract employee onboarding, attendance monitoring, payroll management, employee engagement programs, and compliance checks. This role requires a meticulous and proactive individual who can manage multiple tasks efficiently and ensure smooth HR operations.   Key Responsibilities: 1. Contract Employee Onboarding: Facilitate the onboarding process for contract employees, ensuring all necessary documentation is completed. Notify managers before the joining date of new employees. Ensure agreement and NDA signing are completed promptly. Create employee IDs and set up biometric face ID systems. 2. Attendance Monitoring: Monitor and maintain attendance records for both full-time employees (FTE) and contract employees. Ensure accurate and timely recording of attendance data. Monitor and maintain accurate attendance records for all employees. Address and resolve any attendance-related issues or discrepancies. 3. Payroll Management: Run payroll processing, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies. Handle payroll-related queries and issues efficiently. Coordinate with finance for payroll reconciliation and ledger validation. 4. Incentive, Engagement, and Performance Programs: Assist in the design and implementation of employee incentive programs. Plan and execute employee engagement activities to enhance workplace morale. Support performance management processes, including appraisals and feedback sessions. 5. Odoo Bill Upload and Reconciliation: Manage the upload of bills and expenses into the Odoo system. Perform regular reconciliation to ensure accuracy and consistency in financial records. 6. Compliance and Documentation: Conduct PF, PT, and ESI checks to ensure compliance with statutory requirements. Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records and documentation. Prepare and present reports on HR metrics and activities as required. Processes enrollments, changes, and terminations of employee from control sheet Manages billing and payments for contractors and other vendors Assists with the preparation of annual reports and audits related documents Conduct orientation sessions and facilitate the integration of new employees into the plant environment. 7. HRIS and Reporting: Maintain accurate employee records in the HRIS system. Prepare and present regular reports on HR metrics and activities. Ensure data integrity and confidentiality of employee information. 8. Safety and Health: Collaborate with the safety team to ensure compliance with health and safety regulations. Promote a culture of safety and wellness within the plant. Manage employee health and safety programs and initiatives. 9. Performance Management: Support the performance appraisal process, including feedback sessions and performance improvement plans. Assist in identifying training and development needs for plant employees. Coordinate and facilitate training sessions and workshops.  Qualifications:  Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.  2-4 yrs. experience as an HR Generalist or in a similar role.  Strong knowledge of HR processes, policies, and compliance requirements.  Proficiency in HRIS systems, preferably Odoo.  Excellent organizational and time-management skills.  Strong interpersonal and communication skills.  Ability to handle sensitive information with confidentiality.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).

What youll be doing         Payroll Preparation: Prepare payrolls for India and other key geographies, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and timeliness. This includes processing various payroll transactions and providing regular reports to key partners     Off-Cycle Payments: Prepare off-cycle manual payments as needed, including the necessary calculations and system entries     Payroll Auditing: Audit payroll data and reports for errors, and resolve any identified payroll issues     Issue Resolution and Customer Service: Address payroll issues, resolve concerns in a timely manner, and provide excellent customer service to stakeholders. This includes resolving inquiries related to payroll earnings, deductions, and tax withholding     Compliance and Project Assistance: Ensure payroll compliance with company policy and local tax legislation, and assist with payroll projects, including M&A integrations and system implementations         What were looking for         Software Proficiency: Demonstrated proficiency in payroll and HRIS software, Microsoft Office Suite, and other databases, with a preference for advanced Excel skills     Regulatory Knowledge: In-depth knowledge of payroll regulations, tax laws, reporting requirements, and labor legislation in India, with experience in processing payroll for other geographies(ex. European region)     Analytical Skills: An analytical individual with high attention to detail, excellent problem-solving skills, and a proficiency for accuracy     Adaptability and Process Management: Ability to work in a regularly changing and fast-paced environment, balancing speed and quality, and thriving in a role involving manual and automated processes in a transactional-based payroll environment     Communication and Collaboration: Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to effectively collaborate across the company, experience with equity reporting (RSU s and Stock Options), and a strong understanding of process controls         You might also have         Experience with processing payroll in Workday     Experience processing payroll with Cloudpay     Payroll related Certification
