column2: What you ll do in this role:        The Human Resources Administrator performs a range of administrative and client service functions related to human resources. They work closely with the entire HR team and partner closely with finance and IT to ensure a smooth and seamless employee experience.      The HR Administrator will support the daily needs of employees, becoming our first line of contact for employee inquiries, and often the person answering questions or directing employees to the appropriate resource. The HR Administrator will also be responsible for basic functions within People Operations including records and file maintenance, HRIS data entry, coordinating onboarding and other employee events.       You will:        Manage the QBHR email to answer employee requests and questions, direct them to self-service options, or refer them to appropriate HR team members     Answer frequently asked questions from employees related to employment policies, benefits, hiring processes, etc.     Complete Forms I-9, verify I-9 documentation and maintain I-9 files     Manage all onboarding activity from scheduling and employee communication through coordinating internal resources     Perform HRIS maintenance including data entry and generating reports; work closely with HRIS Manager to ensure data maintenance is accurate and timely; conduct audits on a regular schedule     Assist with processing all employee changes including onboarding, offboarding, status and manager changes, compensation updates, etc. This includes updating HR systems, generating employee status change letters, and collecting signatures as required     Maintain accurate and up-to-date human resource files, records, and documentation; conduct periodic audits of HR files and records to ensure required documents are collected and filed appropriately     Work closely with the Global Head of People Operations to facilitate immigration cases including liaising with outside counsel, tracking immigration status, coordinating documentation, and collecting employee questions for response     Manage the employee intranet, including setting up the site, coordinating with internal partners to ensure content is up-to-date and accurate, identifying new and interesting content for employees       Ideally, you ll have:        6 months to 1 year of experience in a business environment     Exposure to human resources a plus; interest in human resources a must     High level of comfort with technology including research, collaborative tools, and office systems     Attention to detail and discretion when working with confidential data      Outstanding organizational skills     Strong intellectual curiosity, willingness to ask questions and desire to participate in changing systems and processes     Able to discern when to refer questions and when to answer them     Good judgement

column2: We are looking for an HR Administrator to support our Human Resources department. You will act as the first point of contact for HR-related queries from employees and external partners. As an HR Admin, the main administrative duties include maintaining personnel records, managing HR documents (e.g. employment records, Customer Records, Transaction Records) and updating internal databases. Our ideal candidate has experience with HR procedures and can juggle various administrative tasks in a timely manner. Ultimately, you should be able to ensure our HR department supports our employees while conforming to labor laws.          Duties and Responsibilities:            Organize and maintain personnel records          Update internal databases (e.g. record sick or maternity leave)          Prepare HR documents, like employment contracts and new hire guides          Revise company policies          Liaise with external partners, like insurance vendors, and ensure legal compliance          Create regular reports and presentations on HR metrics (e.g. turnover rates)          Answer employees queries about HR-related issues          Assist payroll department by providing relevant employee information (e.g. leaves of absence, sick days and work schedules)          Participate in HR projects (e.g. help organize a job fair event)            Requirements and Skills:            Proven work experience as an HR Administrator, HR Administrative Assistant or relevant role          Experience with HR software, like HRIS or HRMS          Computer literacy (MS Office applications, in particular)          Thorough knowledge of labor laws          Excellent organizational skills, with an ability to prioritize important projects          Strong phone, email, and in-person communication skills

column2: About Webenza: Webenza is a dynamic digital agency dedicated to delivering innovative and impactful digital marketing solutions. We specialize in crafting engaging and effective digital strategies that help our clients achieve their business goals. As a growing organization, we are looking for a motivated and experienced HR Manager to join our team and help us build a thriving, productive, and happy workplace. Job Summary: The HR Manager will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of human resources practices and processes. This role includes managing recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training and development, rewards and recognition, attendance and payroll, and ensuring compliance with HR policies and employment laws. The ideal candidate will have a passion for people, excellent communication skills, and a strategic mindset to drive HR initiatives that align with our business objectives. Key Responsibilities: Recruitment and Onboarding: Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract top talent. Manage the full recruitment cycle, including job postings,       candidate screening, interviewing, and selection. Oversee the onboarding process to ensure a smooth transition for new hires. Employee Relations: Act as a point of contact for employee concerns, grievances, and conflicts. Foster a positive and inclusive work environment through regular communication and engagement activities. Address and resolve employee issues in a timely and effective manner. Performance Management: Develop and implement performance appraisal systems and processes. Provide guidance and support to managers and employees on performance-related issues. Identify training and development needs and facilitate appropriate programs to enhance employee skills. HR Policies and Compliance: Ensure compliance with labor laws and regulations. Develop, implement, and maintain HR policies and procedures. Stay updated on changes in HR regulations and best practices to ensure the company's compliance. Rewards and Recognition: Develop and implement a comprehensive rewards and recognition program. Create initiatives to recognize and reward high performance and achievements. Organize and manage regular award ceremonies, appreciation events,       and other recognition activities. Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of recognition programs and make improvements as needed. Attendance and Payroll: Oversee and manage attendance tracking systems to ensure accurate records. Supervise payroll processes to ensure timely and accurate salary disbursements. Address and resolve any payroll-related issues or discrepancies. HR Metrics and Reporting: Track and analyze HR metrics to identify trends and areas for improvement. Prepare and present HR reports to senior management. Use data-driven insights to inform HR strategies and initiatives. Employee Engagement and Retention: Develop and implement initiatives to enhance employee engagement and retention. Conduct employee surveys and feedback sessions to gauge employee satisfaction. Organize team-building activities, recognition programs, and other engagement initiatives. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field (Masters degree preferred). Minimum of 4 years of experience in HR management, preferably in a digital agency or similar environment. Strong understanding of HR practices, labor laws, and employment regulations. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Proven ability to manage multiple priorities and projects. Strong problem-solving and conflict-resolution skills. Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite. Certification in HR (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR) is a plus. Skills and Competencies: Strategic thinking and business acumen. Ability to build and maintain effective working relationships. High level of integrity and confidentiality. Strong organizational and time management skills. Adaptability and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
column11: HR Generalist Activities, employee engagement, recruitment, joining formalities, Grievance Handling, employee relations, administration, Exit Formalities, hr operations, Induction Program, Rewards And Recognition, HR Strategy, Performance Management, HR Policies

column2: Company Description RoundGlass was built on the vision that wellbeing should be at the very center of our life journey. We are not only reimagining how the world experiences wellbeing, but how companies (like our own) support the wellbeing of their people. We??e a group of talented, socially-conscious, gritty, innovators using technology and human energy to create a vibrant wellness ecosystem. Together, we??e built an amazing community and we are always looking for people who share our passion. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. RoundGlass will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities who need assistance applying for a job. We rely on legitimate interest as a legal basis for processing personal information under the GDPR for purposes of recruitment and applications for employment. Role Description This is a full-time, on-site role for a Human Resources Intern located in Mohali district. As a Human Resources Intern at Roundglass, you will be responsible for assisting with day-to-day HR tasks, such as managing HR policies, employee benefits, personnel management, and HR administration. You will gain valuable hands-on experience in a diverse and collaborative work environment dedicated to promoting wellbeing. Qualifications Human Resources (HR) skills Experience in HR management and personnel management Knowledge of HR policies and procedures Familiarity with employee benefits administration Relevant skills and qualifications that would be beneficial: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Attention to detail and strong organizational abilities Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills Knowledge of local labor laws and regulations Experience with HR software and systems Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. This is a paid 6 months Internship ; having a possibility of converting into Full Time employment depending on the performance during the internship.

Benefits Administration: Administer employee benefits programs such as health insurance, retirement plans, and other perks. Training and Development: Identify training needs and develop programs to enhance employee skills and knowledge. Coordinate and facilitate training sessions and workshops. Monitor and evaluate training program effectiveness. Performance Management: Assist in the implementation and management of performance appraisal processes. Provide guidance to managers and employees on performance evaluation procedures. Support the development and implementation of performance improvement plans. Compliance: Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations. Maintain and update employee handbook and HR policies. Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with HR policies and procedures. HR Systems and Reporting: Maintain HR Information System (HRIS) and ensure accurate and up-to-date employee records. Generate and analyze HR reports and metrics to support decision-making. Identify opportunities for process improvements and efficiencies. Policy Implementation: Develop, update, and communicate HR policies and procedures. Ensure consistent application of policies across the organization. Provide training and support to managers and employees on policy matters. Compensation and Payroll: Assist with the administration of compensation programs, including salary reviews and adjustments. Coordinate payroll activities and ensure accurate and timely payroll processing. Address payroll-related inquiries and issues. Employee Engagement and Culture: Promote and support initiatives that enhance employee engagement and organizational culture. Plan and execute employee engagement activities and events. Conduct employee surveys and analyze feedback to improve workplace environment. HR Projects and Initiatives: Participate in and lead HR projects and initiatives aimed at improving HR processes and programs. Collaborate with cross-functional teams on various organizational projects. Stay current with HR trends and best practices to recommend and implement improvements. Our Story   Founded in 2021 by Stanford University dropouts, Aadit Palicha and Kaivalya Vohra,   Zepto is India?? fastest growing e-grocery company valued at $1.4 Billion following its   recent Series-E fundraise of $200 Million from marquee global investors including   StepStone Group, Goodwater Capital, Y Combinator Continuity, Kaiser Permanente,   Nexus Venture Partners, Glade Brook Capital, and Lachy Groom. Headquartered in   Mumbai, Zepto is present across 10 major cities in the country, 1000+ employees   strong, and delivers 5000+ products, including fresh fruits and vegetables, daily   cooking essentials, dairy, health-and-hygiene products, etc., to Indian homes within   10 minutes. Through strong tech capabilities, an efficient business model, and a   network of highly optimized delivery centers across its 10 locations, the company is   revolutionizing the Indian grocery segment currently pegged at $600 Billion, making it   easier and more convenient. Beyond groceries, Zepto has also introduced a cafe   offering that allows customers to order Coffee, Chai, and other Caf items, along with   their groceries.   ? column2: Position Title: Human Resource Manager Job Summary:  As the Human Resource Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of human resources management within the resort. This includes recruitment, training, employee relations, performance management, and compliance with labor laws and company policies. You will work closely with department heads and senior management to develop and implement HR strategies that support the resort's goals and objectives while fostering a positive and productive work environment. Key Responsibilities: Recruitment and Selection: Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract and retain top talent. Conduct interviews, evaluate candidates, and make hiring recommendations. Coordinate the onboarding process for new employees, including orientation and training. Training and Development: Identify training needs within the resort and develop training programs to address them. Coordinate employee training sessions and workshops. Monitor employee performance and provide feedback to facilitate growth and development. Employee Relations: Serve as a point of contact for employee inquiries and concerns. Address employee grievances and mediate conflicts as needed. Promote a positive work culture and foster employee engagement initiatives. Performance Management: Develop and implement performance management systems to evaluate employee performance. Conduct performance reviews and provide constructive feedback to employees. Recognize and reward outstanding performance and address underperformance through coaching and corrective action. Compliance: Ensure compliance with all relevant labor laws and regulations. Maintain accurate employee records and documentation. Stay updated on changes in employment legislation and update policies and procedures accordingly. HR Administration: Manage employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other perks. Process payroll and maintain accurate payroll records. Oversee administrative tasks related to HR, such as maintaining employee files and managing HR software systems. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, or related field. A master's degree or HR certification (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR) is preferred. Proven experience in HR management, preferably in the hospitality industry or a similar customer service-oriented environment. Strong knowledge of employment laws and regulations. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to handle confidential information with integrity and discretion. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Proficiency in HRIS (Human Resources Information Systems) and MS Office Suite. Key Competencies: Leadership Problem-solving Decision-making Teamwork Adaptability Conflict resolution Strategic thinking Customer focus Reporting:  This position typically reports to the General Manager or Director of Operations. Working Conditions:  The role of a Human Resource Manager in a resort may require flexibility in working hours, including weekends and holidays, to accommodate the needs of the business and the employees.

Description:-  Recruitment Plan   Create a recruitment plan, with timelines and deployment of recruiter details, priority level etc.  Track progress against plan, changes in priorities etc.  Create and circulate MIS giving updates  Manpower Requisition & JD    Follow a defined process of manpower requisition form to trigger the process  Ensure JD are in place for all recruitment positions  Sourcing of Candidates     Job Portals    Evaluate and select best portal services suiting our requirements  Ensure recruiters are trained for best use of portals and improved search skills  Conduct search for positions on portals, provide shortlisted candidate for screening to recruitment managers  Use portal help to refine searches   Recruitment Agencies    Use defined process to enlist recruitment agencies  Track performance of the agencies with the use defined process  Use of Social Media    LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter handle, to be used for sourcing and creating brand awareness amongst candidates  Actively update company profile and opening on social media platforms  Sourcing through Personal Network    Send out requirements to networks outlining clear profile specifications  Follow defined SOPs in using network, forwarding profiles, and soliciting candidates  Follow a standard procedure in responding to reference candidates, both for shortlisted and rejected  Create data bank of network influencers, community outreach volunteers for ease of use and retrieval  Procedure to appreciate a referee whose candidate has been selected  Processing incoming resumes    Use standard formats for compilation and presentation to recruiting manager  Create and use tracking sheets to map progress on any open position  Using standard response time system to deal with resumes and especially responded ones  Hold telephonic / web initial screening interviews by following standard questionnaire to gather/ verify / clarify required information  Use standard system, digital or manual to records interview highlights  Use a standard company introductory information sheet for communicating with candidates  Schedule in person or next round of interviews by clearly following defined process of reimbursement of travel expenses for outstation candidates  Use interview rating sheet to maintain record of interview discussions  Ensure  Data Base of candidates    Maintain database of shortlisted candidates digitally with coding for ease of retrieval  Periodically update database, remove redundant resumes

column2: The professionals to provide support to customers in the Maritime industry globally in their efforts to make the right decisions to achieve profitable and sustainable results.                                      We are a leading provider of services and products to the Maritime industry covering wider Ocean economy having the capabilities, experience, and track record to deliver high value assurance, mobilizing the full potential of customers assets and operations, putting technical matters and business decisions into meaningful context to achieve optimal results. Business Advisory combines deep domain expertise with an understanding of the industry and its stakeholders to assist customers tackle the transformations in the industry and ensure safe, digital, and sustainable solutions.                                             To work collaboratively with a range of technical specialists on a broad range of projects, lead and coordinate Strategy and business advisory services and related deliverables, work closely with clients, develop new areas of business and mentor others in the team.                                                           What we offer you                                                           Competitive Salary                                     The opportunity to work for an organization that has a strong sense of purpose, is values driven and helps colleagues to develop professionally and personally through our range of people development programmes.                                                                                The role                                                   Coordinate multi-disciplinary teams to develop integrated strategies and business solutions provide subject matter expert advice to key clients.                                 Lead and participate in projects focusing on operations transformation, efficiency improvement, operating model design, business-side support of system implementations etc                                 Work across investment value chain with specific focus on Techno-commercial due diligence, Process optimization and Supply chain.                                 Manage technical and commercial aspects of bid development and project delivery while drawing in expertise from our global LR group.                                 Support business development with opportunity identification, proposal development and thought leadership.                                 Demonstrate understanding of Consulting service offerings and ability to communicate their value.                                 Develop client relationships through interactions with client personnel, possibility to participate in business development activities.                                 Contributing to engagement planning and ensuring that products/deliverables meet contract/workplan.                                 Gather data and research information from a range of sources to provide clear, well-written technical reports.                                 Competently undertake own work to an excellent standard and review the work of others, on time and to budget.                                 Being able to manage clients needs in a confident, professional manner.                                 To assess / recommend the time / value of the work to be undertaken for an internal / external client within an agreed fee / cost structure.                                 To discuss / present the deliverable with the internal / external client and be able to suggest alternative solutions where appropriate.                                 To pursue Continuous Professional Development and maintain a high degree of discipline, knowledge, and awareness.                                 To assist in service delivery improvement by communicating internal / external client feedback as appropriate.                                 To coach other employees, as appropriate, and disseminate information to achieve effective knowledge transfer and application.                                             What you bring                                                         Minimum Engineering/bachelor degree or equivalent from a recognized university and Masters in Management.                                 Experience in Business/Management Consulting, preferably from Big 4 Consulting Firms or other strategy/management/Boutique consulting firms.                                 8+ years of experience in the Maritime Industry with focus on Port sector                                  Conducted port consultancy studies, e.g. port development strategy, data analysis and presentation, port capacity calculations, Green and smart port feasibility studies.                                 Experience in the use of structured problem-solving approaches / frameworks.                                 Highly effective communication skills, both written and verbal, and the ability to build strong relationships with a range of clients.                                 Strong facilitation skills that are adaptable to different situations and communications styles                                 Experience conducting analysis (desktop research, data analysis, reviewing documents, interviewing etc.) and synthesizing into digestible outputs (e.g. reports, presentations)                                 Experience with creating business development materials.                                 Able to prioritize and work effectively under pressure.                                 Strong report writing, verbal and presentation skills and able to review the work of others to ensure quality.                                 Good interpersonal skills and an ability to communicate issues and ideas effectively.                                 Be flexible, adaptable, and prepared to take on new challenges and work from other LR or client office locations.                                 Be highly self-motivated, possessing strong enthusiasm and commitment to delivering sustainable outcomes.                                 Proficiency in the English Language commensurate with the work.

column2: Dear Candidate, We have an opening for HR Manager for Mulund Location. Title :- HR Manager Job Description  Recruitment: Adherence to Recruitment Guidelines Overview the sourcing of the profiles available from the recruiter in adherence to the requirement-Raise a flag in case of an on-adherence to SOP. Work with the recruitment team in Sourcing candidates, scheduling interviews in case Hiring managers are rejecting candidates talking to them and problem solving. Ensure that the hiring should be within budget and parity. Induction & Onboarding: Ensure to follow Pre-onboarding, Onboarding & Induction process for New joiners Joining Formalities & Documentation. Attendance & Leave Management: Preparing End to End Attendance & leave for permanent, contract & casual employees, including Overtime & other statutory compliances. Escalate issues of absenteeism, late marks, half days or any irregularities to Seniors (HR Manager, HOD, BU Head etc.) for appropriate action as per the protocol. Ensure information on stop payment etc for employee absconding from work / escalations concerning employee indiscipline or Misconduct matters. Grievance Handling: Responding to the tickets raised in HRIS system within the timelines Employee Engagement Calendar: Create and submit HR Calendar ( Employee Engagement) for business unit Plan and execution events as per Calendar Compliances, Audit and Record Management, HRMS - Data Maintenance MIS & Reporting & Payroll: Employee life cycle management in HRMS & proper documentation in place Manage BU JDs & structure Internal/External Audits Documentation and records management Payroll Input Medical Insurance Data management. Process and SOP: Ensuring HR SOP is adhered to in all processes Exit Formalities: Ensure correct Full and final settlement inputs are sent; Follow up and ensure recovery of any type is made Full and final settlement to be issued to staff. Confirmation Process: Probation Confirmation- timely process on HRIS. Increment Process: Prepare an increment sheet and share with the leaders for the recommendation. Once recommendation is done work closely with TSL to close final increments. Prepare the salary break ups and roll out the increment letters in a timely manner. MIS: Maintaining & updating MIS report regularly. Other Projects Planning & Implementing R&R program for respective BU: Attrition Management Work on Annual Appraisal process for respective BU as per Year ending process. Rev & Dev: Prepare matrix of each individual and ensure it to be signed off by RM & HOD Check the survey report and remind everyone to get 100% responses. Once a report is made, cross check the report with the data. Time:- 7:45am to 4:15pm             8:30am to 1:30pm(For Alternate Saturday)

Strong influencing and communication skills including experience of coaching senior management on a range of people and wider organizational issues. column2: We are looking for a detail-oriented, highly organized, service-minded individual to join our global HR team as an HR Generalist. Maintain integrity of HR data, specifically within the system. Prepare coordinating paperwork for employee changes, i.e. promotion, Manage offboarding process for exiting employees.              This includes preparing and ensuring proper execution of paperwork, updating internal stakeholders (i.e. payroll, IT, etc.), conducting exit interviews, and compiling exit data, all in a timely fashion.              Assist HRBP in ongoing daily support of the business, specifically in matters of employee relations and performance management.              Build and maintain highly effective/collaborative partnerships with cross-functional teams such as Talent Acquisition, Compensation, Benefits, HRIS, Payroll, Finance and IT. Quick thinker/fast learner with a business mentality who will handle assignments, tasks, and projects. Positive attitude with a customer focus and professional demeanor.

column2: JOB DESCRIPTION : At Quantum Leap, the human resources team is dedicated to understanding and addressing the needs of our people to foster a productive and positive work environment. In this role, you'll develop and implement strategies that align with our values, handle compliance, and manage training and development programs. Join us at Quantum Leap, where our success begins with fostering a thriving workplace for our employees. At Quantum leap, we understand that our business thrives when our employees thrive, and it begins with hiring the right human resources team. Job type: Full time  Age: 28 - 37 Y/O  Location: Bangalore  Academic qualification: Bachelors degree in Human Resources  Desired Experience: Minimum 6 years of work experience in HR operations. Well versed in HRIS Responsibility Deliverables: Enhances the organizations human resources by planning, implementing, and evaluating employee relations and human resources policies, programs, and practices.  Provide a dedicated and eective HR advisory service to employees that covers absence and health issues, conduct and capability, grievances, organizational change, and all other employee-relations matters  Be the primary backup for payroll processing, including monthly updates to employee files, bonus/incentive pay, vacation/sick pay, expense reimbursements, hourly-employee validations, and benefits changes  Assist in the communication, interpretation, and upkeep of employee handbook, employee directory, and organizational chart, and contribute to policy development.  Maintains knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in human resources, talent management, and employment law.   Attends and participates in employee disciplinary meetings, terminations, and investigations.   Develop and implement employee engagement programs, such as recognition and reward programs, surveys, Birthday & Anniversary celebration and training sessions Manage employee relations, including addressing employee concerns, facilitating conflict resolution, and coaching managers on HR-related issues.  Collaborate with department heads to develop and implement programs that support the organizations mission and goals.  Performance Evaluation and Reviews  Schedule, conduct, liaise, evaluate, half yearly and yearly performances of employees. Post perf review  collate completed appraisal documents and communicate perf ratings, bonus, promotions, hikes in company letter head document. Save the same in central repository.  Employee Development Plan  Work with every employee to create a training/development plan based on their role and competence matrix. Based on the development plan  execute the plan.  Report to management and provide decision support through HR metrics  Ensure legal compliance throughout human resource management  Nurture a positive working environment Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or a related field  At least 6 years of experience in human resources.  Prior experience as an HR Generalist or in a related position.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  Ability to work independently and as part of a team  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.  Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.  Thorough knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations.  Proficiency with or the ability to quickly learn the organizations HRIS and talent management systems. Note: This Is a full-time role based in Bangalore and will require you to work from the offce.   Website:  https://rajivtalreja.com/ Company:  https://quantumleap.co.in/  Instagram:  https://www.instagram.com/rajivtalreja/ Youtube:   https://www.youtube.com/c/RajivTalrejaD LinkedIn:  https://www.linkedin.com/in/rajivtalreja/

column2: Varroc Engineering Pvt Ltd is looking for HR Generalist to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey. An HR Generalist is responsible for executing various human resources (HR) functions within an organization. Key responsibilities include: 1.	Recruiting and staffing: sourcing, screening, and hiring new employees. 2.	Employee relations: addressing and resolving employee concerns, complaints, and conflicts. 3.	Performance management: conducting performance evaluations and providing feedback to employees. 4.	Employee development: creating and implementing employee training programs and career development plans. 5.	Compensation and benefits: administering employee compensation and benefits programs, such as salaries, bonuses, and insurance. 6.	Compliance: ensuring compliance with federal and state employment laws and regulations. 7.	Policy development and administration: creating, updating, and communicating HR policies and procedures. 8.	Employee records management: maintaining accurate and up-to-date employee files and records. 9.	Diversity and inclusion: promoting and fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace culture. 10.	Other HR-related tasks as assigned by management. Qualifications: 1.	Strong knowledge of federal and state employment laws and regulations. 2.	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with employees at all levels of the organization. 3.	Good organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively. 4.	Experience with HR information systems (HRIS) and other HR technology solutions. 5.	Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive employee information. 6.	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve HR-related issues.

We are here to be your reliable partner, offering a wide range of premium solutions that will help your projects reach new heights of accomplishment. Job Description: The HR Manager will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of human resources management, including recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training and development, legal compliance, and strategic planning. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in HR management, excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and a passion for fostering a positive work environment. Key Responsibilities: Develop and implement  HR strategies  and initiatives aligned with the overall business objectives. Oversee the  recruitment and selection process, including sourcing candidates, conducting interviews, and making hiring decisions. Conduct new employee orientations and ensure a smooth onboarding process. Develop and implement strategies to attract and retain top talent. Manage employee relations issues, including conflict resolution, disciplinary actions, and grievance handling. Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations. Conduct audits of HR activities to ensure compliance with policies and procedures. Administer employee benefits programs and ensure compliance with relevant regulations. Lead performance management processes, including goal setting, performance evaluations, and coaching. Develop and deliver  training programs  to enhance employees' skills and knowledge. Stay up-to-date with changes in employment laws and regulations and ensure compliance. Analyze HR metrics and data to identify trends, track progress, and make data-driven decisions. Collaborate with department head to address staffing needs and support organizational growth. Handle confidential employee information with sensitivity and discretion. Participate in strategic planning discussions and contribute HR expertise to decision-making processes. Foster a positive work environment and promote employee engagement and morale. Continuously seek opportunities to improve HR processes and practices to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and trust at all levels of the organization. column2: Job Title: HR Manager Location: Vasant Kunj, New Delhi Company Overview: English Browne India Limited  is a dynamic and rapidly growing company dedicated to Hygiene and Health . We are committed to fostering a positive work environment where employees can thrive and contribute to our collective success. As we continue to expand, we are seeking a skilled HR Manager to join our team and play a key role in supporting our employees and organizational objectives. Job Summary: The HR Manager will be responsible for overseeing various aspects of human resources functions including talent acquisition, payroll processing, employee relations, and employee performance management. This role requires a strategic thinker who can effectively implement HR initiatives that align with the company's goals and values while fostering a positive work culture. Responsibilities: 1. Talent Acquisition:    - Develop and implement recruitment strategies to attract top talent.    - Manage the full recruitment lifecycle, including sourcing, screening, interviewing, and onboarding.    - Collaborate with hiring managers to understand staffing needs and develop job descriptions.    - Utilize various recruitment channels, including job boards, social media, and professional networks.    - Build and maintain relationships with external recruitment agencies and partners. 2. Payroll Processing:    - Oversee payroll processing and ensure accuracy and timeliness of payments.    - Manage payroll-related inquiries from employees and provide support as needed.    - Stay updated on relevant laws and regulations regarding payroll and ensure compliance.    - Collaborate with finance department to reconcile payroll and resolve any discrepancies. 3. Employee Relations:    - Serve as a point of contact for employee relations issues and concerns.    - Address employee grievances and conduct investigations when necessary.    - Provide guidance and support to managers on employee relations matters.    - Develop and implement policies and procedures to promote a positive work environment. 4. Employee Performance Management:    - Develop and implement performance management processes and systems.    - Coordinate performance reviews and provide support to managers and employees.    - Assist in identifying training and development needs for employees.    - Work closely with management to address performance issues and develop improvement plans. Qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field (Master's degree preferred). - Proven experience in HR management with a focus on talent acquisition, payroll processing, employee relations, and performance management. - Strong knowledge of employment laws and regulations. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. - Ability to handle confidential information with discretion. - Strong organizational and problem-solving abilities. - Proficiency in HRIS and payroll software. Join us at English Browne India limited and be part of a dynamic team dedicated to excellence and innovation in the HR field. If you are passionate about fostering a positive work environment and supporting employee growth and development, we want to hear from you! Apply now by submitting your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and qualifications.

column2: Key Responsibilities: 1.   Recruitment and Onboarding: Partner with hiring managers to develop effective recruitment for required profiles. Manage the full-cycle recruitment process, ensuring a positive candidate experience. Welcome new hires and guide them through our onboarding process, setting them up for success from day one. 2.   Employee Relations: Facilitate employee engagement initiatives in collaboration with the culture team. Collect feedback to enhance engagement strategies and ensure activities are well-planned and communicated in advance. Enhance job satisfaction by resolving issues promptly, applying new perks and benefits, and organizing team building activities. 3.   Performance Management: Support our performance review process, helping employees and managers set and achieve their goals. Provide advice on performance improvement plans and career development opportunities. 4.   Compensation & Benefits: Assist employees with benefits enrollment and any related questions. Manage leave requests process and ensure compliance with laws and company policies.  5.   Policy and Infrastructure Oversight:  Review and update HR policies and procedures in consultation with management. Monitor office infrastructure and maintain secure systems for holding confidential and sensitive information in collaboration with the Administrative Director. 6.   Training and Development: Identify training needs and assist in creating and delivering training programs. Coordinate development initiatives, supporting our teams growth and advancement. 7.   HR Metric & Analytics: Prepare and analyze HR reports to provide valuable insights to management. This includes gathering relevant data, conducting thorough analyses, and presenting findings in a clear and actionable manner. 8.   Payroll: Prepare and manage monthly salary sheets and individual salary slips for all employees. Ensure accurate and detailed salary breakups for each new hire joining the organization, reflecting their specific compensation package. Additionally, maintain a systematic approach to update and verify payroll information regularly.  Qualifications: Bachelors/Masters degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. 1-2 years of experience in an HR Generalist role or similar. Strong Communication skills are required.  Strong knowledge of HR practices, employment laws, and regulations. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Strong organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks. Discretion in handling confidential information. Key Competencies: Strong problem-solving and conflict resolution abilities. High attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team. Adaptable and flexible in a dynamic environment. Strong ethical standards and integrity.

column2: *Position Overview:* We are seeking an experienced and enthusiastic Human Resources Manager to oversee all aspects of our HR practices and processes. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in HR management, excellent communication skills, and a deep understanding of the interior design industry. This role will be critical in fostering a positive work environment, ensuring compliance with labour laws, and supporting the professional growth of our team. *Key Responsibilities:* - Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy. - Manage the recruitment and selection process, including job postings, interviewing, and hiring. - Oversee employee onboarding to ensure a smooth integration for new hires. - Manage performance appraisal systems that drive high performance. - Maintain and update employee records and HR databases. - Ensure legal compliance throughout human resource management. - Provide support and guidance to management and employees on HR-related issues. - Develop and implement employee engagement and retention programs. - Coordinate and manage benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other employee benefits. - Handle workplace investigations, disciplinary procedures, and conflict resolution. - Promote a positive and inclusive company culture. *Qualifications:* - Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. - Proven experience as an HR Manager or HR Generalist, preferably in the design or creative industry. - In-depth knowledge of labour law and HR best practices. - Strong organizational and leadership skills. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. - Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion. - Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite. - SHRM-CP or PHR certification is a plus. *Why Join Us:* - Be part of a creative and dynamic team passionate about design. - Opportunity for professional growth and development. - Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. - Collaborative and inclusive work environment. - Work on exciting projects with high-profile clients. *How to Apply: * If you are a motivated HR professional looking to make an impact in a creative industry, we would love to hear from you! Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are interested in this position to   info@creativehandsindia.com   Creative Hands India Private Limted  is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

column2: As the HR Manager for India, you will be responsible for overseeing all end-to-end HR operations within the country with the help of one HR Executive reporting to you. You will play a pivotal role in shaping and executing HR strategies in alignment with the company's objectives. Reporting directly to the CEO and the Country Head, you will be the key point of contact for all HR-related matters in India. Additionally, you will collaborate with the global HR team to drive and implement global HR initiatives, providing a unique opportunity to expand your expertise in global HR practices.  Job Description: Strategic HR Leadership: Develop and execute HR strategies that align with the company's goals and objectives, ensuring a high-performing and engaged workforce. Employee Relations: Foster a positive work environment by handling employee relations matters, resolving conflicts, and promoting open communication channels. Ensure employee satisfaction and engagement in India. Talent Acquisition and Retention: Aid the global recruitment team in their efforts while implementing retention strategies to attract, source, interview, onboard and retain top talent locally. Performance Management: Aid the global performance management lead to implement performance management systems and processes that ensure fair and transparent evaluation of employee performance and facilitate career development opportunities. Compensation and Benefits: Manage compensation and benefits programs, ensuring competitiveness in the market and compliance with legal requirements. Compliance and Legal: Stay updated on employment laws and regulations in India, ensuring compliance with statutory requirements and company policies. HR Analytics and Reporting: Utilize HR data and analytics to provide insights and recommendations for improving HR processes and decision-making. Employee Lifecycle Management: Ensure smooth and efficient onboarding and offboarding processes, overseeing the entire employee lifecycle to ensure an impeccable employee experience. Training and Development: Identify training needs, develop training programs, and coordinate learning initiatives to enhance employee skills and competencies. Global HR Initiatives: Collaborate with the global HR team to drive and implement global HR initiatives, contributing to the development of consistent HR practices across the organization. Team Management: Provide leadership and guidance to one HR Executive in India, fostering their professional growth and development. Job Specification: Bachelor's degree in human resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Master's degree preferred. Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in HR management, with a strong understanding of HR practices in India. Understanding of multiple countries is advantageous. Experience in collaborating with global HR teams and managing global HR initiatives is highly desirable. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Proven track record of effectively managing HR operations and driving organizational change. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.
column11: HR Policies, Performance Management System, HR Policy Formulation, HR Strategy, Employee Welfare, HR Operations, Performance Management, Employee Retention, HR Analytics, Employee Grievances, Recruitment

column2: As a Senior Manager of HR ( Recruitment and Training ), you will play a pivotal role in shaping and implementing the recruitment and training strategies to attract, develop, and retain top talent. You will manage the end-to-end recruitment process and implement effective training and development programs. Your primary responsibilities will include:         Talent Acquisition Strategy: Developing and implementing comprehensive strategies aligned with the company s goals and objectives. Identifying the staffing needs, workforce planning, and collaborating with hiring managers to understand their requirements.         Job Advertising and Sourcing: Creating and posting job advertisements online and offline to attract a diverse pool of qualified candidates. Utilising innovative sourcing techniques like social media, professional networks, and industry-specific channels.         Candidate Screening and Selection: Conduct thorough candidate screening, including resume reviews, phone screenings, and interviews. Assessing candidates qualifications, skills, and cultural fit to make informed hiring decisions. Coordinating and participating in panel interviews and managing the selection process.         Employer Branding: Developing and promoting the company s employer brand to attract and engage top talent. Collaborating with marketing and communication teams to create compelling employer brand messaging, career website content, and recruitment materials.         Recruitment Metrics and Reporting: Implementing and maintaining recruitment metrics and analytics to measure the effectiveness of sourcing strategies, candidate pipeline, and time-to-fill metrics. Generating regular reports and insights to drive data-driven decision-making and continuous improvement.         Training Needs Analysis: Collaborating with department heads and managers to identify skill gaps and training needs across the organization. Conducting training needs assessments and analyzing performance metrics to design relevant and impactful training programs.         Training Program Design and Delivery: Developing and delivering comprehensive training programs that align with business objectives and employee development plans. Utilising various training methods, including classroom sessions, e-learning modules, workshops, and on-the-job training.         Leadership and Professional Development: Designing and facilitating leadership development programs to enhance the skills and capabilities of managers and supervisors. Providing coaching and mentoring support to high-potential employees and emerging leaders.         Training Evaluation and Feedback: Implementing mechanisms to measure the effectiveness of training programs, including participant feedback, assessments, and post-training evaluations. Analysing feedback and making necessary adjustments to improve the training offerings continuously.         Employee Career Development: Collaborating with managers and employees to create individual development plans and career paths. Providing guidance and support in identifying growth opportunities, acquiring new skills, and pursuing professional certifications.         Compliance and Policy Adherence: Ensuring training programs and recruitment practices comply with relevant laws, regulations, and company policies. Keeping abreast of industry trends, best practices, and legal requirements related to recruitment and training.       Qualifications and Skills:       Master s degree in Human Resources     Proven experience in recruitment and talent acquisition, preferably in the technology or system integration industry.     Strong knowledge of recruitment strategies, sourcing techniques, and candidate selection methodologies.     Experience in designing and delivering training programs, preferably focusing on technical and leadership development.     Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to build relationships with candidates, employees, and stakeholders.

implementing HR policies, procedures, and initiatives that support the organization's goals and objectives     Here are the key responsibilities and qualifications associated with the role of an Executive in Human Resources:     Responsibilities:     Recruitment and Talent Acquisition: Coordinate and manage the recruitment and selection process, including job postings, resume screening, interviewing, and candidate evaluation     Collaborate with hiring managers to identify staffing needs and ensure the timely acquisition of qualified candidates     Employee Onboarding and Offboarding: Facilitate the onboarding process for new hires, including conducting orientation sessions, explaining company policies, and ensuring a smooth transition into the organization     Manage offboarding activities, such as exit interviews and separation procedures, to ensure a positive and professional experience for departing employees     Performance Management: Assist in the implementation and administration of performance management programs     Support managers in conducting performance evaluations, setting goals, and providing feedback to employees     Collaborate with Investigate and address employee grievances, complaints, and disciplinary issues in accordance with company policies and applicable employment laws     Compensation and Benefits Administration: Assist column2: An HR Professional is responsible for executing various human resources (HR) functions within an organization.          Key responsibilities include:         Recruiting and staffing: sourcing, screening, and hiring new employees.     Employee relations: addressing and resolving employee concerns, complaints, and conflicts.     Performance management: conducting performance evaluations and providing feedback to employees.     Employee development: creating and implementing employee training programs and career development plans.     Compensation and benefits: administering employee compensation and benefits programs, such as salaries, bonuses, and insurance.     Compliance: ensuring compliance with federal and state employment laws and regulations.     Policy development and administration: creating, updating, and communicating HR policies and procedures.     Employee records management: maintaining accurate and up-to-date employee files and records.     Diversity and inclusion: promoting and fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace culture.     Other HR-related tasks as assigned by management.         Qualifications:         Strong knowledge of federal and state employment laws and regulations.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with employees at all levels of the organization.     Good organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively.     Experience with HR information systems (HRIS) and other HR technology solutions.     Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive employee information.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve HR-related issues.
column11: ERP, MS Data management, Succession Planning, HR Head, MIS, Reports, Talent Management, Human Resources, Stakeholders, HR Policies, Recruitment, Talent Acquisition

column2: HR Operations Manager     Location: Noida, Bangalore    We are a young educational-technology start-up that is charting new routes in the domain of professional education. Going beyond the traditional focus on data concepts, Dattrained takes a wider approach in introducing students to the real world of data. This includes an immersive development of logical reasoning and an inquiry-based approach tailored towards building a data aptitude.     There is a stark difference in the data analytics that is typically taught in the current aura and the real world data sets/analytics/issues which is often described as the most beautiful and high paying. The datatrained mission is to reveal this beauty of data to young college students and aspiring professionals thus helping them develop a holistic understanding of data sets and how to explore and visualize them to solve real-world problems.     We are looking for people who share our vision, are passionate about data and have the potential to become thought leaders in the field.     1. Act as Head HR for the area and assume total responsibility for the function   2. Be knowledgeable and expert in recruitment of front-line sales team at representative, group leader, and team leader level   3. Field-oriented person to work closely with sales team to understand their work, help them recruit & retain people   4. Visit branches for issues and HR support   5. Employee engagement activities to form a good team and bonding   6. Knowledgeable in e_HRMS or SAP with good knowledge of excel sheets (formula, mail merge, V look up, pivots ...)   7. Vendor management   8. Relationships with sources of recruitment, colleges, NGOs, skill building colleges and institutes, consultants to hire sales reps at lowest cost (around 1000 per candidate) thru these sources and advertisement/referral   9. Set up fixed or mobile camps for recruitment   10. Partner HO initiatives for HR and central schemes   11. column2: Brief Role :  Senior Human Resources Manager  Exp. Req. 10 -  20 yrs;    Job Description   The successful candidate will drive the HR agenda across Asia with particular focus on building a high performance work culture,  ensuring high engagement,  driving strong talent practices,  and addressing employee relations issues. The position will be based in Bengaluru,  India and focus on HR issues in various IEEE subsidiaries in the Asia region,  including offices in China,  India,  Japan,  and Singapore.  This role will deliver day to day Human Resources services in the areas of culture management,  employee relations,  learning and development,  talent management,  talent acquisition,  compensation,  and benefits and wellness. The Sr. HR Manager will have on- site operational oversight of human resources activities in the global offices. This includes coordination of the hiring process,  administration of compensation and benefits programs,  performance and talent management,  employee engagement,  assessment and investigation of employee relations issues,  and delivery of training and educational events. This position ensures compliance with and enforcement of local and national labor and employment laws and regulatory guidelines. He/  She will also develop human resources policies,  review with legal counsel,  and communicate these policies using various mediums.  This position will report functionally (dotted line) to the Director,  Employee Development Partners in Piscataway,  NJ and will report administratively to the Director of India Operations. The position will also take direction from the Senior Director of Asia Business Operations based in Beijing. Functioning with minimal supervision,  the Sr. HR Manager must be a strong collaborator and team member with the ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with internal customers.   Essential Functions  Assess current levels of delivery and identify future needs for various HR functional areas,  including compensation,  benefits,  employee relations,  talent management,  training and development,  staffing,  communications,  employee engagement,  and organization culture. Recommend and implement changes to processes and practices to improve the quality of HR functions leading to increased engagement and organization effectiveness. Implement staffing process,  including job posting requisition,  sourcing of candidates,  interviewing,  selection,  onboarding,  and advising managers and employees on systems. Partner with Learning and Development to plan,  develop and deliver seminars and training,  as well as other training initiatives. Support talent management initiatives,  including succession planning and talent reviews,  career development initiatives,  leadership development,  etc. Assess,  investigate and mediate complex issues; document progress and resolution. Prepare documentation for terminations,  final settlements,  severance checks,  separation agreements and releases,  and other materials required for employment termination. column2: The HR Generalist is responsible for the day-to-day management of HR operations, which means that they manage the administration of the policies, procedures and programmes of the organisation.  This is a role requiring someone who enjoys planning and developing systems, has real attention to detail but particularly is interested in the personal development of the organisation s people. Working as a Human Resources Generalist can provide many career opportunities to move upward within the HR function as the skills acquired as some of the most useful for any organisation and are highly valued.  Job Responsibilities:   An HR Generalist is usually required to consider staffing logistics and take responsibility for recruiting staff for the organisation. You may also be required to contribute to space planning.  A key responsibility for a Human Resources Generalist is the personal and professional development of the organisation s personnel, which involves employee orientation, development and training.  Employee welfare, safety, wellness and health and counselling is an important area of work for the Human Resources Generalist and involvement in the development and implementation of policy documents and handbooks that can be referred to by employees.  HR policy development and documentation in line with the company s corporate vision.  You will also be involved in performance management working closely with senior management within the organisation.  The Human Resources Generalist is required to develop compensation and benefits systems that fit the company s HR responsibilities.  Communication with the whole company is generally generated by the Human Resources department and the HR Generalist, you will be a key member of any decision making process regarding employee communication and the originator of any content sent to employees. Key Skills:   You must be educated to degree level. You may also be required to hold qualifications related to human resources  You will have had previous experience in the role of Human Resources Generalist or a very similar position and be able to demonstrate your complete understanding of the position  A Human Resource Generalist must be able to analyse and present information  You must be extremely well organised and methodical in your approach to problem solving and be able to manage filing/database system  Excellent communication skills are a pre-requisite for a HR Generalist as you will be dealing with employees on every level  You must understand the legalities of business law in relation to HR and employee employment rights and how to apply them within your day-to-day work, company policy documentation and staff welfare  Additional Information  No. of Positions: 2  Job location: Bangalore  Salary: Industry Standards
column11: ERP, MS Data management, Succession Planning, HR Head, HR Generalist, Reports, Talent Management, Human Resources, Recruitment, Talent Acquisition, MIS, Stakeholders, HR Policies

column2: Your role involves leading the HR operations and talent engagement practices of the firm by partnering with HR and Business leadership.      You will be responsible for people processes spanning the entire      employee life cycle from onboarding to exit.      You will lead the employee engagement initiatives of theorganization and partner with business leaders to drive retention of talent.              Position Reports to:    Head Human Resources          The key aspects of your role are as follows :            Support HR leadership and business stakeholders in the design and implementation of highly effective, results-driven talent engagement and people practices.      Review and draft HR policies and processes in line with business needs and aligned with labour regulations.      Provide guidance, counsel and support to employees and managers on employee relations matters and workplace concerns.      Lead the implementation of processes related to employee grievance handling, disciplinary actions, performance improvement plans, investigations and resolution of employee issues.      Responsible for employee engagement and communication efforts such as townhalls, offsites, team building events, focus group meetings, team huddles, employee helpdesks.      Lead the planning and execution of performance management processes from goal setting to year end performance evaluations.      Drive the Diversity and Inclusion initiatives of the firm.      Create insightful reports and analysis of data to examine employee attrition. Recommend actions and interventions to problem solve challenges from time to time.      Demonstrate passion for the people agenda of the firm and partner in designing and implementing robust and progressive people practices. Thought Partnering    - Collaboration with stakeholders, demonstrating conceptual thinking, complex problem solving, keeping updated with market developments.        Judgement    - Maintain a balanced perspective and have a nuanced understanding of employee issues. Demonstrate fairness and good judgement while making people decisions.        Delivering Output    - Producing high quality, accurate content for trainings, relevant reports, dashboards, and MIS to guide leadership actions.        Collaboration and Teamwork    - Partnering with others on projects and contributing as a part of the team.        Communication Skills    - Confident and strong communicator, representing EZ adequately. have a professional demeanor          Required knowledge/experience:        Master s degree in Human Resources from a reputed institute.      6 to 8 years of experience in HR with at least 4 years in HRBP role.      Knowledge of Indian labour laws and compliance norms.      Hands on experience of managing PIP and Disciplinary actions.      Superior verbal and written communication skills and expertise with MS-Office (Word, PowerPoint & Excel)

column2: Job Description: We are looking for an experienced and dedicated HR Generalist to join our team. The ideal candidate will handle a variety of HR functions, including recruitment, employee engagement, payroll, exit processes, attendance, and general HR operations. This role is crucial in supporting our employees and ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of our HR department. Key Responsibilities: Recruitment: Manage the full recruitment lifecycle, including job postings, sourcing, screening, interviewing, and onboarding. Collaborate with department heads to understand staffing needs and ensure timely hiring. Conduct reference checks and prepare employment offers. Employee Engagement: Plan and execute employee engagement activities and programs to foster a positive work environment. Conduct employee surveys and analyze feedback to improve workplace satisfaction. Organize team-building events, wellness programs, and recognition initiatives. Payroll Administration: Process payroll accurately and on time, ensuring compliance with relevant laws and regulations. Maintain and update payroll records, including deductions, bonuses, and benefits. Address payroll-related inquiries and resolve discrepancies promptly. Exit Processes: Manage the employee exit process, including conducting exit interviews, processing termination paperwork, and ensuring a smooth offboarding experience. Analyze exit interview data to identify trends and areas for improvement. Attendance and Time Office Management: Monitor employee attendance and manage leave records. Ensure accurate and timely recording of working hours, overtime, and time-off requests. Address attendance-related issues and provide support to employees regarding time office policies. HR Operations: Maintain and update employee records in the HRIS system. Ensure compliance with company policies, labor laws, and regulations. Assist in the development and implementation of HR policies and procedures. Provide support and guidance to employees on HR-related matters. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, or related field. Proven experience as an HR Generalist or similar role. Strong understanding of HR practices, labor laws, and regulations. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Proficiency in HRIS and MS Office applications, particularly Excel. Ability to handle sensitive information with confidentiality and professionalism. Job Duration & Timings: This is a full-time position.

column2: Position Title:  HR Executive Department:  Human Resources Reports To:  HR Manager/Director Location:  Thoothukudi  Employment Type:  Full-Time Job Summary: As an HR Executive at [Company Name], you will play a key role in managing the human resources operations specific to the shipping and logistics industry. Your responsibilities will include recruitment, employee relations, performance management, compliance with labor laws, and the development of HR strategies aligned with the company's goals. You will ensure a positive and productive workplace, supporting the dynamic needs of our shipping and logistics operations. Key Responsibilities: Recruitment and Selection : Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract qualified candidates for various roles within the shipping and logistics sector. Conduct interviews, evaluate applicants, and coordinate with department heads to fill open positions promptly. Employee Onboarding and Offboarding : Facilitate smooth onboarding processes for new hires, including orientation and training programs. Manage the offboarding process, conducting exit interviews, and ensuring compliance with company policies. Performance Management : Implement and oversee performance appraisal systems to evaluate employee performance. Work with managers to set performance goals and provide coaching and feedback to employees. Compensation and Benefits : Administer and manage employee compensation and benefits programs, ensuring competitiveness and compliance with industry standards. Address employee inquiries related to payroll, benefits, and other compensation matters. Employee Relations : Serve as a point of contact for employee concerns and grievances, ensuring issues are resolved fairly and promptly. Promote a positive work environment through employee engagement initiatives and activities. Compliance and Labor Laws : Ensure compliance with all relevant labor laws and regulations specific to the shipping and logistics industry. Maintain and update HR policies and procedures in accordance with legal requirements and industry best practices. Training and Development : Identify training needs and coordinate training programs to enhance employee skills and performance. Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of training initiatives and make improvements as necessary. HR Information Systems (HRIS) : Maintain accurate employee records using HRIS and other relevant systems. Generate reports and analyze HR data to support decision-making processes. Health and Safety : Collaborate with the Health and Safety department to ensure workplace safety standards are met. Promote a culture of safety and compliance within the organization. Strategic HR Initiatives : Assist in the development and implementation of HR strategies that align with the companys business objectives. Participate in HR projects and initiatives aimed at improving organizational effectiveness and employee satisfaction. Qualifications: Education : Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Experience : Minimum of 3-5 years of HR experience, preferably in the shipping and logistics industry. Skills : Strong knowledge of HR principles, practices, and employment laws. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Proven ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize effectively. Proficiency with HRIS and other HR-related software. Strong problem-solving and conflict-resolution skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Certifications : HR certification (e.g., PHR, SHRM-CP) is a plus. Working Conditions: Office environment with occasional visits to operational sites, including shipping docks and warehouses. Ability to travel as needed to various company locations. How to Apply: Interested candidates should submit their resume and cover letter to [vishnupriya.a@cielhr.com].

column2: The Payroll Analyst position is responsible for managing and supporting our global payroll process for our payrolls in the APAC region. The ideal candidate will have excellent payroll management skills and implementing payroll process improvements and strong project management skills to coordinate the planning, implementation, and administration of programs.      This role will require establishing an excellent working relationship with our payroll vendors to develop, adjust, and enhance payroll systems and procedures due to changes in tax laws, regulations, and our pay policies/compensation initiatives. This position will foster relationships with internal stakeholders such as Tax, Legal, Finance, IT, as well as with our external vendors.     This role is ideally suited for someone with the ability to manage vendors and employees as they process payroll globally, influence and effectively communicate cross-functionally in a fast-paced, growing, and ever-changing environment.                 Essential Duties and Responsibilities     :       Payroll & Benefits: Manage International payroll processing for assigned jurisdictions, compliance, and work closely with the payroll vendor and accountants on various accounting activities.      Payroll Processing & Controls: Ensure proper reviews are in place for payroll output from payroll vendor. This includes ensuring all payroll inputs are accurately captured. Includes but not limited to performing payroll analysis such as total gross payroll to net payment, the average paid per headcount by country, and comparison of analysis to the prior period, etc.     Employee experience: Respond to employee inquiries and serve as a liaison between employee and third-party providers; educate and counsel employees on how to use self-service tools and address issues that fall outside the scope of self-service, including leaves of absence, benefits changes, hourly time tracking and overtime.     Being diligent and complaint to the payroll process manual / procedures.     Third parties: Manage third-party vendors (including international payroll providers) and the preparation, analysis, and maintenance of all payroll related reports, including governmental and regulatory filings.     Cross-functional partnerships: Work with internal partners in Human Resources/ Recruiting/ Strategic Finance/ Legal to facilitate and improve the payroll processes, including benefits and withholdings (e.g., leave of absence, employee benefits, retirement and leave balances, flexible spending accounts, etc.)     Payroll Reconciliation and Validation: Review all payroll reporting and ensure accurate and timely filing with appropriate government authorities.     Year-End: Manage the annual preparation and delivery of yearly forms as required within the jurisdictions     Ad hoc Payroll support as an when needed.                   Required Qualifications:            Systems: Experience with Workday (or equivalent ERP), activpayroll, UKG (Immedis), ADP Celergo payroll vendors, and Excel (think pivot tables and lookups) a definite plus.     Experience with payroll system implementation.     Process Oriented: Strong understanding of payroll processes and best practices.     Excellent management and organizational skills.     Technical skills: Thorough knowledge of payroll-related state, legal, tax, and compliance requirements     Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills needed to interface and establish rapport with all levels of the organization including executive team members.     Experience processing payroll in India required.     Experience processing payroll in Australia, Japan, Philippines and Singapore a plus.               Preferred Qualifications:           A proactive, high-energy attitude geared towards achieving continuous improvement.     Flexibility: Ability to operate in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving, and data-driven organization.     Entrepreneurial; someone who wants to build out the global payroll process.               Education:           BS degree or equivalent. Chartered Accountant or Certified Payroll Professional (CPP) designation a plus.
