column2: JOB DESCRIPTION  - HR EXECUTIVE  & RECRUITER (MALE) Job Type: Full Time/Permanent Experience: 4- 5years Salary: 3LPA  4LPA   JOB BRIEF We are 30 years old furniture manufacturing company dealing with commercial projects based in Coimbatore. We are looking for a self-motivated recruiter who can work alongside a number of specialists at our company.  As a Manufacturing Recruiter, you will be responsible for attracting, assessing, and hiring top talent to support the manufacturing operations of our company. You will play a crucial role in ensuring that our workforce is equipped with skilled individuals who can contribute to our production goals while upholding our commitment to quality and safety.   RESPONSIBILITIES: Recruitment process is the vital role play in this profile. Utilize a variety of sourcing methods, including online job boards, industry associations, and specialized manufacturing networks, to attract qualified candidates for production, engineering, and other manufacturing-related roles. Review resumes, conduct initial phone screenings, and assess candidates' technical skills, experience with relevant manufacturing processes, and alignment with company values. Coordinate and conduct in-person or virtual interviews with candidates, including technical assessments where applicable, to evaluate their suitability for specific manufacturing positions. Develop job descriptions, and refine recruitment strategies to ensure alignment with production goals. Promote our company as an employer of choice within the manufacturing industry, highlighting our commitment to innovation, safety, and employee development to attract top talent. Assist in facilitating the onboarding process for new hires, ensuring a smooth transition into their roles and providing support as needed to address any initial challenges. Maintain accurate and up-to-date records in our applicant tracking system (ATS), ensuring compliance with relevant employment laws and regulations, and generating reports on recruitment metrics as needed. And the candidate will be the responsible person for all other HR activities like attendance, employee relationship, labour welfare activities, payroll support and etc.,   REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Industrial Engineering, Business Administration, or related field (or equivalent experience). Proven experience as a recruiter within the manufacturing industry, with a strong understanding of manufacturing processes, terminology, and workforce needs. Familiarity with a wide range of manufacturing roles, including production operators, machinists, engineers, quality assurance specialists, and supply chain professionals. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage with candidates, hiring managers, and cross-functional teams. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple recruitment projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment. Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment software tools. Commitment to upholding safety standards and promoting a culture of workplace safety within the manufacturing environment. Benefits Yearly bonus Accommodation free food provided as per company norms * Interested candidates send your updated CV through Mail on hr@zenfurniture.in  CONTACT PERSON HR  9080506567   ABOUT US:  https://www.zenfurniture.in/

column2: Job Title:  HR Generalist Location:  Gurugram Company:  Mooving About Us:  Mooving - Energy  is a leading organization. We pride ourselves on fostering a positive and inclusive work environment where innovation and teamwork thrive. Job Description:  We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented HR Generalist to join our dynamic HR team. The ideal candidate will have a broad knowledge of human resources functions, from hiring to onboarding and from employee compensation to evaluation. If you have a passion for HR, are familiar with labor law and look to contribute to a positive workplace culture, wed like to meet you. Key Responsibilities: Administer various human resource plans and procedures for all company personnel. Participate in developing department goals, objectives, and systems. Assist in the implementation and updating of company policies and procedures. Conduct recruitment efforts for all personnel, including writing and placing job advertisements. Screen and interview candidates; conduct reference checks and extend job offers. Administer onboarding and offboarding processes. Handle employee relations counseling, performance management, and improvement tracking systems. Provide support and guidance to management and employees on HR-related matters. Maintain compliance with federal and state regulations concerning employment. Manage and maintain HRIS systems, ensuring data accuracy and integrity. Conduct training sessions on various HR topics, including orientation, policy updates, and employee development programs. Assist in the administration of employee benefit programs and activities. Prepare and analyze HR reports and metrics to guide decision-making. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. 3-5 years of experience in a generalist role. Strong understanding of labor laws and compliance. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Proficient in MS Office and HRIS software. Strong organizational and time-management skills. Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion. preferred from Startup Industry  Preferred Qualifications: Professional certification (e.g., PHR, SPHR, SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP). Experience in Startup What We Offer: Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunities for professional development and career advancement. A collaborative and supportive work environment. Work-life balance initiatives.

column2: Who Are We: Investis Digital is a global digital communications company. We combine effective storytelling with innovative digital approaches to help businesses communicate clearly and authentically with any audience. Using performance marketing and corporate communications, we craft a seamless presence for our clients, positively influencing the awareness, affinity, and action of the people that matter most. Founded in 2000, we have more than 2,000 global clients supported by 500 staff. We are headquartered in London and have offices across Europe, North America, and Asia-Pacific. Key Responsibilities: Maintaining accurate employee records Onboarding and offboarding processes Updating systems and external benefit providers Managing and overseeing new joiner induction process Your main administrative duties include maintaining personnel records, managing HR documents (e.g. employment records and onboarding guides) and updating internal databases. Our ideal candidate has experience with HR procedures and can juggle various administrative tasks in a timely manner. Responsibilities: Organize and maintain personnel records Update internal databases (e.g. record sick or maternity leave) Prepare HR documents, like employment contracts and new hire guides Revise company policies Liaise with external partners, like insurance vendors, and ensure legal compliance Create regular reports and presentations on HR metrics (e.g. turnover rates) Answer employees queries about HR-related issues Assist payroll department by providing relevant employee information (e.g. leaves of absence, sick days and work schedules) Arrange travel accommodations and process expense forms Participate in HR projects (e.g. help organize a job fair event) Role Requirements: Proven track record delivering high value support within a fast-paced people team environment within an administrative or coordinator role Excellent communication and organizational skills with the ability to prioritize workload Strong MS Office skills with experience of using HRI/HRM systems What We Offer:  We're a welcoming bunch where ideas are valued. Everyone is actively encouraged to develop their careers. We are committed to helping you grow, professionally and personally. Our benefits include: - 29 paid holidays a year - Family Insurance Plan - Regular Wellness Sessions - Regular Rewards & Recognition, CSR, Cultural and sporting events

column2: The Employee Engagement Manager,  will work with the Service Teams and the unit HR Directors to create a University -wide engagement strategy. The manager will also work with those responsible for supervisor training to integrate engagement concepts into existing and future supervisor training so that strong supervisors become the primary conduit for increasing engagement. The manager will be responsible for the  execution and overall communication as it relates to employee engagement initiatives. The manager will be responsible for developing a survey process and metrics that will enable the Academy to track employee engagement progress at both an institution wide and a local unit level. During the survey cycle the manager will partner with the HR directors and the Service Teams to ensure effective administration of the survey. The manager will serve as a subject matter expert on the survey results. After the survey cycle,  the manager will produce both global and local reports that will help the Academy and individual units track progress and create action that drive positive employee engagement. Key Responsibilities Create a comprehensive and sustainable employee engagement strategy  Work with senior leaders and deans to develop strategies and demonstrable links between engagement and their strategic goals  Work with vendors,  Office of Human Resource partners and college and administrative unit Human Resource partners to design,  deploy,  and evaluate effective and efficient engagement surveys  Conduct employee focus groups to complement engagement surveys  Develop a train the trainer program to enable units to analyze their own data and build action plans  Create and/ or edit tools,  training materials,  and resources to help partners and leaders successfully build action plans based on survey results  Create an effective communication plan and provide content for various communication vehicles  Leverage events to create and sustain dialogue around engagement  Identify and address issues and solutions related to employee engagement  Help University leaders determine links between engagement and outcomes such as; turnover,  healthcare costs,  grievances,  student success  Work with cross -functional teams to identify unique division/ location needs while balancing the overall purpose and requirements of the employee engagement strategy  Manage a professional training and development staff Required Education and Experience  Masters Degree Preferable  Minimum of 2 years in direct human resource work or in a closely related field  Minimum 1 years experience in managing a staff  Demonstrated ability to move forward an agenda or initiative Preferred Experience  Strong experience working in partnership with leaders and colleagues to drive results. column2: As an integral part of the People Operations Team, the Talent Coordinator, reporting to the Manager of People Operations, plays a central role in delivering exceptional service to the organization while enhancing operational efficiency       This multifaceted position supports the entire employee lifecycle and underpins our talent management processes, encompassing various responsibilities such as; scheduling, maintenance, and management of HRIS databases (BambooHR and Lattice), data tracking and reporting, recruitment support and administration, contract support, and more     This role ensures that Vendasta provides a best-in-class candidate experience by carrying out the coordination and administration of Vendasta s full-cycle hiring process by supporting the Talent Acquisition (TA) Team in the hiring of world-class talent     This role is a strategic partner to the organization, ensuring that peoples operations needs are met through robust operational and administrative support     Moreover, it provides invaluable guidance to Vendasta Leaders and Team Members, facilitating the smooth operation of Vendastas talent management processes from behind the scenes               Experience:    2+ years as a Human resource specialist with sourcing, recruitment coordination, and administration knowledge.               Talent Management Coordination and Support (Talent Acquisition, Performance and Engagement)             Works in collaboration with Hiring Managers, the Talent Acquisition Team and the rest of the People Operations function to carry out operational duties in alignment with Vendasta s Hiring philosophy to support the filling of new and replacement role vacancies.         Assists the Talent Partners with screening, interviewing and employment agreement creation for contractors and employees.         Leads student recruitment including; liaising with 3rd party contacts and educational institutions, organizes career fairs and events, etc         Is a brand ambassador of Vendasta, participating in hiring fairs and events and supporting special projects and initiatives as it pertains to the talent acquisition function in Vendasta.         Supports the Talent Partner with talent management coordination and documentation processes         Supports and leads Talent Management projects, research, etc as required.             People Operations Policies, Programs and Framework Management             Possesses a comprehensive understanding of Vendasta s People Operations frameworks and philosophies and programs, policy and compliance, to ensure they can provide timely and accurate support to the business.          Answers employee queries about HR-related issues or directs to appropriate stakeholders within the organization/people operations team.         Building and updating internal People Operations processes and frameworks.          Manages and updates Intranet (My Front Step) and the Vendasta Employee Manual.         Participates in at least 1 organizational committee as a representative of the India Team.              Data Tracking, Metrics and Reporting             Conducts HRIS Management- BambooHR maintenance and reporting eg. reporting relationships, employee information changes etc          Keeps the People by Month Tracking and lifelines reporting up to date.         Supports the creation, maintenance and management of all records management (time-off process for all employee vacation, sick, and flex time, etc).         Supports ad hoc requests for reporting and analysis for projects and initiatives as required.          Supports the execution of the employee offboarding processes.              Perks :             Benefits - Health insurance         Paid time offs         Training Career Development - Professional development plans, leadership workshops, mentorship programs, and more!         Free Snacks, hot beverages, and catered lunches on Fridays         Culture - comprised of our core values: Drive, Innovation, Respect, and Agility         Night Shift Premium         Provident Fund

column2: As a member of our global team, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with talented professionals from diverse backgrounds, leveraging their insights and experiences to drive strategic HR initiatives forward.          Reporting directly to the Global HR Director, you will play a pivotal role in supporting our India leadership team, providing expert guidance and proactive solutions to address their evolving needs.      Working closely with our HR Advisors, you will be at the heart of our operational functions, ensuring the smooth execution of HR processes and initiatives.          Together, we strive to cultivate an environment where talent thrives, innovation flourishes, and organizational goals are exceeded.              Responsibilities (including, but not limited to)            Partner with business leaders to understand their objectives and develop HR strategies to support business goals.          Act as a trusted advisor to management on all HR-related matters including talent management, performance management, employee relations, and organizational development.          Drive the implementation of global HR programs and initiatives at the local level, ensuring alignment with local laws and regulations.          Lead and facilitate talent review discussions, succession planning, and workforce planning activities.          Provide coaching and guidance to managers on employee development, performance improvement, and conflict resolution.          Partner with the global HR team to design and deliver training and development programs for employees and managers.          Analyze HR metrics and data to identify trends, issues, and opportunities for improvement.          Collaborate with the HR shared services team to ensure efficient and effective delivery of HR services.          Stay abreast of HR best practices, trends, and legal requirements to ensure compliance and drive continuous improvement.          Act as a champion of the organizations culture and values, fostering an inclusive and engaged work environment.              Essential Skills & Experience              Operational Expertise:        A strong understanding of HR lifecycles and processes, with proven experience in effectively managing the operational side of HR functions. Demonstrated ability to streamline processes, optimize workflows, and implement best practices to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.            Exceptional Relationship-Building:        Ability to establish and maintain strong relationships with employees, managers, and senior leadership across all levels of the organization. Proven track record of fostering trust and collaboration to support HR initiatives and drive organizational success.            Open Communication and Empathy:        Skilled in fostering open communication channels, actively listening to concerns, and demonstrating empathy and understanding. Ability to address employee needs and concerns effectively, promoting a culture of transparency and mutual respect.            Stakeholder Management:        Strong stakeholder management abilities, including collaborating closely with department heads, business leaders, and cross-functional teams to align HR strategies with business objectives. Experience in navigating complex organizational structures and driving consensus among diverse stakeholders.            Conflict Resolution:        Proficiency in conflict resolution, with the capability to address employee grievances, mediate disputes, and facilitate constructive dialogue to maintain positive working relationships. Ability to handle sensitive situations with professionalism and tact.            Influencing and Persuasion:        Demonstrated influencing and persuasion skills, with the ability to articulate HR strategies and initiatives in a compelling manner to gain buy-in from various stakeholders. Proven track record of driving change and driving adoption of HR programs through effective communication and persuasion.            Executive Presence:        Executive presence and professionalism, particularly in interactions with senior leaders and executives. Ability to command attention, showcase confidence, gravitas, and adaptability in high-stakes situations, contributing to the credibility and impact of HR initiatives.                  Personal Attributes            Positive, assertive, and driven attitude          Strategic thinker with a forward-thinking mindset          Strong analytical skills for data-driven decision-making          Resilient and adaptable in dynamic organizational environments          Continuous learning mindset to stay updated on industry trends          Leadership abilities to inspire and motivate teams and drive change          Cultural competence and sensitivity for diverse work environments          Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to influence and motivate          High emotional intelligence and adept at building relationships          Able to take a pragmatic view          Can do attitude          Hands-on approach with the ability to analyze source data          Proven ability to meet deadlines and prioritize workload effectively          Willingness to travel occasionally                Qualifications:              Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field;          8+ years of progressive HR experience, with at least 3 years in a business partner or strategic HR role.          Strong knowledge of HR practices, policies, and employment laws in India and globally.          Demonstrated ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.          Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.          Proven ability to drive change and lead HR initiatives in a fast-paced, global environment.          Experience working in a global team is preferred.                Desired skills:              HR certification (e.g., SPHR, SHRM-SCP) a plus.                Tools and platforms              Proficiency in using HRIS platforms          Experience with ATS platforms          Familiarity with performance management tools          Knowledge of LMS platforms          Experience with tools that aid in measuring employee engagement, conducting surveys, and collecting feedback to improve workplace culture and morale          Proficiency in collaboration tools          Skills in data analysis using tools

column2: Company Name: Compunnel INC. Job Title: HR Generalist (US Staffing) Experience Required: 1+ years Location:   Noida Shift Timing: 7 PM to 4 Am (Night Shifts) Job Summary : -    The HR Generalist provides overall human resources and benefits administrative support to all the on-site consultants. This role is responsible for the general administration of human resource policies and practices. The Generalist actively analyses and recommends changes to moderately complex location practices and ensures consistent application of HR laws, regulations, and company policies. ?The role demands strong attention to detail, customer service, problem-solving skills, and a sound overall knowledge of HR practices, laws, compliance, and regulations. Key Responsibilities : -   Perform welcome/orientation calls with the newly hired employees, and regular follow-up calls with all the existing employees to resolve all open queries and concerns.  Responsible for managing/answering the HR incoming emails and responding to the queries within the expected timelines.  Attend to all employee-related queries such as any project updates, leave/vacation, company policies, injury reporting, referrals, timesheet submission, payroll, expenses, unemployment, etc.     Encourage candidates/consultants to use the Companys application, Stafflinepro, to manage every aspect of their employment, new job opportunities, and dedicated helpdesk on the go across multiple devices. Rapport building and promoting the Companys Referral policy to the consultants. Manage benefits administration including answering all queries related to enrolment or any changes; Coordinate with the internal teams/ insurance company contacts to ensure the information is updated on the Benefits Online Portal and resolve any insurance issues.  Filling and executing necessary HR/ Employee related paperwork   Assisting candidate/consultant in case of short-term disability and helping to initiate Workers Compensation in case of any work-site injury.  Responsible for end-to-end process of candidate/consultant offboarding.  Review and approve vacation requests raised by the employees.  Manage consultant?? benefits portfolio such as Insurance, 401(k) Retirement Plan & Voluntary Benefits offered by the Company.   Monitoring all employee insurance changes and fixing any discrepancies by matching data from the Benefits Portal, Payroll Records, and Insurance Invoices    Responsible for escalations/grievance handling. Handling employee grievances including working conditions, salary-related matters, etc.  Responsible for providing superior customer service, and accurate and timely responses to Talent Management, Hiring Managers, and employees to ensure a professional and smooth work experience with the company.   Key Skills & Qualification : -   Basic Qualifications include : -   Min 1-3 years of industry experience in a similar background.   Working knowledge of MS Office Applications including Excel, Word, and PowerPoint Bachelor?? degree preferred in a Human Resource, Business or a related discipline or equivalent experience.   Ability to prioritize, multi-task and work within a tight schedule.  Kindly go through the company link, URL-   www.compunnel.com.   To proceed, kindly share your updated CV via email at   Komal.sharma@Compunnel.com   or WhatsApp at   8218669801

column2: About US:  ThinkSys, an award-winning technology company, is a leading provider of Software Development, QA and IT Services. headquartered in Sunnyvale, CA and offices in NOIDA, India. ThinkSys serves clients worldwide. We have been recognized among the fastest growing private companies in the US (Inc5000 2016), the "Most Exciting"companies in Asia (Red Herring Asia 100) & the "Best Emerging Software Company in Delhi NCR (India). ThinkSys delivers a wide variety of comprehensive end-to-end services that combine power, functionality, and reliability with flexibility, agility, and usability. Our journey began in 2012, marking the inception of our company with just 50 members & now we are a team of 450+ highly skilled specialists who bring their expertise and passion to every software project, ensuring unparalleled quality and innovation.   Job Summary As a HR person, you will play a crucial role in supporting the human resources functions within our organization. This position is ideal for a candidate with a passion for HR and people management, offering an opportunity to learn and grow within the HR domain. The Junior HR Executive will be involved in various HR activities, employee relations, and general HR administration. Responsibilities:  Coordinate and facilitate the onboarding process for new hires, ensuring a smooth transition into the organization.  Maintain employee files and records in electronic and paper form, ensuring accuracy and confidentiality.  Provide support to employees in various HR-related topics such as leaves and compensation and resolve any issues that may arise  Assist in the preparation and documentation of HR policies and procedures.  Handle day-to-day HR administrative tasks.  Take care of the Joining Formalities, Induction, Exit Interviews, etc  Assist in resolving employee relations issues, maintaining a positive work environment.  Support training initiatives by coordinating training sessions and tracking employee development plans.  Assist in employee engagement activities.  Assist & Support the performance appraisal process.  Maintain a database (MIS) of all the employees information and ensure they are up to date and secure.  Produce and submit reports on general HR activity.  Conducts or acquires background checks and employee eligibility verifications. Keep up to date with the latest HR trends and best practices.  Performs other duties as assigned. Qualifications:    Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Basic understanding of HR principles and practices Strong organizational and time-management skills Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) 6 months-1 years relevant experience.  Interested candidates can share their resume at jobs@thinksys.com

column2: Job description Job Title: Human Resources Generalist Company Overview: Keshav Manglam Impex Pvt Ltd is a dynamic [IT Industry] company . With a commitment to fostering a positive work culture and supporting employee growth, we are seeking a skilled Human Resources Generalist to join our team. Position Overview: As our Human Resources Generalist, you will play a crucial role in supporting all aspects of human resources functions within the organization. From recruitment and onboarding to employee relations and performance management, you will be responsible for ensuring that our employees feel valued, engaged, and supported throughout their employment journey. Expiration?- 1 To 3 Years Key Responsibilities: Recruitment and Onboarding: Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract top talent. Coordinate job postings, screen resumes, and conduct interviews. Facilitate the onboarding process for new hires, ensuring a smooth transition into the company. Employee Relations: Serve as a trusted point of contact for employees regarding HR-related inquiries and concerns. Mediate and resolve employee conflicts or issues in a fair and timely manner. Conduct regular check-ins with employees to assess job satisfaction and address any concerns. Performance Management: Administer performance evaluation processes, providing guidance to managers and employees. Identify opportunities for employee development and career advancement. Implement performance improvement plans as needed to support employee growth and productivity. HR Administration: Maintain accurate employee records and HR databases. Manage HR documentation, including employment contracts, policies, and procedures. Stay up-to-date on relevant employment laws and regulations to ensure compliance. Benefits and Compensation: Assist in the administration of employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other perks. Collaborate with finance and payroll departments to ensure accurate and timely processing of employee compensation. Qualifications Proven experience in a human resources role, preferably in a generalist capacity. Strong knowledge of HR best practices, employment laws, and regulations. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion. Detail-oriented with excellent organizational and time management skills. Additional Information: This is a full-time position based at our? Address:? NPX URBTECH , SUITE NO 25-26, PLOT NO C-1, 4TH FLOOR, Sector 153, Noida, Uttar Pradesh 201301?office. Opportunities for professional development and growth within the company. column2: Process payroll and work closely with internal and external stakeholders to make sure our employees across the globe are paid correctly and on time.             Essential Responsibilities         This function will manage, prepare, document, and disburse payroll checks, payroll taxes, and employee benefit payments for India   .    This role partners closely with Trimble s People eXperience (Human Resources) and Corporate Finance teams to ensure compliance with our statutory accounting. In addition, this role is responsible for creating reports illustrating payroll expenditures, including such items as tax payments and benefit plan disbursements.                Day-to-day activities include:                Ensure accurate, compliant, and timely payroll processing for India.             Take ownership of the completion of payroll-related accruals and prepayment             Ensure data integrity from Trimble s HRIS (Workday) to Cloudpay through the integration reports             Act as the main point of contact for employees about payroll through the ASKPayroll app.             Act as backup for the rest of the APAC team, using the Cloudpay calendar for payroll processes regionally.             Partner with the broader Finance team to complete monthly payroll-related balance sheet reconciliations             Partner with Trimble s local payroll providers to ensure the monthly correct payroll results and timely compliance/reporting with government authorities             Analyze ad hoc improvements/practices that may impact payroll in Sweden and work with internal and external stakeholders to arrive at the best payroll solution for Trimble             Gather manual input, including appropriate approvals for upload in Cloudpay (TOP, commissions, ESPP, RSU)                 Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience               Bachelor s degree               AND 5+ years relevent work experience             OR an equivilant combination of education and relevant work experience                 Expertise in payroll platforms/systems like CloudPay.             Familiarity with the Workday ecosystem and preferably with experience in interfaces and integrations between Workday and 3rd party payroll systems.             Experience in the labor, tax and social security framework in India.              Advanced proficiency (verbal and written) in English.             Attention to detail and the ability to explain complex information to others in straightforward situations.             Advanced reporting skills through excel. Preferable experience in the manipulation of big chunks of data through Data Analytics platform like DOMO / PowerBI / Tableau             Change management mindset: willingness to embrace change of processes on a global scale.             Basic knowledge of working within finance and having an understanding of prepayments, accruals, and journals would be beneficial.

column2: Purpose         The Maersk Global Service Centres are spread across 5 sites with over 9500 employees. The GSC organization is responsible for facilitating executing off- shoring primarily for Maersk Line,  however also covering all other Business Units of the APMM Group. The GSC organization has been successful in doubling its size over the past 2 years whilst at the same time improving the satisfaction as well as processes of its business partners.         In light of the expected continued growth in terms of both headcount and process scope for the GSC in the coming years,  we have made changes to the GSC organization design. The new structure is a process based,  delivery focused organization called GSC 2.0 and will come into effect on 1st of August 2011.         One of the new roles designed in support this is the Liner Global Delivery BPI Manager for the Customer Service Process based out of Chennai,  who will be responsible for facilitating performance management,  driving standardization of the Customer Service processes and managing the improvement agenda within scope of the Customer Service Delivery portfolio.         The Role:      The GSC Customer Service Global Delivery BPI Manager is responsible for facilitating effective process management,  standardization and continuous improvement of the Customer Service processes,  including all aspects of the delivery system.      Key Responsibilities would be to:          Take charge of the process improvement agenda for Customer Service delivery organization         Guide improvement initiatives providing E2E benefits (e.g. avoid improvements for the sake of improvement)         Lead projects assigned to Customer Service Delivery BPI by performing program/project portfolio management and thereby avoiding duplication of efforts between sites         Drive replication of best practices and improvement projects across sites and Customer Service processes         Drive standardization of operational practices across sites and Customer Service processes (e.g. operations management,  performance management,  visual management systems)         Establish and overview process standardization and governance of process variants         Facilitate business performance management of Customer Service Delivery processes         Overview and secure business continuity measures are in place and contingency plans tested regularly         Closely working with the Customer Service Business Development BPI team,  facilitating the coordination between the site process teams. Closely coordinate and cooperate with the Customer Service Site BPI teams which in turn take the lead on implementing global solutions,  driving continuous improvement in Gemba,  safeguarding business continuity and providing coaching and learning to the teams in the sites         Act as sparring partner for the process delivery leads in the sites         Be an active member of the Customer Service Delivery leadership team,  jointly setting the strategy,  objectives and the overall improvement agenda for Customer Service Delivery         Lead a small virtual team with 1- 2 team members per GSC site,  including people leadership,  talent development and performance management aspects. column2: Job description Job Title: Human Resource Manager / Admin Coordinator Company Overview: Join our dynamic team at ATOZ Logistics Limited, a leading provider of logistical solutions. We specialize in efficient transportation, warehousing, and distribution services, catering to diverse industries worldwide. With a commitment to excellence and innovation, we are expanding our operations and seeking a talented HR/Admin Coordinator to join our team.  Position Overview: We are seeking an experienced HR/Admin Coordinator who is adept at managing a wide range of administrative tasks while also effectively handling HR functions. The ideal candidate will thrive in a dynamic environment, possess strong organizational skills, and have the ability to collaborate with teams across multiple locations. Responsibilities: HR Functions: Coordinate with the employees at Headquarters, workshop, and various branches to ensure seamless HR operations. Oversee payroll processing, including timekeeping, deductions, leave applications, and tax compliance. Manage the onboarding and offboarding processes for employees, ensuring a smooth transition. Conduct  recruitment  activities, including sourcing candidates, scheduling interviews, and facilitating the hiring process. Maintain employee records and ensure compliance with relevant regulations and company policies. Handle employee relations issues and provide support for resolving conflicts or grievances. Administrative Duties: Manage administrative tasks such as correspondence and scheduling meetings. Coordinate with vendors and suppliers for office equipment, services, and facilities management. Ensure efficient asset management, including tracking and maintenance of company equipment and resources. Utilize Google Sheets and other technological tools for data management, reporting, and analysis. Support the team with various administrative needs, including travel arrangements and event coordination. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. Proven experience in HR and administrative roles Strong understanding of payroll processes, recruitment methods, and HR best practices. Highly proficient in using Google Sheets and mailing. Experience with  HR software such as GreytHR and Keka  is a plus. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills to manage multiple tasks efficiently.   Join Our Team: Fill in the form here to apply -  https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScVTqAXzL4US9Ph8aP9Ijc3APZM6wXKbJVvfFOVB9ETX0Pmrg/viewform  For queries, contact us on WhatsApp at +91 7303096320 CTC: Upto 4.5 lacs pa Job Location: ATOZ Logistics Limited, Patparganj Industrial Area, Delhi Type : Full-time Job

Conduct screening calls to assess candidate suitability for various roles based on communication, technical skills, and cultural fit.             Manage communication and obtain candidate consent for sharing resumes and other personal documents with potential employers. Ensure compliance with all legal and regulatory requirements related to recruitment and employment.             Prepare and maintain HR-related reports and documentation. Conduct reference checking of candidates to verify their qualifications and employment history. column2: The Human Resources Intern performs HR related duties at the professional level and may carry out responsibilities in some or all of the following functional areas: recruiting & staffing; employee relations; compensation; employment & compliance; performance management; employee integration, development & training; process improvement; procedural documentation; employee services and counseling.   The Human Resources Intern will also work closely with other members of the Employment team to support the development and implementation of HR services, policies, and programs.  This position reports to the Manager, Human Resources, and assists and advises Firm Managers and Directors about Human Resources issues.   Key Responsibilities  Supports communication and administration of Human Resources policies, procedures, laws, standards and government regulations.   Participates in employee relations counseling and may respond to issues such as employee complaints, harassment allegations, and civil rights complaints.   Supports performance management process, including annual performance reviews for administrative staff  Recommends new approaches, policies, and procedures to effect continual improvements in efficiency of department and services performed.   Partners with administrative directors, managers, and supervisors to develop and maintain accurate job descriptions for administrative staff positions.   Conducts exit interviews, analyzes data, and makes recommendations for continuous improvement.   Supports the firm s compensation planning and administration process.   Assists with the development and production of HR metrics and reporting.   Participates in administrative staff meetings and attends other meetings and seminars.   May assist in developing, implementing or facilitating training (including orientation) to administrative staff.   Performs other related duties as required and assigned.   Knowledge, Skills & Attributes  Outstanding interpersonal skills and capability to work effectively with a variety of people and departments.   Demonstrated ability to effectively apply knowledge of human resources law & policies;  Strong business acumen and judgment;  Strong written and oral communication skills;  Demonstrated ability to make recommendations to effectively resolve problems or issues, by using judgment that is consistent with standards, practices, policies, procedures, regulation or government law;  Demonstrated understanding of business processes and how to change and improve them to achieve greater efficiency and effectiveness;  Demonstrated ability to research and analyze various types of data and develop meaningful results/ recommendations; and,  Demonstrated ability to prioritize multiple projects and responsibilities and consistently deliver high quality results in a timely manner.   Excellent knowledge of area of expertise (market status, trends, best practices)  Client focus along with relationship building skills  Business acumen and market insight  Effective negotiation, influencing and good communication skills  Integrity and confidentiality
column11: Policies, Intern, Performance management, Staffing, Process improvement, Relationship building, HR, Continuous improvement, Internship, Exit interviews

column2: The Compensation Benefits Analyst is responsible for providing staff support activities to develop, implement, and administer compensation and benefits policies and programs.        General Responsibilities        Key participant in the development of annual salary structures, compensation analyses and benefit program / activities      Performs audits on job content as well as creating and maintaining job descriptions      Reviews and provides recommendations on compensation analyses such as market adjustments and promotions      Key participant in compensation and benefit surveys to analyze the company s position to market and competitiveness      Experience / Qualifications        A university degree required (ie Bachelors degree) or equivalent relevant work experience.      Must be a team player able to work in a fast-paced environment with demonstrated ability to handle multiple competing tasks and demands      Strong communication skills; oral, written and presentation      Strong organization, planning and time management skills to achieve results      Strong personal and professional ethical values and integrity      Holds self-accountable to achieving goals and standards      Proficient in Microsoft Office programs (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)      Strong interpersonal collaboration skills to work effectively with all levels of the organization including suppliers and/or external customers                      Complete a total remuneration competitive assessment of existing CB practices against the local market to determine go forward competitive strategy      Maintains a working knowledge of national legislation influencing compensation and benefits.      Coordinate, provide support, analytics and systems administration for the annual compensation planning process (including salary planning and bonus allocations)      Help to develop and improve internal compensation communication and education      Manage group insurance vendor, monitor service quality and internal process, review the plan and contract on annual basis      Provide HR integration support for company acquisitions by analyzing and converting appropriately MA compensation programs to Sensata structure as needed      Knowledge of WorkDay is a plus      Strong English speaking and writing skills

column2: HR Systems Management    : Overseeing and maintaining HR information systems (HRIS) and databases. This includes data entry, accuracy checks, and troubleshooting any technical issues.        Employee Lifecycle Management    : Managing various aspects of the employee lifecycle, including onboarding, transfers, promotions, and offboarding. Ensuring that all processes are conducted smoothly and in compliance with company policies and regulations.        Benefits Administration    : Assisting with the administration of employee benefits programs, such as health insurance, retirement plans, and other perks. This may involve answering employee inquiries, facilitating enrollment, and coordinating with benefit providers.        Payroll Support    : Collaborating with the payroll department to ensure accurate and timely processing of employee payments. This may involve verifying timesheets, addressing payroll discrepancies, and assisting with payroll-related inquiries.        Compliance and Policy Adherence    : Staying up-to-date with employment laws and regulations to ensure that HR practices and policies comply with legal requirements. Providing guidance to managers and employees on HR policies and procedures.        Reporting and Analytics    : Generating reports and analyzing HR data to identify trends, insights, and areas for improvement. Providing data-driven recommendations to support decision-making processes within the HR department and across the organization.        Employee Relations    : Assisting HR managers with employee relations issues, such as conflict resolution, grievances, and disciplinary actions. Serving as a point of contact for employees seeking guidance on HR-related matters.        Training and Development Support    : Coordinating training programs and initiatives to enhance employee skills and performance. Tracking employee training progress and facilitating the delivery of training materials.        Documentation and Record-Keeping    : Maintaining accurate and organized HR records, including employee files, contracts, and other important documents. Ensuring compliance with record-keeping requirements and data protection regulations.        Continuous Improvement    : Identifying opportunities to streamline HR processes, improve efficiency, and enhance the employee experience. Implementing best practices and recommending innovative solutions to optimize HR operations.        Cross-Functional Collaboration    : Collaborating with other departments, such as finance, IT, and legal, to support HR initiatives and address interdepartmental issues.
column11: Health insurance, Payroll, HRIS, Conflict resolution, HR, Troubleshooting, Continuous improvement, Analytics, Employee relations, Data entry

column2: Role & responsibilities     HR manager is responsible to analyze and solve all manpower        requisitions and shortages, find potential recruitment procedures,        conduct interviews and select the right candidate for the right job.   Human resources        managers need to plan the needs of a company's employees. He/she has to        develop and manage employment programs, salary compensation and performance        evaluations, benefits and promotions.   HR manager shall function within an active and influential        business advisory role with executives in order to drive business        results.   HR manager shall develop staffing        and retention strategies, leadership and organizational development,        motivation of employees, compensation management and delivery,        performance management and workforce planning.   The HR manager must know, follow and prepare all statutory        regulations and documents in relation to human resources.   HR manager also to conduct induction        trainings for right candidates after selection. HR manager also to        intimate the top management regarding training programs held externally        if he finds it suitable as increasing the skills of particular staff.   He/she shall attend the weekly        meetings of the department.   HR manager shall ensure that all        proper procedures and steps have been followed as directed in        recruitment and selection.   HR manager shall plan the staff        promotion (career level) and reward management.   HR manager shall visit the        retail outlets in a planned interval at least once in three months.   HR manager shall be able to plan        motivational and morale building techniques within the staff.

column2: An HR Generalist is responsible for executing various human resources (HR) functions within an organization. Key responsibilities include:     Recruiting and staffing: sourcing, screening, and hiring new employees.     Employee relations: addressing and resolving employee concerns, complaints, and conflicts.     Performance management: conducting performance evaluations and providing feedback to employees.     Employee development: creating and implementing employee training programs and career development plans.     Compensation and benefits: administering employee compensation and benefits programs, such as salaries, bonuses, and insurance.     Compliance: ensuring compliance with federal and state employment laws and regulations.     Policy development and administration: creating, updating, and communicating HR policies and procedures.     Employee records management: maintaining accurate and up-to-date employee files and records.     Diversity and inclusion: promoting and fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace culture.     Other HR-related tasks as assigned by management.Qualifications:     Strong knowledge of federal and state employment laws and regulations.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with employees at all levels of the organization.     Good organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively.     Experience with HR information systems (HRIS) and other HR technology solutions.     Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive employee information.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve HR-related issues.

column2: Recruiting Software and Applicant Tracking System   Recruiterbox. com Recruitment software to track job applicants Recruiterbox is a recruitment software that simplifies and optimizes your hiring process.  Post job openings,  manage candidates,  collaborate with colleagues and use data to help you make an informed decision all in one place.   1500+ fast-growing companies use the Recruiterbox Applicant Tracking System  The challenge: Hire a bunch of great people for our new store.  We needed a way to keep track and organize thousands of applications across numerous departments coming in from different sources.   The solution: Recruiterbox!  In a span of one year,  we grew from a sales team of 250 people to over 800 in India alone.  Recruiterbox has enabled us to manage nearly 500 interviews per week and execute our hiring efficiently across geographies.     Why you will love using recruiterbox       Create jobs once.  Update everywhere Create an opening and reflect it on your company website or on a careers-page hosted by us.  Broadcast jobs to search engines and share them on your social media accounts.     Create a (customizable) set of steps according to your recruitment process and track candidates as they flow through the stages of your hiring funnel.   Assign responsibilities to your team Invite your colleagues to work on recruitment.  Have people responsible for candidates in specific stages,  forward candidates and collect shared feedback.   Create a completely customizable application form to collect richer information from applicants beyond the resume.   One stop for candidates from all sources Collect all job applicants at one place,  whether they come via email,  job-boards,  your careers page or even folders.   All recruitment information in one place Discuss candidates,  share evaluations,  attach documents /  notes to candidates in one place.  No more information buried under a pile of email.   See what makes Recruiterbox better than most recruitment software   Truly web-based applicant tracking Unlike most applicant tracking systems,  Recruiterbox is completely web-based.  There is nothing to download,  install,  update or maintain.      The most intuitive recruitment software Disillusioned with software that is cumbersome to use.  Recruiterbox is built to get out of your way and get the job done.     Recruiterbox pricing is all-inclusive.  There are no hidden charges,  installation costs,  long term contracts or binding commitments.     Do you use email spreadsheets to manage your hiring today Here is why you should consider recruiterbox.      More efficient than email spreadsheets  If you receive job applications in your email,  you know how tedious it is to download open each attached resume.  Also,  searching through attachments is impossible.  Spreadsheets can help you structure data,  but are also not ideal for resume tracking.   With Recruiterbox,  all applicant information is gathered and made searchable in one place.        One-stop Resume Management  Often,  candidate information is spread across files,  emails,  notepads and memory.  Recruiterbox helps you to gather the resumes from multiple sources and manage them from a single place.  Now you can source,  track and hire candidates with ease.        Automated Applicant Tracking    Most of the time in hiring is spent in emailing candidates,  assigning people to interview them,  or simply screening applicants from a pile.   Recruiterbox helps you minimize the time spent on administrative tasks.  Spend less time "managing" hiring and more time actually hiring.              Customizable recruitment process  Each company and its hiring methodology is unique.  Recruiterbox helps map your recruitment workflow in to completely customizable stages.  You can easily create /  edit these stages and assign them to people in your organization.        Hire as a team  Recruiting involves discussion sharing candidate evaluations,  scheduling interviews and delegating tasks - in short,  team work.   Recruiterbox lets you easily organize and share all reviews and communication around a candidate.  It also keeps track and notifies you of important events and tasks.          New to Recruitment Software Here's what you need to know    What is a Recruitment Software anyway Recruitment Software - also often called as applicant tracking system (ATS) - is a tool that enables companies to electronically handle their recruitment needs.  Recruitment softwares are used by both large enterprises and smaller companies,  but vary in functionality and features depending on the needs of the company.  A Recruitment software is very similar to customer relationship management (CRM) systems,  but is designed specifically for recruitment tracking purposes.      What does a Recruitment Software do The primary job of a recruitment software is centralizing all the information about a company's recruitment efforts in a database.  Applicant Tracking Systems are designed to add structure to the processing of resumes and applicant information.  Applicant data is either collected from internal applications (through the front-end),  located on the company website or is extracted from applicants on job boards.  Some modern ATSs allow applicants to be sourced from the company's own database of past job applicants.         What are the types of Recruitment Software Almost all companies use some kind of applicant tracking system or recruitment software to handle job applications and to manage resume data.  Some smaller firms use email and/ or spreadsheets to manage this,  but most companies use a dedicated ATS for recruitment specific needs.  In large enterprises,  recruitment software may be offered as one of the numerous modules of a complex human resources suite or Human Resource Information System (HRIS).   The older recruitment softwares are typically installed within the company premises and have a one-time installation cost.  In recent years,  the ATS is expanding into small and medium enterprises through software as a service offerings (SaaS).  With SaaS,  companies can now pay for recruitment software on a pay-as-you-go basis.  This has been instrumental in increasing the penetration of ATS in smaller companies.

column2: What you ll do in this role:        As a global benefits supervisor you will oversee Quickbase s global benefits programs (e.g., medical, dental, vision, retirement saving, life insurance, disability, and the like). Ensure programs align with the company s business objectives and remain in compliance with current applicable laws and regulations. Assist in the financial oversight for programs and the managing of day-to-day benefits-related activities.      Assist in researching plans and providers to develop benefits programs that optimize costs, maintain external competitiveness, and meet organizational goals. Oversee the annual enrollment process, wellness programs, benefits communication, and relationships with external providers. Work with leaders across functional areas on shared initiatives.       You will:        Collaborate with the Global Head of People operations to develop the vision, analysis, research, communication, and administration of strategic employee benefit programs, and the processes associated with supporting these programs. You will also ensure that these programs support the company s growth strategy, business objectives, and talent acquisition and retention goals.     Manage the systems and technology that support our benefit plans. Work closely with Payroll and HRIS as it relates to benefits. column2: At Lumicel Animation Studios, human resources (HR) is focused on understanding what our human capital needs and knowing how to provide it. If you re a people-person looking to grow your career in the exciting world of HR, this is the best place to dive in. We re in search of a qualified and resourceful HR generalist to support our HR department in ensuring smooth and efficient business operations. The HR generalist will have both administrative and strategic responsibilities, helping us to plan and administer important functions, such as staffing, training and development, HR policies and process. At Lumicel we understand that our business thrives when our personnel and artists thrive, and that starts by having the best HR team to support it.     WHAT YOU LL GET TO DO:       Assist with all internal and external HR related matters     Assist in developing and executing personnel procedures and policies, providing guidance and interpretation for business operations     Participate in the development of HR objectives and systems, including metrics, queries, and standard reports for ongoing company requirements     Assist in administering benefits, compensation, and employee performance programs     Assist with the recruitment process by identifying candidates, conducting reference checks and issuing employment contracts     Participates in developing department goals, objectives and systems     Suggest new procedures and policies to continually improve the efficiency of the HR department and organization as a whole, and to improve employee experience     Ensure legal compliance of labour regulations and applicable employment laws, and update policies and/or procedures as required     Assist in the communication, interpretation, and upkeep of employee handbook, employee directory, and organizational chart, and contributes to the development of policies     Handles employee relations counseling, outplacement counseling and exit interviewing     Provide an effective and dedicated HR advisory service to employees in relation to absence and health issues, conduct and capability, grievance matters, organizational change, and all other employee-relations matters     Produce and submit reports on general HR activity     Recommend strategies to motivate employees     Keep up-to-date with the latest HR trends and best practice     Recruit and interview potential applicants on experience, skills, and education     Organize and manage new employee orientation, on-boarding, and training programs     Represent employer in the community and recruiting events     Works comfortably under pressure and meet tight deadlines     Answer employee questions and addresses employee concerns with company; including employee safety, welfare, wellness and health     Manages committees on wellness, training, health and safety, culture, and communications as needed       Bachelor s degree in HR, business, or a related field     2+ years experience as HR generalist     Additional HR training or experience is a plus     Excellent communication skills, interpersonal skills, ethics, and cultural awareness     Resourceful, problem-solving aptitude and thorough knowledge of HR procedures and policies     Natural interpersonal and communication skills     Strong detail-oriented and resourceful mindset     Advanced knowledge of MS Office, HRIS systems, and comfortable learning new technical systems as needed     Knowledge of HR and Labour laws

column2: An HR Professional is responsible for executing various human resources (HR) functions within an organization.      Key responsibilities include:          Recruiting and staffing: sourcing, screening, and hiring new employees.      Employee relations: addressing and resolving employee concerns, complaints, and conflicts.      Performance management: conducting performance evaluations and providing feedback to employees.      Employee development: creating and implementing employee training programs and career development plans.      Compensation and benefits: administering employee compensation and benefits programs, such as salaries, bonuses, and insurance.      Compliance: ensuring compliance with federal and state employment laws and regulations.      Policy development and administration: creating, updating, and communicating HR policies and procedures.      Employee records management: maintaining accurate and up-to-date employee files and records.      Diversity and inclusion: promoting and fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace culture.      Other HR-related tasks as assigned by management.        Qualifications:        Strong knowledge of federal and state employment laws and regulations.      Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with employees at all levels of the organization.      Good organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively.      Experience with HR information systems (HRIS) and other HR technology solutions.      Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive employee information.      Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve HR-related issues.

column2: Reviews, tracks, and documents compliance with mandatory and non-mandatory training, continuing education, and work assessments. This may include safety training, anti-harassment training, professional licensure, and aptitude exams and certifications.     Recruits, interviews, and facilitates the hiring of qualified job applicants for open positions; collaborates with departmental managers to understand skills and competencies required for openings.     Conducts or acquires background checks and employee eligibility verifications.     Implements new hire orientation and employee recognition programs.     Performs routine tasks required to administer and execute human resource programs including but not limited to compensation, benefits, and leave; disciplinary matters; disputes and investigations; performance and talent management; productivity, recognition, and morale; occupational health and safety; and training and development.     Handles employment-related inquiries from applicants, employees, and supervisors, referring complex and/or sensitive matters to the appropriate staff. column2: Job description         This role Serves as HR solution provider for all the concern related to employee activityadhere to policy guidelines, direct and coordinates human resources activities such as employment, performance management, salary related queries, training and development, conflict resolution and employee relations.             KEY DELIVERABLES/ RESPONSIBILITIES         Ensure adequate manpower to run the company operations seamlessly         Responsible for identifying manpower requirement of overall organization and assist department heads of various divisions in hiring of qualified staff and workers for the smooth functioning of their departments operation.     Responsible to execute activities related to database creation, releasing advertisement on website and in newspapers for vacant positions to be filled by liaising with different Employment consultant agencies.         HR Policy Implementation         Implement and monitor the HR policies to achieve long term goals of the organization.     Review existing policies timely and formulate new policies after identifying the areas.     HR Policy governance General HR Policies like code of conduct, recruitments, travel, leaves, Reimbursements, Benefits, Bonus bands, career path, etc.         Employee Engagement and communication         Responsible for Fair and implementation of Company Employee Awards and Recognition Programs to ensure these programs are accepted by the employees as the highest Appreciation and recognition tool.     Create and facilitate communication mechanisms across levels and implement employee involvement initiatives.         Performance Management, Training and career growth         Work on a Training calendar basis the Training needs of the Individuals and execute the same in a systematic way.     Maintain a succession plan for all departments and Identify people who can move in to next roles.     To build the culture of Performance Driven Organization.      Conduction of MidYear Reviews and Annual Reviews within organization.     Conduct the Target and performance based Annual increments process across organization (Corporate Factories/Plants) also ensure competency based Promotions take place.     Implement innovative programs/initiatives to prevent staff turnover     Conducting and analyzing exit interviews; recommending changes.         Record Management (HRIS)         To ensure that all the filing and documentation of employees are properly maintained with the personnel files of all the entire divisions.     To ensure that all the employees in and out timings are properly recorded on daily basis for the purpose of payroll.     To ensure that statutory registers are properly maintained as per the Labour laws, Advance register, compensatory leave register, overtime register, deductions register, accident register.     To ensure that proper track of leave has been maintained such as vacation, holidays, personal or sick days for employees.         EDUCATION/ DESIRED PROFILE         MBA HR with 6 to 8 years of experience in the same profile.     Excellent Communication, Writing, Interpersonal and Leadership skills.     Proficient in using SAP, MS Office and other related software s to HR.         COMPETENCIES/ SKILL SET           People Skills    Coaching Mentoring, Leadership Empowerment, Communication, Interpersonal, Conflict Management Ethical Business Practices, Prioritization.       Process Management    - Strategic Planning Analyzing, Decision Making Process Re-engineering       Leadership skills   : Quick decision making, people management, team building.

column2: As an HR Lead at Tecstub, you will play a critical role in managing day-to-day HR operations, employee relations, recruitment, vendor management, and employee engagement initiatives      We are looking for a smart, people-oriented professional who can effectively handle a wide range of HR responsibilities and contribute to our overall organizational success                What you ll be doing:            Employee Relations    : Serve as the primary point of contact for employees regarding HR-related matters, including grievances, conflicts, and performance issues. Provide guidance, counseling, and support to managers and employees, ensuring fair and consistent application of policies and procedures.            HR Activities    : Manage and execute various HR processes and programs, such as onboarding, performance management, employee development, benefits administration, employee offboarding, and policy implementation. Maintain accurate HR records and generate relevant reports as needed.            Employee Engagement    : Develop and implement initiatives to enhance employee engagement, satisfaction, and retention. Organize and participate in team-building activities, events, and employee recognition programs. Foster a positive work environment and support a culture of inclusivity and diversity.            Recruitment and Selection    : Collaborate with hiring managers to identify staffing needs and develop effective recruitment strategies. Source, screen, and interview candidates, ensuring a positive candidate experience throughout the hiring process. Coordinate with external recruitment agencies when necessary.            Vendor Management    : Oversee relationships with HR-related vendors, such as benefits providers, background screening agencies, and training consultants. Negotiate contracts, monitor service levels, and ensure compliance with agreed-upon terms.            What you ll bring:          5 to 7 years of proven experience as an HR Generalist or a similar role, preferably in the technology industry.          Strong knowledge of HR best practices, employment laws, and regulations.          Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build relationships at all levels of the organization.          Demonstrated problem-solving and conflict-resolution abilities.          Proficient in HRMS systems, MS Office, and other HR software applications.          Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to handle multiple priorities simultaneously.          High level of integrity and the ability to maintain confidentiality.

column2: An HR Generalist is responsible for executing various human resources (HR) functions within an organization. Key responsibilities include:     Recruiting and staffing: sourcing, screening, and hiring new employees.     Employee relations: addressing and resolving employee concerns, complaints, and conflicts.     Performance management: conducting performance evaluations and providing feedback to employees.     Employee development: creating and implementing employee training programs and career development plans.     Compensation and benefits: administering employee compensation and benefits programs, such as salaries, bonuses, and insurance.     Compliance: ensuring compliance with federal and state employment laws and regulations.     Policy development and administration: creating, updating, and communicating HR policies and procedures.     Employee records management: maintaining accurate and up-to-date employee files and records.     Diversity and inclusion: promoting and fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace culture.     Other HR-related tasks as assigned by management.       Qualifications:       Strong knowledge of federal and state employment laws and regulations.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with employees at all levels of the organization.     Good organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively.     Experience with HR information systems (HRIS) and other HR technology solutions.     Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive employee information.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve HR-related issues.

column1: Jobs In HR In Gurgaon - HR Manager
column2: Brief Role :  Urgent Opening for "HR Manager  Exp. Req. 9 -  11 yrs;   Job Description    PURPOSE    Provide support and guidance to less experienced members of the HR team in their day- to- day operational roles.	 Support the continuous improvement of the HR function through development and implementation of HR programs in	 An assigned geography or business line. With limited guidance,  provide comprehensive HR support to employees and	 Management across assigned service areas,  business units,  or departments. As HR Business Partner,  with guidance, 	 Provide expertise,  support and advice to assigned management teams either locally,  regionally,  globally or by function. RESPONSIBILITIES    Develop strong and effective team relationships with HR specialist functions/ Centers of Excellence,  e.g.,  HRPSC, 	 Finance PSC.	 Maintain and develop local HR policies regarding employment legislation,  HR systems,  practices,  procedures and	 Compliance as required to ensure risk of litigation is mitigated and staff,  company and customer interests are	 Maintained.	 Provide advice and guidance to more junior members of the HR team as appropriate.	 Lead specific projects and support the day- to- day development and implementation of redesign and new local and	 Global HR initiatives.	 Provide HR Partnering management coaching and counseling.	 Act as Business Partner to assigned business areas and ensure that HR delivery adds value to the business.	 Provide input and assist in or lead efforts associated with change management efforts involving reorganizations,  mergers/ acquisitions and transfers to ensure compliance to local legislation.	 - Provide reports and analyses as requested by senior management.	 Support line managers in the recruitment and selection process where appropriate.	 Provide advice and guidance on all aspects related to people management,  absenteeism,  workforce planning, 	 Talent development and management,  etc.	 All responsibilities are essential job functions unless noted as nonessential (N). column2: Recruitment and Staffing: HR Managers/Assistant HR Managers are responsible for managing the organization's recruitment and staffing processes      This involves sourcing and attracting qualified candidates, screening resumes, conducting interviews, and facilitating the selection and onboarding of new employees      Employee Relations: They play a crucial role in promoting positive employee relations within the organization      This includes handling employee grievances, resolving conflicts, and ensuring fair and consistent application of HR policies and procedures      Performance Management: HR Managers/Assistant HR Managers are involved in implementing and managing performance management systems      They work closely with managers and supervisors to set performance goals, conduct performance evaluations, provide feedback, and identify opportunities for employee development and growth      Training and Development: They coordinate and facilitate employee training and development initiatives      This includes identifying training needs, designing and delivering training programs, and evaluating their effectiveness in enhancing employee skills and knowledge      Compensation and Benefits: HR Managers/Assistant HR Managers oversee the administration of compensation and benefits programs      They ensure that the organization's compensation structure is competitive, manage employee benefits, and handle issues related to payroll and benefits administration      HR Policies and Compliance: They develop, implement, and communicate HR policies and procedures to ensure compliance with labor laws, regulations, and company standards      They stay updated on relevant employment laws and regulations and ensure the organization's practices align with them      Employee Engagement: HR Managers/Assistant HR Managers are responsible for fostering a positive work environment and promoting employee engagement      They may organize employee engagement initiatives, surveys, and recognition programs to enhance employee morale and satisfaction      HR Metrics and Reporting: They track and analyze HR metrics and prepare reports on key HR indicators such as employee turnover, recruitment statistics, training effectiveness, and compliance      These reports provide insights to leadership and guide decision-making
column11: Training, Training delivery, Payroll, Compliance, Staffing, Employee engagement, HR policies, HR, Training and Development, Recruitment
