column2: The Employee Engagement Manager,  will work with the Service Teams and the unit HR Directors to create a University-wide engagement strategy. The manager will also work with those responsible for supervisor training to integrate engagement concepts into existing and future supervisor training so that strong supervisors become the primary conduit for increasing engagement. The manager will be responsible for the execution and overall communication as it relates to employee engagement initiatives. The manager will be responsible for developing a survey process and metrics that will enable the Academy to track employee engagement progress at both an institution wide and a local unit level. During the survey cycle the manager will partner with the HR directors and the Service Teams to ensure effective administration of the survey. The manager will serve as a subject matter expert on the survey results. After the survey cycle,  the manager will produce both global and local reports that will help the Academy and individual units track progress and create action that drive positive employee engagement. Key Responsibilities Create a comprehensive and sustainable employee engagement strategy  Work with senior leaders and deans to develop strategies and demonstrable links between engagement and their strategic goals  Work with vendors,  Office of Human Resource partners and college and administrative unit Human Resource partners to design,  deploy,  and evaluate effective and efficient engagement surveys  Conduct employee focus groups to complement engagement surveys  Develop a train the trainer program to enable units to analyze their own data and build action plans  Create and/ or edit tools,  training materials,  and resources to help partners and leaders successfully build action plans based on survey results  Create an effective communication plan and provide content for various communication vehicles  Leverage events to create and sustain dialogue around engagement  Identify and address issues and solutions related to employee engagement  Help University leaders determine links between engagement and outcomes such as; turnover,  healthcare costs,  grievances,  student success  Work with cross-functional teams to identify unique division/ location needs while balancing the overall purpose and requirements of the employee engagement strategy  Manage a professional training and development staff Required Education and Experience  Masters Degree Preferable  Minimum of 2 years in direct human resource work or in a closely related field  Minimum 1 years experience in managing a staff  Demonstrated ability to move forward an agenda or initiative Preferred Experience  Strong experience working in partnership with leaders and colleagues to drive results.  Experience interacting with all levels of management/ staff and across organizational lines.  Experience implementing diverse and high impact HR initiatives to support  Organizational Objectives.  Excellent influencing,  leadership,  communication skills - particularly within matrix style organizations.  Experience presenting to different audiences verbally,  in writing and in presentation formats  Experience working with detailed information and numerical data and presenting it in a way that is easily understood by people at different levels in the organization.  Experience with event management  Identifying opportunities for continuous improvement,  based on feedback,  stakeholder engagement,  trend analysis,  etc.  Experience in change management to improve efficiency and effectiveness
column11: Administration, Change management, Event management, Trend analysis, Employee engagement, Tools, Service, Healthcare, HR, Continuous improvement

column2: An HR Recruiter sources candidates using online channels, updates job ads, filters applications and conducts background checks. The ultimate goal is helping a company build sound employer brand by ensuring that it attracts, hires and retains talented and high-potential candidates.     In order to succeed in this role, you must have a sound knowledge of all sourcing techniques and an extensive experience of conducting various types of interviews, especially group interviews and phone screenings.     So, if you like to work in a fast-paced environment and qualify our requirements, we would like to hear from you.       Responsibilities         Designing and updating job descriptions     Crafting emails for attracting passive candidates     Sourcing potential candidates using various online platforms (e.g. professional forums like LinkedIn, Naukri , ATS etc.)     Screening incoming resumes as well as application forms     Interviewing candidates via various mediums (e.g. in-person, phone, video)     Preparing and distributing assignments as well as language, logical reasoning, and numerical tests     Advertising jobs on careers pages, job boards, and social media     Providing contacts of qualified applicants to the company s Hiring Managers     Sending job offer and recruiting emails, and also answering queries related to compensation and benefits     Monitoring HR metrics (e.g. source of hire, time-to-hire and time-to-fill etc.)     Hosting recruitment events and participating in job fairs     Collaborating with management for identifying future staffing needs     Providing guidance and consultancy to new recruits and also helping them onboard         Requirements         At least a Bachelor s degree in Human Resources Management or a relevant field     Prior experience as an HR Recruiter     Sound knowledge of all HR processes (e.g. recruitment, onboarding, training, talent management etc.)     Sound knowledge of all labor regulations     Experience with resume databases, ATS and referral programs     Sound knowledge of full cycle recruiting     Strong verbal as well as non-verbal communication skills     Exceptional time-management and organizational skills

column2: We are looking for an innovative HR Officer whose primary duty in this role is the facilitation of new hires for the company. This includes screening, recruiting, interviewing, and onboarding new employees. You will also assist with employee relations, performance management, and talent management. Key responsibilities      Updating company databases by inputting new employee contact information and employment details.         Screening potential employees resumes and application forms to identify suitable candidates to fill company job vacancies.         Organizing interviews with shortlisted candidates.         Posting job advertisements to job boards and social media platforms.         Removing job advertisements from job boards and social media platforms once vacancies have been filled.         Assisting the HR staff in gathering market salary information.         Assisting in the planning of company events.         Preparing and sending offer and rejection letters or emails to candidates.         Coordinating new hire orientations.         Responding to staff inquiries regarding HR policies, employee benefits, and other HR-related matters.     Requirements      Bachelor s Degree in Business or associated fields will be preferred.         Effective communication skills     Additional skills      Excellent administrative and organizational skills         Commendable problem-solving skills.

column2: As an Employee Relationship Executive in the Human Resources department, you will play a crucial role in fostering a positive and engaging work environment for our employees      You will be responsible for building strong relationships, addressing employee concerns, and enhancing overall job satisfaction      Your empathetic approach, exceptional communication skills, and problem-solving abilities will contribute to a harmonious workplace and the well-being of our team      Responsibilities:      Employee Engagement:      Develop and execute strategies to enhance employee engagement, morale, and overall job satisfaction.      Plan and coordinate employee recognition programs, events, and initiatives to promote a positive work culture.          Conflict Resolution:      Act as a point of contact for employee grievances, concerns, and conflicts, ensuring timely and effective resolution.      Conduct thorough investigations, interviews, and gather relevant information to address employee issues.          Communication and Counselling:      Maintain open lines of communication with employees, providing a supportive environment for them to voice concerns or seek guidance.      Offer counselling and guidance on various workplace issues, including performance, career development, and work-life balance.          Performance Management:      Collaborate with managers to address employee performance matters, assisting in developing improvement plans when needed.      Monitor performance improvement plans and provide guidance to ensure employee growth and development.          Policy and Compliance:      Ensure employees are aware of company policies, procedures, and code of conduct, and address any non-compliance issues.      Stay updated on relevant labour laws and regulations to ensure adherence to legal requirements.          Exit and Transition Management:      Conduct exit interviews to gather feedback and insights, identifying trends and areas for improvement.      Assist in managing employee transitions, such as resignations, retirements, and internal transfers.          Employee Well-being:      Collaborate with wellness programs to promote a healthy and productive work environment, both physically and mentally.      Identify and address potential stressors or challenges affecting employee well-being.          Data Management and Reporting:      Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of employee interactions, concerns, and resolutions.      Prepare reports and summaries to provide insights into employee relations trends and improvements.          Qualifications:      Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Psychology, or a related field (Masters degree preferred).      Proven experience in employee relations, conflict resolution, or a related HR function.      Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to empathize and build trust.      Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to address complex employee issues.      Knowledge of employment laws and regulations, ensuring compliance and fair treatment.      Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.      Proficiency in HRIS (Human Resources Information System) and Microsoft Office Suite.      Certification in HR or employee relations is a plus.
column11: Career development, Performance management, Data management, HRIS, Labour laws, Analytical, Employee engagement, Wellness, Counselling, Performance improvement

column2: Work with a cross-cultural team to design and execute social media campaigns across Africa and India                        Collaborate with team members across all aspects of campaign design from research, brainstorming, strategy defining, concept development, outcome reviews, and client feedback.                              Provide technical guidance to the AIfluence delivery team on the integration of SBC theories of change and best practices into each project                                Collaborate on the development of internal and external SBCC tools, campaign activities, and materials using evidence-based theories and methodologies.                                  Work closely with AIfluence delivery team to develop, implement, and measure the impact of campaign strategies. Experience applying A/B testing will be critical.                                Participate in thought leadership strategy sessions to identify areas for improvement at all stages of the creator lifecycle.                              Working with other team members, you will analyze and report on each campaign and provide guidance for optimizing campaigns for growth and efficiency.                              Support the review of social media content (videos, images, and other media) to understand campaign execution and guide improvement over time                              Other duties as assigned                                WHO YOU ARE                                You have a desire to create impactful social and behavior change communication campaigns. We are looking to work with someone who has experience in the SBC space, working with digital tools, analysing outcomes,                                                      collaborating with a team, and most importantly, creative problem-solving.                                                            You are organized, have excellent follow-through, and will enjoy building something from the ground up at one of the leading Adtech companies in Africa and India.                                  You can develop a measurement framework to help evaluate potential influencer partnerships and to evaluate the performance of the current influencer portfolio.                                  Have a great understanding of and passion for social media communication.                                  You pay extreme attention to detail with relentlessly high standards and have an innate willingness to roll up your sleeves and get the job done!                                  You will also demonstrate the ability to coordinate with clients, partners and the rest of our organization at a variety of levels and across functions to ensure successful campaigns.                                    This is a remote working position for candidates in the wider Africa region and India and requires the candidate to be a self-starter who can juggle multiple tasks at once, lead projects independently with minimum supervision and work harmoniously with a diverse group of people.                                    Bachelor?s Degree required                                                          At least 5+ years of demonstrated experience in implementing and monitoring social behavior change, communication or marketing activities                                  An understanding of social media metrics, conversion funnels, and the ability to link results                                                      with specific elements of a broader campaign                                                          Exceptional presentation, written and verbal communication skills                                                        Experience designing communication campaigns, especially in the health and development sectors.                                Demonstrable capability of self-direction and motivation ? you will have a lot of freedom to                                                      make decisions, run tests, and drive the team forward.                                                        Ability to deliver under pressure on time-sensitive assignments                                Fluency in French is an added advantage                                Photography/video production and/or experience with the Adobe creative suite is an advantage                                  An attractive remuneration and benefits package will be offered to the successful candidates.
column11: Decision-making, Confidence, Collaboration, Commitment, Communication

column2: As the Human Resources (HR) Coordinator at JKK Natraja group of institution, you will play a vital role in supporting the HR departments activities and ensuring effective management of human resources within the college. You will be responsible for various administrative and operational tasks related to recruitment, employee relations, benefits administration, and HR recordkeeping. Your role will contribute to creating a positive work environment that fosters professional growth and supports the overall mission of the college.                   Responsibilities:             Recruitment and Onboarding:           Assist in the recruitment process by posting job vacancies, screening applications, and coordinating interviews.         Arrange and conduct orientation sessions for new hires to ensure a smooth onboarding experience.         Maintain accurate records of employee information and documentation related to recruitment.           Employee Relations:           Act as a point of contact for employees regarding HR-related queries and concerns.         Assist in resolving employee conflicts and issues through effective communication and mediation.         Foster a positive work culture by promoting teamwork, open communication, and employee engagement initiatives.           HR Policies and Compliance:           Stay updated with employment laws and regulations to ensure HR practices comply with legal requirements.         Assist in developing and updating HR policies and procedures to reflect changes in laws and best practices.         Ensure HR practices are fair, ethical, and aligned with the colleges values and guidelines.           Benefits Administration:           Support benefits enrollment processes and provide employees with information on available benefit programs.         Collaborate with benefits providers and vendors to address employee inquiries and resolve issues.         Assist in organizing and conducting benefits-related workshops or seminars for employees.           HR Recordkeeping:           Maintain accurate and up-to-date HR records, including personnel files and databases.         Ensure confidentiality and security of employee data, adhering to data protection regulations.         Prepare HR reports and metrics as required by the HR department and college management.           Performance Management:           Support performance appraisal processes by coordinating evaluations and ensuring timely completion.         Help employees and supervisors understand the performance management system and provide guidance when needed.           Training and Development:           Assist in coordinating training sessions and workshops to enhance employees skills and knowledge.         Collaborate with internal and external trainers to organize professional development programs.               Qualifications:             Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.         Prior experience in HR, either through internships or entry-level positions, is desirable but not mandatory.         Knowledge of HR best practices, employment laws, and regulations.         Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work with diverse groups of individuals.         Detail-oriented and organized, with excellent time management skills.         Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).         Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information discreetly.
